Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) Index -- DO NOT CHANGE ID CODES

WBS-1: Core Product & Platform (technical implementation, SEO,
messaging, payments, admin, etc.)

WBS-2: City Launch & Go-To-Market (market research, city selection,
launch operations, marketing)

WBS-4: Talent Supply & Role Verticals (Models, Photographers,
Videographers, Content Creators / Influencers)\
\
SubSection 1.1 --- Role System Design

1\) Core Concept: "Linked Service Profiles" under One Account

One account per person (single login, single identity).

Each account can attach one or more "Service Profiles" (SP) --- one per
role:

Model SP

Photographer SP

Videographer SP

Content Creator SP

Each Service Profile is a self-contained, bookable offering with its
own:

Rolespecific fields (e.g., measurements vs. gear list)

Portfolio (images/videos assigned to that role)

Rates/packages & availability

Reviews & rating (per role)

Search index entry and URL

The Account has shared, global elements:

Display name, avatar, city/region, verification badges, background check
badge

Follower/following counts (global)

Unified inbox (roleaware threads)

Unified feed (posts can be tagged to one/more roles)

Favorites boards (can hold userlevel or rolelevel items)

Why: Treating each role as a distinct, bookable "Service Profile" makes
search and booking crystal clear while keeping life simple for multirole
users via one login and shared assets.

2\) URLs & Navigation

User overview: /u/{handle}\
Shows account header + tabs for each Service Profile (e.g., Model \|
Photographer \| Creator), global posts, and "About".

Service Profile canonical pages:

Model: /u/{handle}/model

Photographer: /u/{handle}/photographer

Videographer: /u/{handle}/videographer

Creator: /u/{handle}/creator

Search results always link to the rolespecific page (not the account
overview) to keep context tight.\
Example: From "Model" search, clicking Jane goes to /u/jane/model. From
there, users can switch roles via tabs ("Also offers: Photographer").

3\) Profile UI (What viewers see)

Header (shared)

Name, city, avatar, verification badges, backgroundcheck badge, overall
followers, quick actions (Message, Share, Report).

Role chips: Model \| Photographer \| Videographer \| Creator (active
role highlighted).

Tabs (roleaware, contextual default):

Work (role portfolio) --- grid/lightbox, role tags on media; NSFW gating
if applicable.

About (role fields) --- e.g., for Model: height, measurements,
hair/eyes, categories; for Photographer: specialties, gear, software;
for Creator: platform links, verified follower counts, engagement rate.

Rates & Packages --- hourly/day rates, packaged offers (e.g., "2hr
studio shoot w/ 10 edits").

Availability --- calendar, travel notes, response time.

Reviews --- rolespecific (default to the role you're viewing) with
toggle to view All Roles.

Posts --- profile feed; filter chips to display posts from this role by
default.

Primary CTA (contextual):

On role pages: "Book {Role}" and "Message about {Role}"

On overview: disabled until a role is selected (or show a small role
selector popover).

4\) RoleSpecific Data (Minimum Fields)

Model SP

Height, weight, measurements, dress/shoe size

Hair color, eye color, skin tone/ethnicity (selfascribed)

Categories (fashion, fitness, swim, glam, etc.)

Willingness: TFP/paid only; NSFW allowed? (if policy permits)

Base rates, travel radius/fees

Photographer SP

Specialties (portraits, fashion, boudoir, commercial, events)

Gear (camera bodies, lenses, lighting), studio access

Editing software/turnaround time

License/usage terms defaults (for contracts)

Base rates/packages

Videographer SP

Specialties (reels, music videos, events, product)

Equipment (cameras, gimbals, drones), editing tools

Deliverables (duration, formats), turnaround

Base rates/packages

Content Creator SP

Platforms (IG, TikTok, YT, OF, etc.) with verified follower counts &
computed engagement rate (if integrations enabled)

Niche(s), audience geo %, age/gender splits (if available)

Promo formats offered (grid post, story, reel, live)

Base rates/packages

Notes: All SPs inherit shared basics (bio, location), but require
rolespecific fields to be indexed for search.

5\) Search & Discovery (CategoryFirst)

Search begins by selecting a category (role): Models \| Photographers \|
Videographers \| Creators.

Home search bar has a leading role selector (defaults to last used).

Each role has its own advanced filters (different fields, operators, and
ranges).

Indexing: Each Service Profile is a separate search document.

A multirole user appears once per relevant role (e.g., "Jane --- Model"
and "Jane --- Photographer" are distinct cards).

Result Cards (rolescoped):

Avatar, name, city, role label, role rating (e.g., ★4.9 • 32), starting
rate, key highlights per role (Models: height/measurements; Creators:
followers/engagement; Photographers: specialties), verification badges.

Quick actions: Book, Message, Save to Board.

Subtext: "Also offers: Photographer" (clickable) --- but doesn't pollute
the current role results.

Saved searches & alerts are rolescoped (e.g., "Models in Houston, 5\'8+
fitness, \$\$/hour").

6\) Booking (RoleAnchored)

A booking is always tied to a Service Profile (the role being hired).

Request flow: Date/time, location, brief, deliverables, rate/packages;
optional contract terms (usage rights, model release template).

Calendar integration: One unified availability for the account; bookings
from any role block out time globally to prevent conflicts.

Rescheduling/cancellation apply to the rolebound booking, but time
blocking stays global.

7\) Reviews & Ratings (Clear & Fair)

Only bookers can review. One review per completed booking.

Rolespecific ratings:

Each Service Profile has its own star rating and review list.

On the account header (and in search cards), show perrole ratings if
they exist (e.g., "Model ★4.9 (32) \| Photographer ★4.6 (12)").

Overall rating (optional/secondary): A weighted composite (by \# of
reviews per role). Display lightly on the overview, never used in
rolespecific ranking.

Review visibility: Default to the role you're viewing with a toggle to
see All Roles (clearly labeled).

Why: Keeps feedback relevant to the service hired while still showing
crossrole reputation if desired.

8\) Messaging (Unified Inbox, RoleAware)

One inbox for the user, with smart organization:

Thread type: General Inquiry vs. Booking Thread #ID

Role context tag: e.g., Model, Photographer

Counterparty and project title/date

Status chips: New, Awaiting Reply, Payment Pending, Completed

Read receipts (✓ sent, ✓✓ read) with timestamps.

Filters & folders: By role, by status (Unread, Awaiting response), by
city/date.

Thread merge policy:

Each booking always gets its own thread.

Prebooking inquiries by role are separate threads per role (prevent
confusion).

The inbox shows conversation bundles by counterpart (expand to see
rolespecific threads).

Attachments: Mood boards, references, call sheets.

Safety: Inline tips for firsttime connections; easy report/block.

Incentives (ties to verification; see §12): base monthly newconversation
credits + bonus credits for verified tiers. Bookings and reply threads
do not consume credits.

9\) Portfolio & Tagging (Per Role, Easy to Maintain)

Media Library (account level): upload once, then assign media to one or
more roles (checks).

Role Portfolios: Each SP has Albums (e.g., "Editorial", "Fitness").
Media show role tags and collaborator tags.

Tagging collaborators: Add other users to media with role credit (e.g.,
"@Sam --- Model").

Approval queue for the tagged user; on approve, the media appears in
their Collaboration section (rolespecific).

NSFW controls (if allowed): mark media NSFW; hidden by default unless
viewer opts in.

Maintenance speed: Assigning media to roles is a multiselect action.
Bulk actions to clone albums across roles.

10\) Follows & Favorites (Boards)

Follow (global, simple):

Follow the user account (not per role) to keep counts meaningful.

Feed preferences let a follower choose which roletagged posts they want
to see (All / Model / Photographer / ...).

Favorites ("Boards"):

Save either the role card ("Jane --- Model") or the user ("Jane --- All
Roles").

Boards can mix items but default to roleconsistent when saved from a
role search.

Create projectspecific boards (e.g., "Q2 Lookbook Models") with notes,
tags, and share/collab options (optional future).

Quick actions on cards: Compare, Bulk message, Request availability
(future).

11\) Posts & Feeds (RoleTagged, Unified View)

Users can post updates (text, image, video). Each post must be tagged
with one or more roles.

Profile Posts tab defaults to the role being viewed; toggle to "All
roles".

Global follower feed shows posts from accounts you follow; filter by
role tags.

Post types (examples): Portfolio release, BTS, Availability,
Lookingtocollab (but avoid "job board" styling), Deliverables showcase.

12\) Verification Badges & DM Credits (Incentives)

Badge tiers:

Email verified

Phone/SMS verified (+5 newconversation message credits/month)

ID verified (+10 credits, search boost)

Background checked ("Trusted Pro") (+∞ credits for new conversations,
top search tier)

Display: badges in header & on search cards.

Search boost rules: Verified profiles rank above unverified (within
relevance range). Backgroundchecked get an extra boost.

Rationale: Tangible perks make verification desirable beyond trust (more
DMs, higher visibility), aligning with your incentive idea.

13\) Admin & Safety Controls (RoleAware)

Role completeness gates: a Service Profile must meet a minimal
completeness score (mandatory fields + 6+ portfolio items) to appear in
search.

Moderation by role: media, posts, and reviews are flagged in context of
a role.

Dispute/Report always tied to a booking (and thus to a role), keeping
records clean.

14\) Analytics (User & Internal)

For users (per role and overall):

Views, saves to boards, messages started, booking requests, conversion
rate, avg. response time.

Content performance: portfolio item views, post engagement.

For ops (internal):

Liquidity by city/role, search→inquiry→booking funnel, verification
adoption, dispute rates by role.

15\) Edge Cases & UX Rules

Multirole appearing in one search: Show only the matching role card;
breadcrumb says "Also offers: X" (link to other SP page).

Switching roles on profile: Keep sticky tabs visible; switching tabs
changes CTA & fields seamlessly.

Adding a new role later: Onboarding wizard for that role (fields +
minimal portfolio) before activation.

Calendar conflicts: Booking on any role blocks the account calendar.
Attempting overlapping requests prompts a conflict resolution UI.

Reviews spillover: Do not mix ratings across roles in search ranking.
Display crossrole ratings in the header for transparency only.

16\) MVP vs. PhaseUp (for scope control)

MVP must haves:

Linked Service Profiles; rolefirst search; rolespecific fields &
portfolios; roleanchored bookings; rolespecific reviews; unified inbox
with role tags; basic follows; basic favorites boards; verification +
incentives (email/phone/ID); availability blocking; NSFW gating switch
(policy-dependent).

Phase 2+ enhancements:

Packages catalogs, advanced board collaboration, post analytics, social
metrics verification integrations, audience demographics for creators,
compare view for boards, saved search alerts, deep calendar sync, and
DND windows.

17\) Acceptance Criteria (we can check these off)

From a Model search, multirole users appear only as Model cards with
rolespecific fields.

On reaching a profile from search, the Model tab is active; switching
tabs shows other roles without leaving the page.

Booking, messaging, and reviews are tied to the active role.

The inbox groups threads with role context and shows read receipts.

Users can post once and tag the role(s); feeds and profile posts filter
accordingly.

Favorites boards accept both role cards and full users; boards are
organizable and shareable.

Verification badges grant DM credits and search boost; credits are
visible in a simple meter.

Calendar is global; bookings on any role block time across all roles.

Design Rationale (short)

Rolescoped everything (search, rates, reviews, portfolio) = zero
confusion for buyers.

One account, linked Service Profiles = low maintenance for multirole
users (shared assets, one inbox).

Incentivized verification = safer community + tangible growth perks.

Categoryfirst search = faster decisionmaking + cleaner filters.

Boards & posts = stickiness, collaboration, and social proof without
turning into a job board.

Addendum to §1.1 --- Roles & IA

FanSubscription Creator (OnlyFans/Fansly/etc.) --- Role Definition

New role (toplevel): FanSubscription Creator (icon + label). Appears
alongside Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator in nav and
onboarding.

Age gate & safe mode: The global "18+ results" toggle defaults OFF for
guests/new users. Turning it ON (with age confirmation) reveals
FanSubscription Creators and any profiles with Nudity Tier \> Lingerie.

Portfolio policy: Onplatform nonexplicit content only (artistic nudity
allowed per policy). Explicit sexual content/acts are prohibited. Links
to paid fan platforms are allowed in a dedicated "Links" block.

Deliverables scope: We support SFW collaborations and promo deliverables
(IG/TT/YT/X). We do not facilitate explicit content production or sale.

Acceptance criteria

"FanSubscription Creator" is its own role in the role picker, navbar,
and category landing pages.

Global 18+ toggle (default OFF) gates visibility; explanatory tooltip
clarifies policy.

Profile "Links" block exists; portfolio upload filters block explicit
content.

Addendum --- §1.1 Roles & Entity Model (Studios as Space Listings) ---
FINAL

Goal: Introduce Studios as space listings (not roles) that complement
talent bookings without diluting the core multirole account model. Keep
terminology crisp so search, profiles, reviews, and booking policies
remain coherent.

A\) Entities & Terminology (strictly §1.1 scope)

Account --- one login that can own multiple assets.

Service Profile (Role) --- a person-based offering the account can
operate under:\
Model • Photographer • Videographer • Creator • FanSubscription Creator
(unchanged).

Space Listing (Listing Type) --- a place-based offering the account can
own: Studio.

When verified via the light process in §3.4, it displays the Verified
Studio badge.

Key distinction: Studios are listings, not roles. Service Profiles
represent people; Studio represents a rentable space.

B\) Relationships (what can link to what)

An Account may own 0..N Service Profiles and 0..N Studio listings.

Linking (optional): A Service Profile may link one of the Account's
Studio listings (e.g., a photographer links their cyclorama).

Result: the Service Profile shows a "Owns/Has Studio" chip; the linked
Studio's detail page shows "Hosted by {Profile}".

Independence: Studios can exist without any Service Profile (e.g., host
who only rents space).

C\) Classification & Surfaces

Public categories (highlevel):

People (roles): Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator /
FanSubscription Creator

Places (listings): Studio

Search role selector (later detailed in §4.1/§1.2) includes Studio
alongside People roles.

Profiles vs Listings:

Service Profile page = person's offering + booking widget.

Studio Listing page = space details + hourly booking widget.\
(UX/page map specifics belong to §4.0/§4.1; this addendum only defines
the entities.)

D\) Reviews, Reputation & Policies (alignment only)

Reviews & scores are typescoped:

Service Profiles accrue rolespecific reviews.

Studios accrue spacespecific reviews.

Reputation Score is computed separately for Service Profiles vs Studios
(consumed by ranking later).

Policies: Talent bookings follow talent matrices; Studio bookings follow
studio matrices (per §3.9/Studio addendum). (This addendum only records
that they are distinct.)

E\) Verification & Gating (entitylevel)

Service Profiles: ID → Instant Book; Background → Trusted Pro
(unchanged).

Studios: Studio Lite verification (address/doc check) → Verified Studio
badge; Instant Book may require verification (policy in §3.4).

Safe Mode: applies to people profiles with 18+ settings; Studios are not
gated by Safe Mode.

F\) Data Model (nontechnical description)

ServiceProfile: role_type, role_fields (varies by role),
verification_status (ID, BG), reputation metrics.

StudioListing: listing_type=studio, studio_fields (address neighborhood,
capacity, amenities), verification_status (unverified \| lite_verified),
reputation metrics.

Link: optional association from ServiceProfile → StudioListing for
"owns/has studio" chip.

Booking: distinct booking objects for Service vs Studio; can be Linked
at checkout (see §1.3/§4.0 later).

G\) Acceptance Criteria (to mark §1.1 addendum FINAL)

Studios defined as Space Listings, distinct from Service Profiles
(roles).

Account may own multiple Service Profiles and Studio listings.

Linking from a Service Profile to an owned Studio is supported (for
crosssurfacing chips only; no coupling of reviews).

Review/Rep separation: Service reviews remain rolescoped; Studio reviews
are spacescoped.

Verification: Studio uses Studio Lite → Verified Studio badge; Service
verification unchanged.

Policy separation acknowledged: talent vs studio matrices handled in
their own sections.

H\) Why this works

Clarity: People (roles) vs Places (studios) eliminates ambiguity in
search, reviews, and policies.

Scalability: One account can grow horizontally (new roles) and
vertically (add studio listings) without schema contortions.

Low coupling: Linking is optional and displayonly, preserving clean
ownership and independent

SubSection 1.2 --- RoleSpecific Data & Advanced Search

1\) Design Goal

Make search pinpoint and commercially relevant (not gear-nerdy), so a
buyer can quickly find the exact look, reach, budget fit, availability,
and reliability they need---then book in a few clicks.

2\) Global Search UX (CategoryFirst)

Step 1 (Required): User selects a Role to search: Models / Photographers
/ Videographers / Creators.

Step 2: Search bar accepts keywords; Advanced Filters change per role.

Result Card = Service Profile (rolescoped): name, city, role label, role
rating, starting rate, 2--3 rolespecific highlights, verification
badges, followers/engagement (if connected), and Instant Book badge (if
enabled).

Clickthrough: Goes to the role page (e.g., /u/jane/model) with sticky
tabs to view Jane's other roles.

3\) Global Filters (apply to every role)

Location & distance radius

Available on (date/time picker) → "Only show profiles available on this
date"

Budget / starting rate (range)

Rating (min stars) & \# of reviews (min)

Verification (ID / Backgroundchecked / Socialverified)

Response time (e.g., "usually replies within 2h")

Completion / cancellation rate (reliability)

Instant Book toggle (see §7)

Languages; Travel willing (local only / regional / national)

Last active (e.g., last 7 days)

These are the "what buyers care about" filters---availability, price,
quality, trust, reliability, and speed.

4\) RoleSpecific Filters (what truly matters)

4.1 Models

Look & presence (high impact):

Height, measurements (bust/chest, waist, hips; cup optional),
dress/clothing, shoe

Body type, tattoos, piercings, hair (color/length), eye color, skin
tone, facial hair (if applicable)

Age (18+ only platform), ethnicity (selfdescribed)

Categories/levels (fashion, beauty, fitness, swim, lingerie, artistic
nude if allowed---see §9)

Commercial/operational:

Rate (hour/day), travel radius & travel fee, chaperone friendly, release
preference (e.g., standard model release)

Reliability signals: noshow rate, ontime rate, average reply time

Social signals (if connected): platform(s), followers range, engagement
rate, audience top geos, growth rate 30d (see §5)

Competitors already filter basics like hair/height/measurements; we add
reliability, availability, and audience quality---which they lack.

4.2 Photographers

Focus on result buyers see, not gear:

Specialties (portrait, fashion/editorial, beauty, commercial, product,
events)

Style descriptors (natural light, moody, highkey, cinematic, colortrue,
retouchedlook)

Deliverables (e.g., "# edited images", RAW available?, lookbook,
campaign, ecomm sets)

Turnaround (e.g., 48h, 1 week)

Studio access (yes/no), preferred shoot types (instudio, outdoor),
chaperone welcome

Rate (hour/day/packages)

Reliability (completion rate, ontime rate), rating

Social signals (if connected): followers, engagement, recent growth

We remove gear/software filters; nonphotographer buyers don't care. We
foreground style, deliverables, turnaround, studio access, price,
reliability.

4.3 Videographers

Content types (shortform reels, promo, music video, event, interview,
product)

Deliverables (duration formats, aspect---vertical/horizontal), \# of
revisions, sound capture (yes/no), captions (yes/no)

Turnaround, rate, travel

Style (snappy/reels, cinematic, docu, productclean)

Reliability, rating

Social signals (followers, avg views---if connected)

4.4 Content Creators / Influencers

Platforms (IG/TikTok/YouTube/...); posting frequency

Followers range, engagement rate, avg video views, story views (if
available)

Audience demographics (top countries/cities, age/gender splits) & brand
safety tag

Niches (beauty, fitness, cosplay, gaming, fashion, etc.)

Deliverables & rates (grid post, story set, reel/short, live, bundle),
lead time

Growth rate 30/90d, prior brand collabs

Reliability (ontime posting rate), rating

Verified social metrics & audience demographics are available via
firstparty APIs when the creator connects their accounts (details §5).
TikTok Creator Marketplace & IG Graph API support verified metrics for
optedin professional accounts; YouTube API provides channel stats.

5\) Social Metrics: Live, Verified & Searchable

What's possible (2025):

Instagram (Graph API): For Creator/Business accounts that connect, we
can fetch followers_count, media stats, and some insights; Business
Discovery lets you query other professional accounts' public metrics
within policy. (Regular personal accounts are limited.)

YouTube Data/Analytics APIs: Provide subscriber counts, view counts,
watch time & more for connected channels.

TikTok: Via Login/Display API we can show connected profile/video info;
richer audience/engagement demographics are available through Creator
Marketplace / Business integrations for optedin creators/partners.

OnlyFans: No official public API; thirdparty wrappers rely on
reverseengineering and are not official or guaranteed. So we should not
promise live OF metrics; we can let creators link OF and selfdisclose
stats, optionally verified manually.

Product approach:

"Connect Socials" module for any role. If connected, we show a Verified
Social badge + live counts on profile & enable search filters
(followers/engagement/growth/audience geos) for those users.

Privacy & consent: Only metrics the user consents to share are displayed
and indexed.

Fallback when not connected: userentered stats (clearly marked
Unverified; not searchable by metrics).

Data freshness: sync nightly; fast ondemand refresh button with
ratelimits.

6\) Packages & Extras (Fiverrstyle) --- Required on every Service
Profile

Each role supports:

Packages (Basic / Standard / Premium) with deliverables, turnaround,
revision count, and price.

Extras (addons): examples by role

Models: "Wardrobe change packs", "Travel to location (miles)", "Social
shoutout addon", "Rush booking"

Photographers: "Extra edited images", "Rush delivery", "RAWs", "Studio
included", "MUA coordination"

Videographers: "Extra revisions", "Captions/subtitles", "Vertical
cutdowns", "Thumbnail package"

Creators: "Extra story frames", "Link in bio (X days)", "Pin post (X
days)", "Crosspost to TikTok"

Usage/licensing tiers (Commercial / Paid Ads / Exclusive / Buyout) with
clear pricing.

Instant Book allowed when provider sets autorules (e.g., package X,
availability, radius).

This removes TFP ambiguity and makes booking pure ecommerce: see options
→ add extras → pay → schedule.

7\) Fixing the "Manual Networking" Problem (for low and highfollower
users)

A. Instant Book + Smart Availability

Talent can optin to Instant Book by defining guardrails (packages,
calendar windows, location radius). Search filter "Instant Book" shows
readytobook now talent.

Smart availability filter: pick date/time → show only available Service
Profiles.

B. Smart Invites (private, not a job board)

A buyer can select up to N profiles and send a single, personalized
booking invite that reaches each privately (no public listing).

Autoaccept rules (for busy/highfollower talent): "autoaccept if: package
≥ \$X, travel ≤ Y, brand safe, date in my windows."

C. Concierge (Pro)

For VIPs and brands: a paid Concierge that assembles shortlists, handles
invites, negotiates packages/extras, and schedules. Revenue:
subscription or perengagement fee.

D. Collab Mode (for highhigh, noncash)

Zerocash collaboration contracts with deliverables (shoot + crossposting
obligations). Both sides sign; platform tracks performance (proofofpost,
content delivered).

We monetize via Pro plan features, not commission, and still accrue
reviews + reliability metrics.

E. AudienceFit Match

For creators/models: filter/score by audience geos and engagement (e.g.,
"US female 18--24 heavy") so buyers pay for reach that matters.

Existing platforms make you post castings or DM endlessly; Swipecast
leans into job posts with live chat. We avoid public job boards and keep
1to1 booking, plus powerful smart invites and autoaccept to remove the
manual grind.

8\) Boards (Favorites) for Real Projects

Save role cards into project boards, add notes (budget, fit, priority).

Bulk actions: Invite all, Request availability, Compare (rates, social
reach, reliability).

Share board as private link to collaborators (internal/agency use).

9\) NSFW & OnlyFans Policy --- Decision Framework & Recommendation

Reality: payment processors (Stripe/PayPal) restrict adult content;
explicit sexual content risks account shutdowns.

Options

Mainstreamfirst (Recommended)

Allow SFW + artistic nudity (nonexplicit) with NSFW gating and age/ID
verification; disallow explicit sexual content onplatform.

Allow OnlyFans creators as users; portfolios must follow our content
rules. They can link to OF externally; we don't ingest OF metrics (no
official API).

Use mainstream processors (easier scaling & brandsafe).

Adultfriendly lane (complex)

Permit explicit content in a segregated, agegated area; requires
adultfriendly payment processors and heavy compliance (age checks,
recordkeeping). High ops/compliance cost; potential ad restrictions.

Recommendation: Option 1 for launch. Capture the boudoir/glamour
business and OF creators (as creators) without explicit content on the
site. Revisit a dedicated adult lane only after strong traction and
compliance capability.

10\) SingleCompose Feed (No Double Posting), Smart Delivery

User posts once, tags one or more roles (Model/Photog/etc.).

Delivery:

Followers choose role preferences when following a user; the feed shows
posts matching their interests first.

Dedupe: if a post is multitagged, we only show it once to the follower.

Profile Posts tab defaults to the role you're viewing; toggle "All
roles".

Templates: Availability update, Portfolio drop, BTS, Looking to collab
(private invite CTA, not public job).

Optional: crosspost to connected socials (later).

This keeps posting simple for multirole users while giving followers
clean, relevant feeds.

11\) Extra Verifications (low cost, high trust)

Baseline (free): email + phone/SMS; 2FA optional.

ID & Age (paid): document + selfie liveness via IDV provider (e.g.,
Persona/Onfido). Typical SMB pricing starts around \$250/mo platform
minimums or percheck fees; we can pass costs to users wanting the badge.

Background Check (paid, optional "Trusted Pro"): US checks via vendor
(e.g., Checkr packages \~\$30--\$90/report). We pass through + small
margin; renewal annually.

SocialVerified (free): connect IG/TikTok/YT for verified metrics badge
(see §5).

PaymentVerified (free): valid card/bank on file.

StudioVerified (optional): onetime address + utility/biz doc for studio
listings.

ReferenceVerified (free): after N completed bookings with \>4★ average,
earn "Great Partner" ribbon (automated).

Incentives: Each badge improves search boost and DM credits (as we set
in §1.1), so verification increases bookings and offsets its cost.

12\) Pricing Impact of Verifications

We do not absorb expensive checks at scale; instead:

Passthrough direct costs (IDV/background) with small margin.

Bundle into Pro subscription (includes 1 ID check + search boost +
analytics Pro).

Net effect: verifications pay for themselves via higher ranking, more
DMs, Instant Book eligibility, and higher conversion. (We'll track
uplift in Analytics, §13.)

13\) ProviderSide Analytics (RightSized)

Core (free)

Views → Messages → Bookings funnel (per role)

Search queries & top filters that surfaced you (e.g., "5′8″+ fitness
models in Houston")

Avg position in search for your key filters (est.)

Package performance (acceptance, upsell to extras)

Reliability metrics (response time, cancellation rate)

Social snippet if connected: followers, engagement trend (30d)

Pro (paid)

Audience analytics (for creators): geo/age/gender summaries from APIs

Benchmarking: your rates/turnaround vs. local peers (by role & rating)

Price optimizer suggestions (raise/drop by X% based on conversion)

Boarding intelligence: who saved you to boards; abandoned invite
recovery prompts

SubSection 1.3 --- Booking, Payments & Disputes

Purpose: Make booking as fast and trustable as Airbnb/Fiverr: clear
options, instant or nearinstant confirmation, escrowed payment,
transparent cancellation rules, and a fair dispute process --- all
optimized for repeatable revenue and low support overhead.

A\) Key Concepts & Objects

Service Profile (SP): The bookable unit for a role (Model / Photographer
/ Videographer / Creator). All bookings are tied to a specific SP.

Package: A preconfigured offer (deliverables, duration, turnaround,
revisions, price). Each SP must have ≥1 package or a base hourly/day
rate.

Extras (optional): Addons the buyer can select at checkout (rush, extra
edits, travel miles, etc.). Not required to publish.

Usage License: A selectable tier (Commercial / Ads / Exclusive / Buyout)
with clear terms & price adders.

Instant Book: Book without messaging if the request matches the SP's
autorules.

Smart Invite: Private multirecipient invite (no public job board) that
lets the buyer send one request to N profiles and award 1 or more slots.

Autoaccept Rules (optin): Talent-defined conditions that autoaccept
requests (e.g., package ≥ \$X, weekday window, \<=10 miles).

B\) Booking Modes (How a booking starts)

Instant Book (optin by talent)

Visible "Instant Book" badge in search.

Buyer selects date/time, package, extras, license, location, pays →
booking confirmed immediately if within rules.

Calendar blocked; chat thread opens automatically.

RequesttoBook

Buyer configures the same elements; sends a request.

Talent can Accept / Decline / Counter (send Custom Offer with different
package/price/time).

On Accept, payment is captured and booking confirmed.

SLA nudges: autoexpire unanswered requests (e.g., 48h) to keep the
funnel clean.

Smart Invite (private)

Buyer selects up to N profiles → writes one brief (date/time,
package/budget).

Each recipient receives a private invite; buyer can award one or
multiple hires.

Reduces backandforth while avoiding a public job board.

C\) Checkout & Payment Flow (Buyer experience)

Select Offer: Choose package or base rate duration; pick extras and
license tier.

Pick Date/Time: Required; availability filter helps show open slots.

Location: Address or "studio provided by talent" if applicable; travel
fee dynamically calculated if the SP adds permile pricing.

Contract Pack (autoattached):

Booking Agreement (scope, deliverables, schedule, payment terms,
cancellation, safety rules).

Usage License (for photographer/videographer deliverables; simple,
prepriced tiers).

Model Release (autoattached if booking a model).

Content Promotion Terms (for Creators: posting timeline, tag/credit
rules).

Parties esign at checkout; all docs stored with the booking.

Summary & Fees: Subtotal, platform fees (see §E), taxes (if any), and
escrow notice.

Pay & Confirm: Card or bank method; funds moved to escrow; confirmation
screen and email. Calendar blocks for both parties; chat opens.

Tip: Show a small "What you get" panel (deliverables, revisions,
turnaround, license) and a separate "What's not included" to reduce
postshoot disputes.

D\) Escrow, Release, and Payouts (Money movement)

Escrow on Accept/Book: Buyer is charged; funds held in custodial escrow.

Completion signal:

Timebased jobs (e.g., hiring a model): Provider taps "Completed" after
session; client has 24--48h to confirm or raise a dispute.

Deliverablebased jobs (e.g., photo/video/creator posts): Provider marks
individual milestones (Shoot done → Proofs delivered → Finals delivered)
or single "Delivered" if simple. Client has review window per milestone.

Autorelease: If no dispute is opened by the end of the window, payout is
autoreleased.

Payout timing:

Standard: Release 48h after completion confirmation (or window expiry).

New provider risk policy: First X payouts delayed up to 7 days or
reserve % held to reduce chargeback/fraud risk; relax as reputation
builds.

Payout methods: Bank transfer (ACH) primary; backup options (PayPal,
etc.).

Tips: After completion (or milestone), buyer can add a tip (0% platform
fee on tips to encourage generosity).

E\) Fee & Pricing Strategy (Revenue model)

Goal: be simpler and fairer than legacy directories, with enough margin
to fund verification, support, and growth.

Recommended baseline (US launch):

Provider fee (commission): 12% of booking subtotal.

Buyer service fee: 5% (min \$2).

Processing costs: Covered within these fees (we keep the math simple for
users).

Elastic incentives (drive behaviors we want):

Instant Book discount: Provider fee -- 1% on Instant Book transactions
(promotes "buy now").

Verified boosts: Backgroundchecked providers get --0.5% fee and ranking
boost (ties to Trust incentives).

Highvalue tiering: For any single booking subtotal \> \$1,000, provider
fee on the portion above that drops to 10%.

Alternatives to test (A/B later):

15% provider, 0% buyer (simpler, common in marketplaces).

8% provider, 7% buyer (shifts load to buyer; sometimes better acceptance
with pros).

We'll start with the baseline, track conversion and sentiment, and
optimize. Promotions (e.g., zero buyer fee for first booking) can
accelerate adoption.

F\) Changes, Overtime & OnSet Additions

Overtime: In booking thread, either party can propose overtime in
30/60min increments at a preset rate; both tap to confirm; card is
incrementally charged; calendar extended.

Extras after checkout: Provider can offer postcheckout extras (e.g.,
"+10 edits") as onetap upsells; buyer approves & pays.

Travel/expenses: Preapproved extras (travel miles, parking, studio
rental). For adhoc expenses: upload receipt → buyer approves (or
dispute) → charge processed.

G\) Rescheduling & Cancellations (Policies)

Providers choose one of three policy templates per SP (or per package).
Buyers see the policy before paying.

Noshows & late arrivals (defaults):

Noshow (buyer): 0% refund; provider may still be reviewed.

Noshow (provider): 100% refund + strike; buyer may review; provider
flagged for support review.

Grace: 15minute grace window; beyond that, time may be deducted or
counted as noshow per policy.

Safety & force majeure exceptions:

Harassment, unsafe location, severe illness, natural events → Support
can override to full/partial refund; strikes applied accordingly. A
"safety cancel" reason shields public review text (but logs internally).

Reschedule flow:

Either party proposes a new time; if accepted, booking updates.

If not accepted within policy windows, original cancellation terms
apply.

H\) Disputes (Fair, timeboxed, evidencedriven)

When: Buyer or provider can open a dispute before payout (or within X
hours after if autoreleased; we'll keep this window short).

What we collect (inthread):

Timeline: checkin/out times, chat logs, shared files, signed contracts,
location pin (if enabled).

Evidence uploads: screenshots, deliverables, RAW proof (when relevant).

Resolution paths:

Noshow / not as described / deliverables missing:

Timebased jobs: prorated or full refund depending on attendance.

Deliverablebased: partial refund based on % of agreed deliverables; or
full refund if nothing delivered.

Partial performance: Mediation suggests partial settlement (we generate
a proposed split both can accept).

Bad faith / repeated issues: Strikes, suspension, or removal (internal
policy).

Outcome handling:

If settlement agreed → escrow splits accordingly.

If not → platform decides per policy & evidence; decision is final (per
ToS).

Chargebacks: We retain evidence packets to contest with processor;
repeat chargebackers flagged.

I\) Contracts & Releases (Builtin)

Autoattach the right forms based on roles & selected license:

Booking Agreement (scope, payment, cancellation, IP).

Model Release (for shoots with a model).

Usage License (creator → buyer; tiered).

Promotion Terms (for creators: posting dates, tags).

Esign at checkout (both parties).

Perbooking vault: Timestamped PDFs accessible to both; immutable log.

Templates: We provide clear, plainlanguage templates; providers can
upload a Custom Addendum (subject to platform review).

J\) AntiCircumvention & Safety

Onplatform payments are required. Messaging attempts to share external
payment details trigger gentle warnings and, if repeated, temporary
messaging limits.

Why it's better here: payment protection (escrow), cancellation
coverage, dispute support, verified reviews, DM credit incentives.

Emergency tools: Inthread "Safety flag" → prioritizes to Support;
optional checkin toggle that marks arrival/departure time & general area
(not visible publicly).

K\) Taxes & Compliance (US launch)

We facilitate payments between buyer and provider and will follow
applicable tax reporting obligations as a marketplace facilitator (exact
thresholds can change; we'll align with the processor's reporting
workflow).

Sales tax: Most creative services are servicebased; taxability varies by
jurisdiction. The platform will support tax toggles per state/city and
adjust at checkout when applicable.

Yearend docs: Providers get a yeartodate earnings report and any
required tax forms via the payout provider dashboard.

We avoid giving tax advice; we provide the records and surface
processorlevel reporting where applicable.

L\) Notifications & Calendar

Email/push for: requests, invites, accept/decline, payment received,
reminder (24h/2h before), reschedule, dispute events, payout sent.

Calendar: 2way sync (readonly in MVP; writeback in Phase 2). ICS file in
confirmation email.

M\) Provider & Buyer Dashboards

Provider (per role + overall):

Next bookings; outstanding requests; required actions (confirm, deliver,
message).

Earnings (pending, available, lifetime), payouts history.

Policy & pricing quick edit; Instant Book toggles; Autoaccept rules.

Disputes center: upload evidence, view status.

Buyer:

Upcoming shoots; requests & invites; Reschedule/Cancel; Add extras;
Leave review; Receipts and invoices.

N\) Analytics Touchpoints (tiein to §1.2)

Booking funnel: Profile views → addtocart → request/IB → confirmed →
completed (per role).

Cancellation & dispute rates (per policy, per package).

Revenue by package/extras/license (help providers tune offers).

Time to accept / response time (feeds search filters).

Promo impact: Track fee discounts vs. conversion and LTV.

O\) Acceptance Criteria (for engineering & QA)

Three booking modes fully functional (Instant Book, RequesttoBook, Smart
Invite), all roleanchored.

Escrow holds funds on accept/book; autorelease on completion with
dispute window.

Overtime and postcheckout extras can be added and charged midthread with
bothparty confirmation.

Cancellation policies selectable per SP (or package) and enforced with
prorated and exception handling.

Dispute center collects evidence, supports partial refunds, and logs
final decision.

Contracts & releases autoattached and esigned at checkout; PDFs stored
with booking.

Fees applied per model (12% provider, 5% buyer) with Instant Book and
verification adjustments.

Payouts: standard delay 48h; newprovider reserve/delay policy enforced.

Notifications & calendar work endtoend (email + inapp; ICS export).

Dashboards show accurate states and histories for both sides.

P\) Rationale (why this will convert)

Fewer steps + Instant Book = more completed bookings.

Packages + optional extras clarify scope and upsell without complexity.

Escrow + clear policies reduce buyer fear and provider noshow risk.

Disputes with evidence keep support load manageable and outcomes
predictable.

Fee incentives nudge the behavior we want (Instant Book, verification)
while keeping takerate competitive.

Contracts bakedin prevent most misunderstandings that plague legacy
platforms.

Addendum to §1.3 --- Travel & Distance Pricing & Logistics (FINAL)

1\) Product goals

Make travel predictable and fair for both sides.

Prevent accidental longdistance bookings.

Keep Instant Book clean (no surprise costs).

Support true longhaul bookings with clear rules (day rates, lodging,
perdiem) without overcomplicating MVP.

2\) Talent travel policy (per Service Profile)

Each SP (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator) sets:

A. Base location

Home city + map pin (hidden publicly; we show city/ZIPlevel to users).

B. Included radius

e.g., 15 mi included (no travel fee). Buyer search defaults to
radiusfiltered results.

C. Travel pricing model (choose one)

Permile beyond included radius (e.g., \$0.75/mi roundtrip, cap
optional), or

Pertime travel rate (e.g., \$30/hr drive time), or

Zones (simple flat fees):

Local (≤ included radius): \$0

Regional (e.g., 16--75 mi): flat \$X

Outofarea (e.g., 76--150 mi): flat \$Y

Longhaul (\>150 mi): Requestonly (no Instant Book), requires custom
quote (flight/train/hotel likely).

D. Longhaul rules (toggle per SP)

Travelday rate (if a day is lost to transit).

Lodging required (Yes/No; minimum star rating optional).

Perdiem (meal allowance) or "expenses at cost with receipts."

Flight class policy (e.g., economy basic/economy).

These appear automatically when the distance exceeds the SP's Longhaul
threshold.

E. Instant Book guardrails

Maximum travel distance/time eligible for Instant Book (e.g., ≤25 mi or
≤45 mins driving).

Anything beyond becomes RequesttoBook (forces a conversation/quote).

F. Touring calendar (optional)

Talent can publish "On tour" dates (e.g., "In Dallas Nov 12--13").

On those dates, search treats them as local to that city (travel fees
suppressed/adjusted).

3\) Buyer search & guardrails

Default search radius (e.g., 25 mi) with a conspicuous "Expand radius"
toggle.

Results beyond the SP's Instant Book limit display "Travel
required---Request to Book."

"Visiting talent" toggle shows users who've set touring dates in the
buyer's city/date.

If a buyer selects a date/location first, we prefilter to available &
traveleligible profiles only.

4\) Travel fee calculation (checkout)

We estimate distance/time using a mapping service (e.g., Distance Matrix
API) based on talent's base location and the buyer's shoot location,
then apply the SP's chosen model (Permile/Pertime/Zones).

Line items at checkout:

Package price

Travel fee (breakdown: miles/time/zones)

Extras (if any)

License tier (if any)

Platform fee(s), tax (where applicable)

For longhaul: Instant Book disabled; buyer sees "Travel quote required."
The request flow collects flight/hotel expectations and/or "expenses at
cost" consent.

Dallas ↔ Houston example (longhaul):

If distance exceeds SP's Longhaul threshold (e.g., 150 mi), checkout
switches to RequesttoBook. The SP's longhaul rules (travel day, lodging,
perdiem) appear automatically so both sides know the terms before money
is held.

5\) Dayof transportation (local rides)

We considered offering buyers the option to prepay a rideshare for
talent. Here's the practical approach:

MVP recommendation:

Do not directly book rides inside our app. Instead, let buyers:

Cover travel via the Travel fee (fixed & predictable), or

Offer a "Local ride credit" addon (flat \$ amount) that the talent can
use as they wish.

Why not deep rideshare integration for MVP?

Uber's consumer Ride Request widget is deprecated; today they recommend
deep links to m.uber.com/app rather than thirdparty apps creating rides
endtoend.

Uber for Business and Vouchers API (and Lyft Concierge API) exist, but
they're designed for enterprise programs (credits/vouchers/guest rides),
which adds account setup, policy, reconciliation, and support overhead
we don't need at launch.

Phase2 option (if demand is strong):

Add an "Attach rides voucher" flow for enterprise buyers using Uber for
Business Vouchers or Lyft Concierge, where the buyer funds a capped ride
credit tied to the booking. We'd still keep our Travel fee logic for
nonvoucher cases.

6\) Preventing bad bookings

Hard stops: If distance \> SP's Max travel allowed, booking cannot
proceed (UI explains "Out of travel range; request a remote option or
choose visiting dates").

Soft stops: If distance triggers longhaul, we force RequesttoBook and
surface the SP's travel rules.

Calendar conflicts: Long travel times also block adjacent slots (buffer)
to avoid doublebooking.

7\) Payments & escrow for travel

Travel fees are part of the escrow amount and follow the same
cancellation/dispute policy as the job (unless flagged as nonrefundable
expenses after tickets/hotels are purchased with buyer approval).

For expenses at cost workflows (flight/hotel receipts): provider uploads
receipts → buyer approves → platform charges card and adds to escrow or
settles as a postcheckout extra.

8\) UI copy (concise and proactive)

Search chips: "Local (≤ 25 mi)", "Include traveling talent".

Result badges: "Travel required---Request to Book", "Visiting your city
on \[dates\]".

Checkout: "Travel fee calculated from distance/time using talent's
policy," (ⓘ) tooltip with formula.

Longhaul panel: "This booking requires travel arrangements
(flight/hotel/perdiem). Send a request to confirm details."

9\) Acceptance criteria (travel)

SPs can configure Included radius, Travel pricing model, Longhaul
threshold/rules, and Instant Book limits.

Search respects radius by default and clearly marks travelrequired
results.

Checkout computes travel fee via distance/time API and shows a
transparent line item.

Longhaul disables Instant Book, requires RequesttoBook, and surfaces
travel rules.

"Local ride credit" addon supported; no rideshare booking in MVP.

(Phase2) Can attach Uber/Lyft vouchers for enterprise buyers.

Addendum to §1.3 --- Contracts, Releases & Paperwork (Templates,
Requirements, Signatures) --- FINAL

Goal: Make paperwork automatic, standardized, and enforceable---so
deliverables, rights, and usage are crystal clear without forcing every
user to lawyer up.

A\) Smart Docs Engine (builtin, templatefirst)

Autoattach at booking: Based on roles in the booking, the platform
attaches a default pack of documents (below) prefilled with names,
dates, location, deliverables, fees, and licensing.

Esign builtin: Simple, legally binding esign (draw/type) with audit
trail (IP, timestamp, device).

Bringyourown: Providers/brands may upload custom addenda (PDF/DOCX) to
sign in the same flow.

Jurisdiction & minors: City/state choice adjusts venue law; minor flag
adds guardian consent + stricter photo policy.

B\) Minimum Document Set (autoselected)

Service Agreement / SOW (always): scope, timeline, payment schedule,
revisions, cancellation, dispute venue.

License/Usage Addendum (if media usage): media types, geos, durations,
paid vs organic, exclusivity options, optional workforhire clause.

Model Release (if any model present): publicity rights grant; adult vs
minor variants; explicit nopornography covenant.

Property/Studio Release (if private or providerowned space): permission
to shoot, house rules, damages.

NDA (optional toggle from buyer): mutual or oneway.

Safety Addendum (if Nudity Tier \> Lingerie): attire/coverage, chaperone
policy, changing/privacy, closed set, onsite contact.

Defaults are editable by parties before signing; diffs logged.

C\) When Are Docs Required?

Before checkin. All required docs must be esigned by both parties before
"Start" can be tapped in the app.

Brief stage: Buyers see the default pack preview on the brief; providers
see it when quoting.

No "paperless" bookings where releases are expected (e.g., shoots with
models).

D\) Enforceability Hooks

Escrow gating: Funds won't release until required docs are signed and
deliverables accepted.

Deliverables manifest references the SOW + License; disputes use these
as source of truth.

Audit trail: Signed PDFs with hash, IP/device/timestamps downloadable by
both parties.

E\) Special Cases

TFP/Collab mode: SOW + noncommercial license by default; optional
upgrade to commercial later (with price).

Fansubscription creators: Adds Posting & Attribution Addendum (see §3.5
addendum) detailing deadlines and minimum live duration; autoverify
posts via OAuth/URL.

Minors: Guardian esign required; extra safety terms; no nudity tiers
available.

Union/agency talent: Upload agency rider; overrides conflicting defaults
where allowed.

F\) Templates & Ownership

Platform maintains jurisdictionaware templates reviewed by counsel
(disclaimer: not legal advice).

Users retain rights per the signed License/Usage Addendum; platform is
not a party beyond payment terms and dispute venue.

G\) Acceptance Criteria

Smart Docs attach automatically by role; users can edit before sign.

Esign with audit trail; PDFs stored & versioned; available in booking
thread.

Checkin blocked until required docs are signed; escrow release blocked
without docs + acceptance.

Minor/guardian flows, safety addendum for nudity tiers, property/studio
release when applicable.

Addendum --- §1.3 Booking, Payments & Disputes (Studios integration)

Goal: Integrate Studios (space listings) into booking & payments without
complicating talent flows. Keep talent and studio as separate bookings
that can be purchased together in one checkout as a Linked Booking
Group. Preserve clear rules, escrow, deposit holds, and dispute outcomes
per type.

A\) Booking Objects & Linked Group

Two booking types:

Talent Booking (person-based: Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator).

Studio Booking (space-based: hourly rental with rules).

Linked Booking Group (LBG): if a buyer checks out with both a talent and
a studio, we create two bookings tied under one group ID.

Independent policies & payouts per booking; the UI shows a group
summary.

Time sync: studio start/end must align to the talent schedule
(respecting min hours & buffers).

B\) Studio Checkout (what the buyer confirms)

Pricing line items: base \$/hr × booked hours + min hours enforcement +
cleaning fee (if any) + estimated taxes (if applicable) + deposit hold
(authorization, not captured).

Rules & access: house rules, max capacity, noise policy, overtime
policy, loadin/out, door/access code (released after confirmation),
parking notes.

Smart Docs (autoattach): Property/Space Release + House Rules (sign
before checkin).

Address privacy: public page shows neighborhood; exact address and
access details reveal only after confirmation.

C\) Instant Book vs Request to Book (studios)

Default: Instant Book ON (host may toggle "Approval required").

Instant Book guardrails: Instant Book requires Studio Lite verification
or host ID verification (policy toggle).

Conflicts: if the studio is IB but the linked talent is requestbased,
the LBG holds the studio slot for X minutes while talent accepts.

D\) Funds Flow: Escrow & Authorizations

Talent booking: escrow per existing §1.3 rules.

Studio booking: escrow the studio rental amount at checkout.

Damage deposit: place a card hold (configurable per listing, e.g.,
\$200--\$1,000). Not counted in GMV; expires or is partially/fully
captured only upon a verified claim.

Cleaning fee: charged as part of studio subtotal (refundable only if
host cancels).

Payment method mix: both bookings appear on one receipt; behind the
scenes, we maintain two ledgers and two payouts.

E\) Reschedules & Edits (groupaware)

Propose change (buyer or provider/host): new time/date proposed to both
bookings in the LBG.

If both accept → times shift; Smart Docs autoamend; any price deltas
(e.g., longer hours) are quoted & reauthorized.

If only one can move → buyer chooses to split the group (proceed with
one, cancel the other per its policy) or cancel both per each policy.

Price adjustments:

Talent: change orders/addons as usual.

Studio: hours & cleaning adjustments; additional fees quoted before
reauth.

F\) Onsite Flow: CheckIn/Out & Overtime (studios)

Checkin/out: geofenced Start/End taps; logs timestamps and duration.

Overtime: billed per listing rule (e.g., per 30 min at 1.5×).

If overtime detected (End \> booked End), host files a PostBooking
Adjustment within 24h with evidence (checkout log, photos).

Buyer has 48h to accept/dispute; we may autoapprove if evidence is clear
(policy toggle).

Crew size overage / rule violations: host can submit an adjustment claim
with evidence within 24h (caps & allowed reasons defined in listing).

G\) Cancellations, NoShows & Safety (group and pertype)

Pertype matrices apply independently (talent follows talent policy;
studio follows studio policy).

Group UX: buyer sees a combined summary showing outcomes for each
booking.

Host cancel (studio): buyer gets 100% refund on studio + \$25--\$50
goodwill credit; talent booking remains unless buyer also cancels it.

Safety exception: unsafe conduct → waive platform fees, refund
appropriately, and open Safety case; access to space can be revoked
remotely if applicable.

Noshow:

Studio: if buyer fails to check in within grace window and host was
present/available → studio payout per matrix; deposit not captured
unless damage or specific violation.

H\) Damage Deposits & Claims (studios)

Hold timing: authorize at checkout or 24h prior (host preference);
release 48h after checkout if no claim.

Claim flow: host opens claim within 24h with photos & description;
amount requested up to hold cap.

Adjudication: Neutral Review may approve full/partial capture or deny;
capture appears as a separate charge (not escrow).

Abuse guard: repeated frivolous claims throttle host visibility and may
remove deposit privileges.

I\) Completion & Payouts

Studio completion trigger: autocomplete on successful checkout (no
deliverables).

Talent completion trigger: acceptance of deliverables or autoaccept per
§1.3/Delivery Room rules.

Payout timing:

Studio: 24--48h after checkout, minus adjustments under review.

Talent: 48h after acceptance/autoaccept.

Early Payout (peruse): available to eligible hosts/providers (Rep ≥ 85)
with the 0.5% acceleration fee as defined in §3.2 (peruse, not
subscription).

J\) Receipts, Taxes & Invoices

Unified receipt shows two sections (Talent • Studio), fees, taxes (if
any), deposit hold (authorization only), and separate cancellation
policies.

Taxes: talent services vs space rental may differ by locale; we surface
hostprovided tax settings; lineitemized.

Documents: signed Smart Docs (Service Agreement, Property/Space Release,
House Rules) downloadable from the booking thread.

K\) Edge Cases & Safeguards

Doublebooking protection: instant revalidation of studio availability at
payment step; if collision, buyer gets a failsafe choice (waitlist or
alternative suggestions).

Early exit: no refunds for unused time unless host agrees; checkout time
is source of truth for overtime only (not undertime credits).

Access failures (e.g., bad code): host must provide alternate access
within 30 min; otherwise buyer may cancel for cause (full refund).

Travel fees: remain talentonly; no travel fees on studio bookings.

L\) Events & Analytics

booking.create.talent\|studio, booking.group.linked, booking.group.split

studio.deposit.authorized\|released\|captured_partial\|captured_full

studio.adjustment.opened\|buyer_accept\|buyer_dispute\|resolved

checkin.start\|end (role: studio/talent), overtime.detected

cancel.requested (who, when), cancel.outcome (per booking)

payout.scheduled\|sent (per booking)

M\) Acceptance Criteria (mark §1.3 addendum FINAL)

Two booking types implemented; Linked Booking Group supported in
checkout, thread, and receipts.

Studio checkout includes hourly pricing, min hours, cleaning fee, rules
& access, Property/Space Release esign, and deposit hold.

Instant Book for studios with optional "approval required"; guardrails
for verification.

Reschedule proposes synchronized changes; buyer can split or cancel with
pertype policies applied.

Checkin/out geofenced for studios; overtime & overage adjustments flow
live with evidence & timers.

Damage deposit lifecycle (authorize → claim window → capture/deny →
release) implemented.

Completion & payouts follow pertype triggers; Early Payout (peruse)
eligible for highrep accounts.

Receipts/invoices show separate lines & policies; tax handling surfaced;
Smart Docs downloadable.

Edge cases handled (doublebooking, access failure, early exit, travel
fees talentonly).

Analytics events instrumented.

N\) Why this works

Clarity & fairness: Separate bookings keep policies, disputes, and
payouts clean---no crosscontamination.

Low friction: Instant Book + deposit holds match studio norms while
escrow preserves trust.

Group convenience: Linked groups let buyers plan shoots endtoend with
predictable outcomes if plans change.

Operationally sane: Evidencebased adjustments and timeboxed claims keep
support scalable.

SubSection 1.4 --- Messaging, Inbox & Collaboration UX

Goal: Make communication effortless and professional from first contact
through final delivery. Keep everything in one place, roleaware, and
bookingaware to cut backandforth, prevent misunderstandings, and
increase completed bookings.

A\) Principles

Roleaware & Bookingaware: Every conversation is clearly tied to a role
(Service Profile) and, when applicable, a specific booking.

Single source of truth: Chat, briefs, shot lists, files, contracts,
location, schedule, extras, and payments live inside the thread/project.

Fast & respectful: Read receipts, quick replies, templates, and
structured forms reduce friction and ambiguity.

Safety first: Prominent tools to report, block, escalate, and check in;
privacy by default.

Anticircumvention: Keep the value onplatform (escrow, protection,
reviews), while being transparent and fair.

B\) Objects (data model at a glance)

Thread (id, type, role_context, participants, status)

Type: Inquiry (prebooking), Invite (Smart Invite), Booking (postaccept),
Dispute, System

Role Context: Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator (from the
Service Profile)

Status: Open • Awaiting reply • Pending decision • Confirmed • Completed
• Disputed • Archived

Message (sender, timestamp, content, attachments, system_flags)

Delivery states: sent (✓), delivered (✓✓), read (✓✓ filled)

Typing indicator, last active (e.g., "Active 2h ago")

Attachment (file, type, size, hash, role_tags)

Images (JPG/PNG/WebP), Video (MP4/MOV), Docs (PDF/DOCX/XLSX), Zip/RAR,
Links (sanitized)

Project (exists for Booking threads)

Summary (package, extras, license), schedule, location, participants,
moodboard, shot list, call sheet, contracts, deliverables, milestones,
expenses, payments, travel, notes.

Action Cards (structured forms injected in chat)

Propose time / reschedule, add extras, add overtime, upload
proof/finals, request approvals, expense receipt, mark completed, open
dispute, share location, safety flag.

C\) Inbox: layout & organization

Layout:

Left pane: Folders + thread list

Center: Messages

Right pane: Project Panel (context & actions)

Folders:

All, Unread, Starred, Inquiries, Invites, Bookings, Disputes, Archived,
Spam

Filters: by Role (Model, Photographer, ...), by Status (Awaiting reply,
Payment pending), by City/Date, by Has files

Bundles: Threads are bundled by counterparty; expand to see separate
rolescoped conversations

Thread list item:

Avatar + Name, Role chip, Type chip (Inquiry / Booking / Invite), Status
chip, last message preview, unread count, date, read receipt icon if
your last message was read

Thread search:

Keyword search, file type filters, date range, role filter

Message requests:

Firsttime contacts land in Requests (under Inquiries) with Accept /
Decline / Block.

Bypass to Inbox automatically if sender meets your contact filters
(e.g., IDverified, inradius, budget disclosed).

D\) Compose & credits (spamsafe by design)

New conversation credits (monthly) per account, with bonus credits from
verification badges (as defined in §1.1).

Unlimited replies in existing threads and unlimited messaging for
confirmed bookings.

Contact filters: Talent can require IDverified only, budget disclosure,
or date provided to message.

Quick replies & snippets: Providers can save templated responses; we
autosuggest based on context ("Thanks, I'm available that day---package
options attached").

Message booster: For buyers, optional oneoff priority ping
(limited/charged) to nudge highdemand talent.

E\) Thread header & Project Panel (right pane)

Thread header (always visible):

Counterparty name + avatar; Role chip; Type chip; Status

Booking summary bar when applicable: date/time • location • package •
price • escrow status • policy

Project Panel tabs (Booking threads):

Summary: package, extras, license, price, escrow status, timeline
(proposal → accepted → shoot → delivery → review)

Schedule: date/time, buffers, reschedule button, ICS export

Location: map pin, parking notes; travel terms; share location (toggle)

Participants: buyer, provider, assistants (optional), MUA/stylist tags
(FYI only); roles & contact via chat

Brief: project description + structured brief fields (theme, wardrobe,
references)

Moodboard: pinned images/links, dragreorder, annotate with comments

Shot List: checklist of shots; statuses (planned, in progress, done)

Call Sheet: autogenerated PDF (time, location, contacts, setup notes,
schedule blocks, wardrobe list)

Files & Deliverables: proofs, finals, RAW (if allowed); preview &
approvals; watermarked previews until marked "accepted"

Contracts: booking agreement, model release, usage license, promo terms
(esigned PDFs)

Expenses: travel miles/time fees, receipts, approvals

Actions: add extras, add overtime, propose reschedule, cancel, open
dispute, mark complete

F\) Collaboration features (in chat, zero friction)

Action cards render inline (mobilefriendly):

Propose new time → selector → both see Accept/Decline

Add extra (catalog) → confirm & pay in one tap

Overtime (30/60min blocks) → both approve → charge

Upload proofs → gallery preview with Approve/Request changes

Upload finals → mark milestone "Delivered" → triggers release timer

Expense receipt → buyer approve/pay

Share location (general area, not exact address unless both consent)

Safety flag (see §H)

Annotations: On moodboard and shot list items, inline comments +
\@mentions.

Pin message: Keep key messages at top (address, wardrobe, parking code).

Labels & notes: Private labels ("VIP", "High budget", "No reshoots")
visible only to you.

Voice notes (Phase 2) and video call link (Phase 2) if needed---kept
lightweight.

G\) File handling & delivery guardrails

Supported types & limits (MVP):

Images up to 25MB each; Videos up to 500MB; Docs up to 50MB; Zips up to
1GB

Perthread storage cap (e.g., 10GB) with option to add more (paid or Pro
plan)

Preview & watermark: Proofs autowatermarked (provider setting). Finals
unlock watermark once client taps Accept or escrow autoreleases.

Large deliverables: Allow external links (Drive/Dropbox), autocapture
file manifest (name/size/checksum), and warn on expired links.

Versioning: When reuploading finals, keep prior version accessible with
timestamps.

Retention: Files retained for N months after completion (export
reminders sent before purge).

Copyright & license: Display active usage license above deliverables;
warning if buyer requests use beyond license.

H\) Safety & moderation

Safety flag (red button):

Reasons: harassment, unsafe location, payment pressure, illegal request,
explicit content violations, impersonation, other.

Immediate priority route to Support; autosuspend of Instant Book on the
accused until triage; discreet handling.

Checkin: Optional "I've arrived / I'm leaving" timestamps; can share
general location radius with counterparty; private to thread & support.

Block & report: One tap to block future messages; reporting requires a
short reason.

Automoderation:

Contact sharing & offplatform payment detection → inline warning +
educational tooltip ("You lose escrow protection, reviews, and
cancellation coverage offplatform").

NSFW policy enforcement: image scanning + manual review queues for
suspected violations.

Privacy defaults: Email/phone hidden; reveal toggle after booking
(optional per user).

DND / Quiet hours: Peruser settings; requests still deliver silently
with summaries.

I\) Anticircumvention (fair + educational)

Prebooking: External payment links/phrases prompt an educational nudge
and are softblocked; persistent attempts throttle sender's
newconversation ability.

Postbooking: External coordination is allowed (we still encourage
onplatform for records); deliverables & approvals should remain in
project for dispute coverage.

Value reminders: Periodic banners highlight benefits: escrow,
cancellation coverage, verified reviews, analytics, and search boost for
verified users.

J\) Notifications

Push/email for: new message, invite/request received, accepted/declined,
payment captured, files uploaded, approvals requested, reschedule
proposal, dispute updates, payout sent.

Digest mode: For busy users, bundle notifications every X hours unless
"Booking day" (then realtime).

K\) Roles & permissions

Owner participants: buyer & provider (full read/write).

Secondary participants (optional): assistants, MUA/stylist; invited by
owner; readonly or filesonly permission; cannot alter payments or
policies.

Tag & consent workflow: When provider tags a collaborator on media, that
user receives an Approve/Decline card in chat; on approve, media appears
on both profiles (rolescoped per §1.2/§1.1).

L\) Tieins to other modules

Booking & Payments (§1.3): Add extras, overtime, expenses from chat;
payment capture + escrow state visible in header & Project Panel.

Search & Profiles (§1.2/§1.1): Response time & reliability metrics
update based on chat behavior (first response SLA, noshow, delivery
confirmations).

Verification (§1.1): Verified users get extra newconversation credits
and priority inbox surfacing.

M\) MVP vs. Phase2

MVP

Moodboard, Shot List, Call Sheet, Files, Contracts, Expenses, Actions)

N\) Acceptance criteria (for engineering & QA)

O\) Rationale (why this will convert)
