L\) Why this works

Amplifies, doesn't distract: Studios boost conversion of shoots without
turning us into a venue marketplace.

Curated & creativeonly: We avoid the event/party longtail and focus on
spaces that matter to our users.

Operationally sane: Lite verification, instant book defaults, deposits,
and simple amenity filters keep v1 lean.

Option value: If traction pops, we can elevate Studios in the nav and
expand supply; if not, we gracefully tuck it behind "Attach" without
harming core flows.

SubSection 3.1 --- Core Monetization Mechanics

Goal: Monetize in ways that increase trust and throughput, not friction.
Keep pricing simple, fair, and transparent; reward the behaviors that
grow the marketplace (verification, Instant Book, reliability).

A\) What we charge (and why)

1\) Transaction (perbooking) economics

Provider fee (commission): 12% of booking subtotal (packages + extras +
license + travel).\
Why: This benchmarks lower than creator marketplaces like Collabstr
(15%), Swipecast (15%), and Peerspace host fees (15--20%), while
remaining close to Upwork's freelancer fee (10%)---so we're competitive
for launch without undercutting our margins.

Buyer service fee: 5% (min \$3); 3% when paid via ACH (once available).\
Why: Buyer fees around 5--5.5% are common on large marketplaces (e.g.,
Fiverr 5.5% + a smallorder fee), and Upwork charges 3--5% depending on
payment method/plan. Our \$3 minimum ensures we cover processing on
small bookings, and the ACH discount mirrors market norms and nudges
lowercost rails.

Processing costs: paid out of platform take (the buyer fee largely
offsets card fees at \~2.9% + \$0.30 in the U.S.; ACH is lower). Note:
card processing fees from the original transaction aren't returned on
refunds (industry standard).

Refund policy on fees:

If provider cancels or safety exception → refund buyer service fee.

If buyer cancels per policy → service fee is nonrefundable (covers
payment ops & support).

Provider fee adjusts automatically to the final job value after any
discounts/refunds.

Why this mix: Simple, predictable, and aligned with market expectations
and our earlystage unit economics. 5% buyer keeps us in line with Upwork
and below/near Fiverr's charge to buyers; 12% provider undercuts or
matches comparable verticals.

2\) Fee adjusters (nudge the right behavior)

Instant Book discount: Provider fee --1% on Instant Book transactions
(promotes "buy now").

Trusted Pro (backgroundchecked) discount: Provider fee --0.5% (rewards
safety investment).

Highvalue tiering: On the portion above \$1,000 in a single booking,
provider fee drops to 10% (keeps big jobs onplatform; echoes the "volume
discount" concept users recognize from legacy Upwork tiers).

Newmarket promos (timeboxed): e.g., \$0 buyer fee on first booking in a
launch city; or --2% provider for first 60 days postlaunch.

All discounts are stackable with a floor (e.g., provider fee floor =
9%).

3\) What we don't charge for

DMs and inquiries (within fairuse credits; see §3.2).

Tips (0% platform fee on tips, paid postcompletion)---a clear
differentiator vs. platforms that take a cut of tips.

TFP/Collab Mode (no cash) --- no commission; we monetize indirectly
(Pro, boosts).

B\) Escrow, payout timing & reserves (recap, monetization lens)

Escrow on accept/book: we hold funds until completion/milestones (see
§1.3).

Payout timing: standard 48h after completion; newprovider reserve (e.g.,
first 1--3 payouts delayed up to 7 days or 10% rolling reserve) to
reduce fraud/chargeback risk.

Early Payout (Pro preview for §3.2): selected providers with strong Rep
Score can receive same/nextday payouts for an optional 0.5%
payoutacceleration fee (applied to the provider fee component).

C\) Worked examples (realistic, stepbystep)

We keep the math explicit so Finance & Product implement identical
calculations.

Example 1 --- \$300 booking, default fees, no discounts

Booking subtotal: \$300

Buyer service fee (5%): 0.05 × 300 = \$15 → Buyer pays \$315

Provider fee (12% of \$300): 0.12 × 300 = \$36

Provider takehome (preprocessing): \$300 − \$36 = \$264

Processor cost (illustrative): assume 2.9% + \$0.30 on \$315

2.9% of 315 = \$9.135; + \$0.30 = \$9.435 (≈ \$9.44)

Platform gross on this booking (before ops):

Revenue = provider fee \$36 + buyer fee \$15 = \$51

Less processing ≈ \$9.44 → Net ≈ \$41.56.

Example 2 --- \$600 booking, Instant Book (--1%) + Trusted Pro (--0.5%)

Buyer service fee (5%): 0.05 × 600 = \$30 → Buyer pays \$630

Provider fee base (12%): \$72

Discounted provider fee (10.5%): 0.105 × 600 = \$63

Provider takehome: \$600 − \$63 = \$537

Platform revenue preprocessing: \$63 + \$30 = \$93

Processing (2.9% + \$0.30) on \$630: \$18.57

Net to platform (before ops): \$74.43.

Example 3 --- \$85 booking, smallorder check

Buyer service fee: 5% of \$85 = \$4.25 (≥ \$3 min, so min does not
apply) → buyer pays \$89.25

Provider fee (12%): \$10.20 → provider takehome \$74.80

Processing on \$89.25 (2.9% + \$0.30): ≈ \$2.89

Platform net (preops): (10.20 + 4.25) − 2.89 ≈ \$11.56

On very small bookings (e.g., \$30), the \$3 min protects margin---where
many peers set \$3--\$3.50 smallorder addons.

D\) Pricing transparency & UX rules

Oneline disclosure at checkout: "Platform fees include secure escrow,
contracts, support & payment processing."

Provider dashboard "takehome preview" per package (and optional "include
estimated card fees" toggle).

Refund/discount edits autoreissue amended receipts for both sides (see
§1.4 addendum).

City promos show strikethrough fees (e.g., "Buyer fee \~5%\~ → 0% this
month in Houston").

ACH discount labeling: clearly show "Pay by bank (save 2% on fees)" once
ACH is enabled; this mirrors buyerside fee reductions on comparable
platforms.

E\) Antileakage incentives (why pay through us)

Protection value: escrow, platform contracts/releases, dispute handling,
verified reviews, Pro analytics.

Economics: lower provider fee for Instant Book and Trusted Pro;
eligibility for paid Search Boost gated by onplatform performance.

Friction: gentle inchat warnings on offplatform payment attempts; repeat
attempts throttle newconversation sends (see §1.4/§1.5).

F\) Edge cases & policy notes

Dispute outcomes: platform retains the buyer fee only when buyer is at
fault; if we rule for the buyer due to provider fault, we refund the
buyer fee (mirrors common guest/host fee treatments).

Chargebacks: a disputehandling fee (e.g., \$15) may be charged to the
losing party only in clear abuse; otherwise we absorb processor dispute
fees.

Taxes: where services are taxable, fees are calculated on the taxable
base appropriately; receipts itemize taxes separately.

NSFW policy alignment: mainstreamfirst (artistic nudity allowed),
enabling mainstream processors and avoiding adultcontent
surcharges/payout friction.

Refunds & processor fees: card processing fees on the original
transaction are not returned by processors; our policy and tooling
reflect this.

G\) Acceptance criteria (to mark 3.1 FINAL)

Fee engine supports 12% provider + 5% buyer (min \$3); ACH buyer fee 3%;
stackable discounts (Instant Book −1%, Trusted Pro −0.5%, 10% on portion
\> \$1,000) with floor 9%.

Buyer fee refunded on providerfault cancellations/safety exceptions;
nonrefundable on buyerinitiated cancels.

Payouts: 48h standard; newprovider reserve policy configurable by
cohort; Early Payout addon ready for §3.2.

Receipts/invoices autoupdate after amendments/discounts; totals
consistent with escrow.

Provider dashboard shows takehome preview; checkout shows clear fee
blurb + tooltip; ACH discount is surfaced when available.

Analytics capture net platform revenue per booking, fee mix, and impact
of discounts on conversion.

H\) Why this works (postresearch)

Marketaligned: 12% provider sits below or near sector peers (15%+ on
Collabstr/Swipecast/Peerspace; Fiverr takes 20% from sellers), while 5%
buyer with \$3 min mirrors buyer fees at Fiverr/Upwork.

Profitable from day one: buyer fee largely covers card processing;
smallorder min prevents negative unit economics; ACH discount reduces
payment costs and attracts highervalue buyers.

Growthpositive: discounts for Instant Book and Trusted Pro increase
conversion and safety; highvalue tier encourages larger jobs to stay
onplatform (a pattern users recognize from legacy fee ladders).

Addendum to §3.1 / §3.2 --- Policy & Pricing Notes (Storage & Docs)

Storage policy copy (customerfacing): "We store review copies and
paperwork for 12 months. Originals stay in your Drive/Dropbox. We're not
a longterm archive."

No storage fees at launch (per §3.2 StartFree strategy); external
hosting required for large deliverables.

Document access: Signed docs are always downloadable; we maintain copies
even if external links expire.

Dispute window: Contracts define a posting/delivery dispute window
(e.g., 7--14 days) during which links must remain live.

Addendum --- §3.1 Core Monetization Mechanics (Studios) --- FINAL

Goal: Apply our simple, trusted pricing (12% provider / 5% buyer) to
Studio bookings without ambiguity. Keep deposits outside GMV, align
refunds with studio policies, and preserve clean ledgers for Linked
Booking Groups (talent + studio in one checkout).

A\) What we charge on a Studio booking

Provider (host) fee: 12% of the studio subtotal

Subtotal = hourly rental × booked hours + cleaning fee + paid addons
(e.g., furniture move)

Excludes taxes and deposit holds.

Buyer service fee: 5% of the studio subtotal (min \$3)

ACH discount (when enabled): buyer fee 3% (min \$3) if the buyer pays
via ACH.

Refund of buyer fee follows fault: refunded on hostfault cancel;
nonrefundable on buyer cancel per policy.

Processing costs: paid from platform take (same as talent).

No change to talent fees. Talent and Studio fees are computed on their
respective subtotals, even when purchased together.

B\) Discounts & nudges (studio)

Instant Book discount applies to Studio bookings: --1% on the provider
fee for IB transactions.

Trusted Pro (background) is peopleonly; does not apply to Studio hosts.

Highvalue tier: the 10% provider fee above \$1,000 threshold applies per
booking (talent and studio evaluated separately).

City promos (timeboxed) may separately reduce buyer/provider fees on
studio bookings; configured per city cohort.

C\) What we do not charge on studios

Damage deposits (card holds) are not GMV; we do not take a platform fee
on deposit captures.

Postbooking damage captures (if approved) pass through to host; the
platform may still incur processor fees.

Tips (if we enable them for hosts) remain 0% platform fee.

D\) Adjustments that are feeable

Overtime, crewsize overages, ruleviolation fees (when upheld) are
treated as booking adjustments → included in studio subtotal and feeable
at the same provider/buyer fee rates.

Change orders that extend hours or add paid items → feeable (computed at
approval time).

E\) Linked Booking Groups (talent + studio in one checkout)

We create two bookings (one talent, one studio) under a Linked Group ID.

Fees are computed per booking; buyer sees a unified receipt with two
sections (Talent • Studio).

Refunds/reversals apply per booking based on each policy; the group
summary presents the net outcome.

Processing may be a single charge or split under the hood; the ledger
remains separated to keep fee math transparent.

F\) Refund policy alignment (studio vs talent)

Studio cancels (hostfault): 100% refund of studio charges; buyer service
fee for that booking refunded; goodwill credit per §3.9.

Buyer cancels: follow the studio matrix (e.g., \>7 days = 100%, 7--48h =
50%, \<48h = 0%); buyer fee nonrefundable.

Noshow (buyer at studio): host paid per matrix; buyer fee nonrefundable.

Force majeure/safety: platform may waive fees and refund appropriately
(studio and/or talent) per §3.9.

G\) Worked examples (clear math)

Processor assumption: \~2.9% + \$0.30 per charge (illustrative). We show
platform preprocessing revenue and an approx net after processing for
transparency.

Example 1 --- Studioonly booking

Rate: \$100/hr × 4h = \$400

Cleaning fee: \$40 → Studio subtotal = \$440

Buyer fee (5%): 0.05 × 440 = \$22.00 → Buyer pays = \$462.00

Provider fee (12%): 0.12 × 440 = \$52.80 → Host takehome (preprocessing)
= 440 − 52.80 = \$387.20

Platform revenue (preprocessing) = provider fee \$52.80 + buyer fee
\$22.00 = \$74.80

Processing (est.) on \$462: 2.9% × 462 = \$13.398 ≈ \$13.40; + \$0.30 =
\$13.70

Approx net to platform = 74.80 − 13.70 = \$61.10

Deposit hold: \$300 authorization (not charged, not GMV)

Example 2 --- Linked Group: Talent \$600 + Studio from Ex.1 (no
discounts)

Talent booking

Subtotal \$600 → Buyer fee (5%) \$30.00; Provider fee (12%) \$72.00

Platform preproc rev \$102.00; processing (est. on \$630) \$18.57 → net
≈ \$83.43

Studio booking (from Ex.1)

Platform net ≈ \$61.10

Combined (informational)

Platform preproc = \$102.00 + \$74.80 = \$176.80

Approx processing total ≈ \$18.57 + \$13.70 = \$32.27

Approx net ≈ \$144.53

Buyer sees two buyerfee lines (talent \$30, studio \$22) and a single
receipt with two sections.

If Instant Book applies to talent and/or studio, reduce the respective
provider fee(s) by 1%; math updates accordingly. ACH payment would
reduce the buyer fee(s) to 3% where used.

H\) Chargebacks & deposit captures (studio specifics)

Representment for studio chargebacks includes: checkin/out logs, rules
acceptance, houserules esign, before/after photos, and adjustment
evidence.

Deposit capture (after approved damage claim) is a separate charge; no
platform fee applied; we still prepare evidence and may incur processor
dispute fees.

Repeated abusive claims by hosts or buyers trigger Rep penalties and
eligibility throttles (IB off, boost suppress).

I\) Citybycity knobs (monetization safety)

Configure studioonly promos (e.g., 0% buyer fee on first studio booking
in founding city).

Optionally waive Studio Lite verification fee for first 25--50
hosts/city (CAC budget), not a permanent policy.

Keep provider fee floor = 9% after all discounts (applies independently
to talent and studio).

J\) Acceptance Criteria (mark §3.1 addendum FINAL)

Provider 12% / Buyer 5% applied to Studio subtotal (cleaning/addons
included; taxes/deposits excluded).

IB --1% discount applies to Studio; Trusted Pro does not (peopleonly);
\>\$1k tier reduces Studio fee portion to 10%.

Buyer fee refunds on hostfault cancels; nonrefundable on buyerfault per
studio matrix.

Deposit holds: not GMV; no platform fee on captures; lifecycle events
logged.

Overtime/overages/change orders feeable at standard rates when upheld.

Linked Group receipts show two sections and two buyerfee lines; ledgers
remain separated; partial refunds handled per booking.

Analytics: revenue by type (talent vs studio), fee mix, ACH penetration,
discount impact, deposit claim rates, chargeback ratios by type.

K\) Why this works

Simple, predictable economics extend cleanly to studios; buyers see
clear line items, hosts see reliable takehome.

Margins protected: buyer fee offsets processing; deposits don't inflate
GMV or distort fee math.

Scalable ops: perbooking ledgers + group receipts make refunds,
disputes, and reporting straightforward.

Aligned incentives: IB discount encourages fast conversion; fee tiers
keep highvalue bookings onplatform.

SubSection 3.2 --- Pricing & Tiers (Launch: Start Free, Grow, Then
Monetize in Layers)

Goal: Maximize early adoption and bookings by removing monthly paywalls
and monetizing via takerate (see §3.1) and optional, usagebased addons
that never compromise fairness. Introduce an optional Pro tier only
after we reach liquidity and can prove it increases creator revenue.

A\) Principles (launch stage)

No subscriptions at launch --- free to join, free to list, free to
message within generous fairuse.

Value is earned, not paywalled --- verification, reliability, and
reputation unlock visibility and perks.

Payasyougo, not rent --- Boosts/RFPs are usagebased; no forced bundles.

Fairness & safety first --- paid visibility never outranks relevance or
safety gates.

Monetize later, when proven --- add an optional Pro tier only after
clear, databacked ROI for users.

B\) What everyone gets for free at launch (simple, generous)

Multirole profiles: up to 3 service profiles per account (Model /
Photographer / Videographer / Creator).

Portfolio & storage: up to 100 images + 20 videos; 15 GB total storage
(pooled across roles).

Messaging: 40 newconversation credits/month (unlimited replies & all
booking threads).

Booking stack: escrow, contracts/releases, licensing tiers; calendar &
ICS sync; travel calculator (see §1.3).

Social metrics: connect IG/YT/TT/X; verified chips on profile & cards
(see §1.2 addendum).

Fees: commission per §3.1 (12% provider; 5% buyer, \$3 min, 3% ACH when
enabled).

No listing fees. No paid storage. No paid DM packs at launch.

C\) Earned trust perks (free, but gated by safety/reliability)

1\) ID Verified

Unlock Instant Book eligibility.

+20 newconversation credits/month (total 60).

Search nudge (minor tiebreak when results are otherwise equal).

Eligible for "Verifiedonly" buyer filters.

2\) Trusted Pro (Background Check passed)

--0.5% providerfee discount (stacks with Instant Book --1%; floor 9%
from §3.1).

Priority in RFP request queues.

Onetime \$15 Boost coupon (funded from CAC budget).

3\) High Reputation (Rep ≥ 85; see §1.5)

Earned tiebreak in ranking after relevance/availability/distance/price.

Early Payout eligibility (peruse; see §E).

Invite priority in Smart Invites.

None of these can be bought. They must be earned via verification,
reliability, and great reviews.

D\) Usagebased monetization (optional; never paytowin)

1\) Search Boost (CPC with daily caps)

Promotes cards only in queries the provider already matches.

Labeled Promoted; strict density limits (≤2 in top 20; ≤1 above the
fold).

Eligibility: ID Verified, Rep ≥ 70, no recent strikes.

2\) Featured Carousels (fixedterm)

City/category home modules (e.g., "Featured in Houston").

Weekly flat price; slot caps; guaranteed rotation.

3\) RFP Broadcast Credits (for buyers/teams)

Post a brief (role, city, budget) → broadcast to matching verified
providers.

Sold in small packs (e.g., 5 for \$29). Replies remain free.

4\) Optional buyer ACH discount

Buyer fee 5% (min \$3) → 3% when paying via ACH once enabled (mirrors
norms, reduces costs; see §3.1).

E\) Early Payout (peruse, not a plan)

Eligibility: Rep ≥ 85 and ID Verified or Trusted Pro.

Pricing: 0.5% per accelerated payout (applied to the providerfee
component only), charged only when used.

Limit: Max once per booking; no stacking.

F\) Storage & deliverables (no paywall at launch)

Base 15 GB for all; 30 GB when ID Verified; 50 GB when Trusted Pro or
Rep ≥ 85.

Large sets can use external links (Drive/Dropbox); platform captures a
manifest (name/size/checksum) for disputes.

Revisit storage billing only if \>5% of active users routinely hit
ceilings and costs materially increase.

G\) Messaging health & antispam (no paytospam)

Monthly 40 newconversation credits; +20 for ID Verified; +20 for Trusted
Pro (max 80).

Credits autoreplenish monthly; extra credit purchases disabled at
launch.

"Nudge" limit: 1 priority nudge / thread / day; abuse throttled;
repeated violations reduce newconversation caps.

H\) Fairness & ranking guardrails (immutable)

Relevance first: query fit → availability → distance → price → Rep
tiebreak → Verified/Trusted nudges.

Paid visibility caps: strict density limits; clear Promoted labels;
never outrank better matches.

Safety gating: Boosts & RFP broadcasts require ID Verified, Rep ≥ 70, no
recent strikes.

I\) Launch promos (transactionfirst; timeboxed by city)

0% buyer fee on first booking in launch cities.

--2% provider fee for first 60 days postlaunch (stackaware; respects 9%
floor).

Verification subsidies: cover part of ID cost for the first 300
signups/city; \$15 coupon on passing Background.

City promos rendered as strikethrough on fee lines (e.g., "Buyer fee
\~5%\~ → 0%").

J\) When (and only when) to add an optional Pro plan later

Introduce a voluntary Pro tier only if all triggers are true in ≥ 2
launch cities:

Liquidity: Search→Inquiry ≥ 20%; Inquiry→Booking ≥ 35%; Repeat bookings
≥ 30%.

Willingness to pay: ≥ 20% of active providers repeatedly buy Boosts/RFP
credits.

Pro uplift proof: Piloted Pro features show ≥ 20% conversion/GMV lift
vs. control.

Community health: NPS ≥ 45 and Pro does not depress Free engagement.

If/when launched: keep Pro optional and valueadd (e.g., monthly Boost
stipend, advanced analytics, concierge), never required for
discoverability.

K\) Metrics to watch (prove we chose right)

Activation: % of new providers publishing ≥ 1 package within 7 days → \>
50%.

Messaging health: Median first response time ≤ 2 hours; abuse reports \<
0.3 / 100 conversations.

Verification adoption: ID ≥ 60%, Trusted Pro ≥ 15% by day 60 in a city.

Unit economics: Booking net (per §3.1) positive in ≥ 95% of
transactions; smallorder min protects margin.

Boost ROI: Median paid Boost yields ≥ 2.5× incremental GMV.

Repeat: 30%+ repeat bookings within 90 days in mature launch city.

L\) Acceptance criteria (to mark 3.2 FINAL)

No subscriptions at launch; no paid storage; no paid DM packs.

Feature gates/perks are driven by Verification, Trusted Pro, and
Reputation, not payment.

Search Boost, Featured, RFP credits implemented as usagebased with
eligibility gates, labels, and density caps.

Early Payout available peruse for qualified providers.

Storage tiers increase via verification/reputation; externallink
manifesting implemented.

Messaging credit system live; abuse throttles; "nudge" limits enforced.

Launch promos configurable per city/cohort (fee holidays, provider fee
reductions, verification subsidies).

Dashboards: activation, verification adoption, Boost ROI, unit
economics, response times, repeat bookings.

M\) Why this works (launch economics & growth)

Removes adoption friction that hurt legacy platforms (no "pay to
participate").

Aligns incentives --- we profit when users profit (commission), not
before.

Builds trust at scale --- earned perks (verification/reputation) boost
safety and conversion.

Keeps options open --- once liquidity and ROI are proven, we can add an
optional Pro that power users want to pay for.

Notes for §3.1 consistency (already reflected)

Keep 12% provider / 5% buyer (min \$3; 3% ACH); Instant Book --1%,
Trusted Pro --0.5%, highvalue tier 10% above \$1,000; floor 9%.

Early Payout is peruse (0.5%) and eligibilitybased --- not tied to any
subscription.

SubSection 3.3 --- Paid Boosting & Promotions (UsageBased Only)

Goal: Unlock incremental bookings and early revenue without harming
trust or liquidity. Paid visibility is optional, eligibilitygated,
clearly labeled, and strictly capped. Organic relevance remains the
primary ranking signal. We pilot quietly (Houston) and scale only if
metrics prove netpositive.

A\) Principles (grounded in research)

Fairfirst, never paytowin. Organic ranking = query match → availability
→ distance → price fit → Rep Score. Paid units never displace more
relevant organic matches.

Eligibility before dollars. Boosts only for proven, trusted providers
(ID Verified, Rep ≥ 75, ≥2 completed onplatform bookings or ≥1 verified
reference, no active safety flags).

Transparency & control. Every paid unit is labeled Promoted with a "Why
am I seeing this?" explainer; buyers can Hide a provider and Report.

Hard caps & guardrails. Strict density, frequency, and impressionshare
caps; qualityscore weighting; misrepresentation = autopause.

Pilot, measure, earn the right to scale. Quiet Houston beta → expand
only if we hit growthsafe KPIs (organic share, buyer CTR/conv, provider
ROAS) and no trust regressions.

B\) Inventory & Placements (v1, minimal & conservative)

Search Results Boost (primary)

Placement: results list.

Format: standard profile card + Promoted chip + dynamic ribbon (e.g.,
"Instant Book", "Trusted Pro", "Available this week").

Density caps: ≤1 Promoted abovethefold, ≤2 Promoted in top 20 results.

Category / City Featured Carousels (home & landing)

Modules: "Featured in Houston", "Featured Photographers".

Slots: 10--12 cards, rotating evenly; visible only in the pilot city.

Not in v1: inbox/proposal boosting, email ads, push highlights. We do
not boost RFP proposal order or message thread ranking (avoids
"paytowin" backlash).

C\) Products & Pricing (usagebased, no bundles)

Search Boost (CPC)

Pilot floors (illustrative): TierA city (Houston) --- Models \$0.90,
Photographers \$0.70, Videographers \$0.80, Creators \$0.85.

Budgeting: daily budget + max CPC; even pacing; prepaid wallet; charge
on valid clicks only.

Ordering (within paid caps only): Score = 0.5×log(bid) +
0.5×QualityScore.

Featured Carousel (flat weekly)

Pricing: \$49--\$89 / week (Houston, by role).

Delivery: impression guarantees; rotation fairness; makegood credits if
short.

No subscriptions, no longterm commitments, no forced packs.

D\) Eligibility, Targeting & Relevance (what keeps it fair)

Eligibility: ID Verified, Rep ≥ 75, ≥2 completed bookings (or ≥1
verified reference), no active safety flags, policycompliant content.

Query matching (hard filter): role, location radius, availability
window, price range, NSFW toggle must all match; otherwise no delivery.

Audience targeting: provider may narrow by city/radius/price band;
negative keywords/genres allowed.

QualityScore (0--1): exact filter match, recent response rate/time, Rep,
Instant Book, price fit to query median, historical CTR/conv. New
boosters start at 0.5.

E\) Rotation, Frequency & ShareofShelf Caps

Frequency caps (per buyer): max 2 paid impressions/session, 5/day, 4h
cooldown per provider/buyer pair.

Provider impressionshare cap: paid impressions per provider ≤8% of all
eligible paid impressions/day (prevents domination).

Organic share guardrail (platformwide): at least 85--90% of buyer result
clicks must land on organic cards in the pilot (monitored KPI).

Roundrobin within caps: if eligible \> slots, rotate weighted by
(remaining budget × QualityScore).

F\) Provider Experience (setup → proof of value)

Setup flow: pick service profile → choose Search Boost or Featured → set
budget & bid → (optional) narrow targeting → confirm.

Creative policy: no custom ads; we use the profile card + system ribbon
(prevents deceptive creative).

Guidance: "Suggested bid" and "expected clicks/bookings" estimates;
"Improve QualityScore" checklist (ID verify, reduce response time,
enable Instant Book, adjust price fit).

Reporting (realtime): impressions, clicks, CTR, avg CPC, inquiries,
bookings, GMV attributed, ROAS, and incremental lift via a 10% holdout
(eligible but not shown).

Autocoaching: if 7day ROAS \< 1.5×, show "Consider pausing or improving
QS" prompt; if \<1.0× after 14 days, recommend pause.

G\) Buyer Experience (clarity & control)

Labeling: Promoted chip + info tooltip ("Matches your filters; purchased
limited promotion. Promoted never outranks more relevant results.")

Controls: Hide this provider (suppresses organic & paid for 30 days),
Report (routes to Safety).

Consistency: paid units respect NSFW settings and all filters; density
caps enforced above.

H\) Fraud, Safety & Abuse Controls

Invalid click detection: rapid repeats, zerodwell bounces, bot/device
anomalies, selfclicking, rings → automark invalid & credit back CPC;
repeated anomalies throttle delivery & flag for review.

Misrepresentation: price/availability mismatches or baitandswitch →
autopause campaign + warning; repeat → suspension.

Safety linkage: any active safety investigation → suppress all paid
delivery until cleared.

Budget protection: daily overspend guard (≤5% variance) + autocredit on
pacing errors. Chargeback shield: new campaigns disabled if unresolved
chargebacks.

I\) Launch Posture & Comms (Houston pilot)

Access: inviteonly cohort of 100--200 eligible providers per role in
Houston for first 6--8 weeks.

Messaging to community: publish an Integrity Pledge (fairfirst, clear
labels, hard caps, eligibility gates).

Feedback loop: inproduct survey after 2 weeks of spend; provider & buyer
focus groups at week 4; adjust caps/floors accordingly.

Reinvestment: earmark 20--30% of pilot Boost revenue to buyer
acquisition in Houston (drives net liquidity).

J\) KPIs & "Kill Switch" Thresholds (first 60--90 days)

Adoption & performance

≥ 12--18% of eligible providers try Boost; Featured weekly slot fill
≥60%.

Median ROAS ≥ 2.5×; median costperbooking ≤ \$18 (TierA).

Buyer experience & trust

Organic click share ≥ 85--90% (guardrail).

Buyer Hide rate ≤ 3% of paid impressions; Safety reports ≤ 0.2 / 1,000
paid impressions.

No significant drop in search→inquiry or inquiry→booking vs. prepilot
baselines.

Fairness & ecosystem health

Gini index of paid impression distribution stays below threshold (no
provider monopolies).

Nonboosted, highRep providers maintain stable inquiry rates (±10%).

Kill switch (autopause) if any occur:

Organic click share \< 80% for 7 rolling days; or

Buyer Hide rate \> 5% for 7 days; or

Incremental bookings (holdout) ≤ 0 for 2 consecutive weeks; or

Spike in safety reports tied to promoted cards.

K\) Pricing Governance & City Tiers

City tiers: TierA (Houston, Dallas, LA, NYC, ATL) → TierB (growing
metros) → TierC (smaller metros).

CPC floors review: monthly; adjust ±\$0.10--\$0.20 based on fill,
provider ROAS, and buyer CTR/conv.

Featured pricing review: quarterly by impressions delivered, CTR,
bookings/slot.

L\) What we won't do (explicit guardrails)

No boosting of proposals/RFP response order or message thread
prominence.

No "unverified" or lowRep accounts in paid slots.

No unlabeled or disguised ads.

No auction in v1 (simplicity first); we may test a hybrid bid × QS
auction later if/when liquidity warrants.

M\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.3 FINAL)

Search Boost (CPC) live with city+role floors, daily budgets, validclick
billing, even pacing.

Featured Carousel live with weekly flat pricing, rotation, impression
guarantees & makegoods.

Eligibility gates enforced (ID, Rep ≥ 75, booking/reference minimums, no
safety flags); query match hard filter; NSFW compliance.

Caps: density (≤1 above fold; ≤2 in top 20), frequency (2/session,
5/day, 4h cooldown), provider impression share ≤ 8%/day.

QualityScore & ordering implemented; fair roundrobin pacing; organic
share guardrail tracked.

Fraud & safety: invalidclick credits, overspend guard, autopause on
misrep/safety.

Reporting: realtime KPIs + holdoutbased incrementality; autocoaching on
low ROAS.

Admin tools: floors, slot caps, guardrails/kill switch, makegood
credits, cohort gating.

Comms: Integrity Pledge published; buyer labeling & controls shipped;
feedback loop live.

N\) Why this works (for launch)

Protects growth: Paid units are sparse, vetted, and relevancebound;
early users see that quality wins without paying.

Aligns incentives: Providers can optin to spend when it pays; we prove
incremental bookings via holdouts, not just clicks.

Avoids known pitfalls: No inbox/proposal boosting (sidesteps "paytowin"
backlash); strict caps prevent ad overload.

Scales responsibly: Pilot → prove → expand. If metrics or sentiment sag,
kill switch lets us pull back instantly.

SubSection 3.4 --- Verification & Compliance Monetization

Goal: Maximize early adoption and bookings while raising trust. Use
automationfirst verification with manualexception only, verify at
milestones (not at signup), and absorb essential costs during launch.
Store attestations (Pass/Fail) rather than raw PII.

A\) Principles (launch posture)

Frictionlight, milestonegated. No heavy checks at signup. We trigger
verification only when it unlocks value or reduces risk (e.g., Instant
Book, first payout, privateaddress shoots).

Automation first, humans last. Use vendor SDKs (doc scan, liveness,
geocode) and OCR to autoapprove the vast majority; route only fails/edge
cases to a small ops queue.

Platform absorbs essential costs (launch). Treat ID checks as customer
acquisition and trust investment; revisit after liquidity.

Privacy by design. We keep outcome + timestamp + vendor; vendors hold
sensitive artifacts.

Explainable & fair. Clear consent, reasons, appeals. No protectedclass
logic.

Citylevel dials. Subsidy, triggers, and badge rules configurable per
launch city.

B\) The Verification Ladder (what, when, why)

Tier 0 --- Account Basics (always free)

Email + phone (SMS) verify, device fingerprint, IP risk screen.

Badge: New --- building trust. Limited DM credits (see §3.2).

Tier 1 --- ID Verification (unlocks value; platformpaid at launch)

Triggers (any of): enable Instant Book; accept first paid booking;
release first payout; host at a private address (nonstudio); exceed
monthly newconversation cap.

Method: gov ID scan + selfie liveness + fraud checks (SDK).

Unlocks: ID Verified badge, Instant Book, +20 DM credits, minor search
tiebreak (equal matches).

Refresh: every 24 months or on risk events.

Tier 2 --- Background Check ("Trusted Pro", optional; passthrough
priced)

Triggers: optin for Trusted Pro badge; required for certain sensitive
categories if ever added.

Method: SSN trace, national criminal/sexoffender, sanctions; countylevel
where indicated by vendor logic.

Unlocks: Trusted Pro badge, provider fee --0.5% (see §3.1), RFP
priority, onetime \$15 Boost coupon.

Refresh: 12 months or on risk events; FCRAstyle adverse action + appeal
flow.

Tier 3 --- Studio Verification (optional; "Lite" first)

When: user wants a Studio Verified badge or frequently sets their own
space as the shoot location.

Lite (MVP, automationheavy): address claim + one supporting doc
(lease/utility/biz registration) → OCR + name/address match +
geocode/Place lookup → autoapprove if match confidence high; manual
review only on fails.

Full (defer to Phase 2): optional remote video walkthrough or thirdparty
inspection for highvolume venues.

Unlocks: Studio Verified badge; search filter "Studio access: verified";
fastpath location selection at checkout.

Social Verification (optional, free)

OAuth to IG/YT/TT/X; nightly sync metrics → verified chips and
perplatform search filters (see §1.2 addendum).

Age/NSFW Eligibility (derived)

Age derived from Tier 1; enables artisticnudity portfolios per policy
(mainstreamfirst stance).

C\) Flows & UX (keep it fast, clear, recoverable)

2minute ID flow target; progress meter; "Why you're seeing this"
explainer tied to the trigger (e.g., "Needed to release payouts").

Grace periods: If a trigger occurs midconversation, allow user to finish
current action and prompt verification before the next gated action.

Failure recovery: clear reason category + retake guidance; escalate to
manual only after 2 failed attempts.

No hard walls at signup: users can browse, build profile/portfolio, and
message within free limits before any KYC.

D\) Cost & Monetization Posture (launch → scale)

Who pays (launch):

ID (Tier 1): Platformpaid (subsidized) in founding cities.

Background (Tier 2): Passthrough pricing; we may add a small coupon to
encourage early adoption.

Studio Lite (Tier 3): Platformpaid doc review for first 200
studios/city; then \$19 docreview fee (waived by promo when needed).

Social OAuth: free.

Budget guardrails (Ops/Finance):

Set a monthly KYC budget cap per city (e.g., \$750--\$1,500),
autothrottle subsidies if exceeded (e.g., defer nonurgent Tier 1 until
payout trigger).

Track cost per verified and cost per incremental booking uplift; keep
CAC efficient.

Future levers (only postliquidity):

Optional expedited verification (24h fast lane) for a small fee.

Bundles (ID + BG) with modest margin only if conversion lift is proven
and churn impact is nil.

E\) Automation & Ops Model (devlight, scalable)

Vendors: one KYC SDK (ID + liveness), one BG vendor, geocode/Place API
for Studio Lite.

Manualexception queue: target \<10% of ID attempts; SLAs: ID \< 24h
(exceptions), BG ≤ 48h (county delays may vary), Studio Lite \< 24h for
failed automatches.

Staffing (pilot): 1 parttime reviewer per \~500--700 monthly
verifications (exceptions only).

Dashboards: pass/fail rates, exception volume, completion time, dropoff
at each step, cost per check, conversion lift vs. unverified.

F\) Data Handling & Compliance

We store: status (Pass/Fail/Needs info), reason codes, timestamp, vendor
ID; no raw ID images/biometrics.

Retention: verification attestations 24 months or until account
deletion; honor legal holds.

Consent: explicit consent screens; link to privacy, biometric notices
where applicable.

FCRA/EEOC: preadverse + adverse action for BG denials; individualized
assessment; appeal path.

Nondiscrimination: no targeting by protected class; policy + audits.

Marketplace role: verification conveys eligibility, not employment or
moral certification.

G\) Studio Verification --- MVP (what we do now vs later)

Do now (Lite): doc OCR + name/address match + geocode/Place check;
autoapprove if high confidence; manual on fails.

Don't do now: inperson inspections, insurance validation, complex
KYB---defer to Phase 2 for highvolume venues.

Booking UX: buyers can select a Verified Studio from a list; private
addresses masked until confirm; location verification optional at
checkout for private addresses ("Verify general area").

H\) Incentives (make trust feel rewarding)

ID Verified: Instant Book + +20 DM credits; minor search tiebreak on
equal matches.

Trusted Pro: fee --0.5%, RFP priority, \$15 Boost coupon (see §3.3),
badge on cards.

Studio Verified: filterable badge; "Studio" ribbon on cards; inclusion
in "Studios in \[City\]" carousel.

SocialVerified: perplatform chips and search filters; nightly trends on
profile.

I\) KPIs & Guardrails (first 90 days per city)

Adoption: ID ≥ 60% of active users; Trusted Pro ≥ 15% of active
providers; Studio Lite ≥ 10% of active studios.

Speed: median ID completion \< 2 min (selfserve); BG ≤ 48h (85%); Studio
Lite ≤ 24h (exceptions).

Conversion lift (vs. unverified): ID → +12--20% search→inquiry; Trusted
Pro → +10--15% inquiry→booking.

Dropoff: verificationstep abandonment \< 20%; if higher, simplify flow
or move trigger later.

Cost: monthly KYC spend within ±10% of budget cap; cost/verified flat to
down.

Kill switches: if search→inquiry or inquiry→booking drops \>10%
postgating in a cohort, relax triggers (e.g., gate at payout only) until
metrics recover.

J\) Pricing (simple & growthfriendly at launch)

ID Verification: \$0 to user (platformpaid) in founding cities.

Background Check (Trusted Pro): passthrough (e.g., \~\$25--\$35 avg),
with promo coupon in first 60 days.

Studio Lite: \$0 for first 200 per city; then \$19 (doc review).

Social OAuth: \$0.

Expedite (later): optional \$9 fast lane if demanded (postliquidity).

K\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.4 FINAL)

Milestonegated triggers wired (Instant Book, first payout, private
address, message caps).

Vendor integrations live (ID/liveness, BG, geocode), with
manualexception queue + SLAs.

Subsidy controls: percity KYC budget caps; throttle rules; ops
dashboards.

Attestationonly storage; consent & privacy notices; FCRA/appeals for BG.

Studio Lite OCR+geocode flow live; manual fallback; badge + search
filter.

Incentives: badges, fee nudge (Trusted Pro), DM boost, search tiebreaks
wired.

Metrics & kill switches: adoption, speed, dropoff, conversion lift, cost
per verified; autorelax triggers if growth impact detected.

L\) Why this works

Protects growth: No heavy checks at signup; verification happens when
users see the value (payouts, Instant Book).

Controls cost & ops load: Automation handles most verifications;
platform pays for the musthave checks only; tight budget caps.

Builds trust fast: Visible badges and small ranking nudges reward safe,
reliable behavior and raise booking confidence.

Scales cleanly: Studio Lite now; deeper inspections only when warranted.
Citylevel dials let us tune friction and spend.

Notes for PM/Eng handoff: keep triggers and budgets configurable per
city; log all verification events for audit; run monthly reviews on
pass/fail rates, exception causes, and dropoff to continuously trim
friction without compromising safety.

§3.5 --- Brand/Buyer Products (Briefs/RFPs, Shortlists, Concierge,
Delivery)

Goal: Buyers (brands, agencies, studios, solo creators) go from idea →
shortlist → booked → delivered fast, with clear scope, documents,
storagesane delivery, and verifiable outcomes---without subscriptions.
Everything stays fair (relevancefirst), safe (escrow + esign), and
growthfriendly (usagebased RFP credits only).

A\) Principles

Speed with clarity: Briefs produce applestoapples quotes; awarding
triggers escrow, documents, and a Delivery Room automatically.

Relevance over volume: Invite the right providers; broadcast only to
eligible, verified cohorts.

Trustfirst: IDVerified/Trusted Pro gating, esign before checkin,
onplatform escrow & dispute flows.

Storagesane delivery: Originals remain in buyer/provider cloud
(Drive/Dropbox/etc.); platform stores previews + manifests only.

Usagebased monetization: Smart Invite is free; RFP is creditsbased (no
monthly plans, no paywalls).

B\) Buyer Personas & JobstobeDone

Solo/SMB buyer: Needs a model/photographer for a simple shoot; wants
fast quotes and clear outcomes.

Marketing team/agency: Multiseat, needs shortlists, approvals, brand
docs, reporting.

Studio ops: Frequent, repeat bookings; prefers Verified Studios; cares
about schedule reliability.

Creator collab buyer: Seeks socialreach deliverables (IG/TT/YT posts)
with verification and postingwindow guarantees.

C\) Brief Composer (Quick & Full)

Required first step (Quick Brief = \~60s; Full Brief for complex jobs):

Project basics: Role(s), city/radius, date(s)/time(s), duration.

Goal & deliverables: Presets (e.g., "10 edited photos (3kpx), 2 vertical
videos (1080×1920, ≤60s)") + Influence presets (IG Collab, Story
Mentions, TT Post, YT Short) with posting window & min live.

Style refs: Moodboard upload/links; keywords.

Budget: Range or fixed; Budget sanity meter (compares to city/role
median).

Location: Pick Verified Studio or "Buyer provides address" (masked until
award); travel radius/fee toggle.

Eligibility & safety: IDVerified/Trustedonly toggles, NDA toggle, Nudity
& Boundaries (if models involved; artisticnudity only).

Model specifics (if applicable): Look filters + nudity tier + chaperone
policy + social metrics filters.

Timeline: response deadline, delivery date.

Docs preview: Shows the Smart Docs pack (SOW, License, Release, NDA if
toggled) that will autoattach on award.

Privacy: Hide brand name until award (toggle).

D\) Smart Invite & RFP Broadcast

Smart Invite (free):

System suggests 8--15 bestfit providers (role, availability, distance,
price fit, Rep Score, social metrics).

Buyer can edit and send invites (free). Providers get a consolidated
request thread with Quick Quote.

RFP Broadcast (creditsbased):

Sends the brief to a wider pool of eligible providers (IDVerified, Rep ≥
70, no safety flags).

Pricing: credit packs (e.g., 5 for \$29).

Guardrails: min budget floors by city/role/duration; 1 live
broadcast/role per buyer; template checks to reduce spam/underpay.

E\) Proposal & Pricing UX (Provider)

Quick Quote (≈60s): select package, price, availability, short note;
optional addons (travel, extra edits, overtime).

Full Proposal: itemized deliverables (incl. social deliverables),
schedule/milestones, licensing line items, portfolio links.

No proposal peeking: providers don't see others' bids.

F\) Compare & Award (applestoapples + escrow)

Compare view: normalized grid: Price, What's included, Rep Score, Badges
(ID/Trusted/Studio), Travel, Change/Overtime, Social posting window,
Notes.

Fit Score (0--100): assistive signal explaining match to brief (style,
budget, distance, availability).

Award flow: select winner → escrow deposit (default 50%, configurable) →
Smart Docs esign session opens → booking created.

G\) Documents & ESign (Smart Docs)

Autoattach pack on award: Service Agreement/SOW, License/Usage Addendum,
Model Release, Property/Studio Release (if needed), NDA (if toggled),
Safety Addendum (if Nudity Tier \> Lingerie).

Esign: draw/type with audit trail (IP, timestamp, device).

Gate: Checkin blocked until required docs are signed. Escrow won't
release without docs + acceptance.

H\) Delivery Room (storagesane delivery with verification)

Manifest = source of truth: Autogenerated from accepted quote
(counts/specs).

Storage model:

Previews on platform: webres photos & 720p video proxies; watermarks
allowed for previews.

Originals external: Google Drive / Dropbox / OneDrive / Box / S3
presigned owned by provider.

Ingestion:

OAuth mode (preferred): pull file list/metadata → pin manifest
(names/sizes/MIME/URLs).

Linkonly mode: paste share URLs; we crawl to create a readonly manifest.

Checksums: compute hashes for onplatform files; store length/etag for
externals; providers may paste SHA256 for finals.

Autochecks on upload: count, type/codec, pixel dimensions,
bitrate/duration, color profile, no watermarks on finals.

"All finals delivered" provider toggle validates against manifest.

I\) Acceptance, Revisions & AutoAccept

Technical acceptance: once autochecks pass, Buyer Review window opens.

Buyer Review: default 3 days (packageconfigurable) to accept, partial
accept (per milestone/group), or request inscope revisions (1 round
included).

Autoaccept: if buyer inactive after 3 days and autochecks passed, system
autoaccepts remaining deliverables; escrow releases per §1.3.

Change orders: outofscope requests routed to paid Change Order.

J\) Influence/Promo Deliverables (verification & enforcement)

Presets: IG Collab Post + Story Mentions; TikTok Post (+Duet/Stitch
optional); YouTube Short + Community Post.

Posting window & minimum live: buyer sets (e.g., post within 72h, remain
live ≥7 days).

Verification:

If accounts linked via OAuth, system autoverifies URL and monitors live
status.

If not linked, provider submits the public URL; system captures a
snapshot & status; buyer confirms.

Noncompliance: autoopens a deliverable dispute → 24h cure window →
partial refund equal to the allocated value if missed/removed.

K\) Attendance, NoShows, Disputes (fast, evidencebased)

Checkin/out: both parties tap Start/End (geofenced, ±60 min).

Evidence log: timestamps, geotags, chat/call logs (durations),
manifests, behindthescenes snaps.

Buyer noshow / late cancel: refunds per policy (e.g., 72--24h = 50%
payout; \<24h = 100% payout).

Provider noshow: buyer 100% refund + goodwill credit; provider
reliability strike & Instant Book pause.

Deliverables shortfall: 48h cure window; else partial refund
proportional to undelivered items.

Subjective disputes: one revision → Neutral Review (scopebased outcome:
reedit or partial refund).

Safety exception: fee waivers/credits as needed; safety review
autoopens.

L\) Boards & Collaboration

Boards: named shortlists with status tags ("New, Invited, Proposed,
Awarded").

Teamwork: \@mentions, comments, polls; readonly share link; optional NDA
gate for external reviewers.

Live freshness: cards show availability chips and price updates; stale
badge after 14 days.

Concierge Light (free, automated): AI refines brief, suggests
scope/budget, drafts invites, schedules top 3 for 15min slots; nudges
for NDA and verifiedonly toggles.

Human Concierge (pilot; budgets ≥ \$3k): coordinator curates talent,
wrangles schedules/deliverables; free at launch in founding cities;
later optional 2% success fee (postliquidity).

U\) Why this works

Clear scope → fewer disputes: Smart Docs + normalized quotes + manifests
make expectations explicit.

Storage costs contained: We host previews & paperwork; originals stay in

SubSection 3.6 --- Seller Tools & Workflows (Models • Photographers •
Videographers • Creators)

Goal: Give sellers a fast, repeatable workflow that turns profile views
into booked, wellscoped jobs---and makes delivery, disputes, and payouts
painless. Tools are roleaware, storagesane, and trustfirst. Monetization
remains usagebased (no subscriptions at launch).

A\) Principles

Publish in minutes, improve forever: ship an MVP service profile
quickly; refine with datadriven suggestions.

Roleaware, single account: one login, multiple service profiles (Model /
Photographer / Videographer / Creator) with clean separation in search
and reviews.

Clarity prevents disputes: packages, Smart Docs, Delivery Room
manifests, and timeboxed review windows make outcomes objective.

Storagesane by default: previews on platform; originals remain in
seller's cloud (Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/Box/S3 links).

Trust earns advantages: verification & reputation unlock Instant Book,
tiebreaks, Early Payout, RFP priority---never paytowin.

B\) Seller Onboarding Wizard (10--12 minutes, roleaware)

Step 1 --- Choose roles: Model / Photographer / Videographer / Creator
(can add more later).\
Step 2 --- Portfolio basics: upload perrole cover image(s), 12--24
highlights; set Nudity Tier & Comfort (Models/Creators).\
Step 3 --- Packages (per role): pick package templates (below), add
price/duration/what's included, turnaround time, revision policy,
overtime & change rates.\
Step 4 --- Addons: travel (matrix), extra looks/edits, rush delivery,
social posts, studio rental addon, hair/makeup partner, etc.\
Step 5 --- Availability: weekly schedule blocks, Instant Book windows,
buffers, travel time logic; connect calendar (ICS).\
Step 6 --- Location: base city, service radius, touring dates (for
traveling models/creators).\
Step 7 --- Safety & preferences: chaperone welcomed/required, genderpref
team (optional), boundaries.\
Step 8 --- Pricing strategy: enable intro discount (first 3 bookings),
lastminute fill (autodiscount empty slots), minimum price guardrail.\
Step 9 --- Connect social: IG/YT/TT/X for verified chips & search
filters (per §1.2 addendum).\
Step 10 --- Verification prompts: ID (to unlock Instant Book),
optionally Background (Trusted Pro), Studio Lite (if applicable).\
Publish → profile QA checklist + "What improves ranking" tips (response
time, verified docs, price fit).

C\) Package Templates & AddOns (per role)

Templates are opinionated defaults sellers can edit---keeps quotes
comparable & reduces scope creep.

Photographer

Starter Session (60--90 min): X looks, X edited photos (e.g., 10), raw
previews for selection, 7day delivery, 1 revision.

HalfDay / FullDay: timebased; includes lighting, basic studio backdrop;
deliverables by count (e.g., 25/50 edits).

Campaign Shoot: team coordination, shot list, licensing preset
(web/social/paid ads tiers).

Videographer

ShortForm: 1--3 vertical edits ≤60s; footage capture + edit; licensed
music option.

Product Video: 30--60s hero + cutdowns; basic motion graphics; color &
sound pass.

Event Coverage: hours + deliverable minutes, highlight & social reels.

Model

Lookbook / Ecomm: rate + number of looks; posing & outfit changes; usage
preset (web/social).

Creative/Editorial: half/full day; boundaries & chaperone policy
surfaced.

UGC Package: selfshot stills/videos per brief + Influence addons
(posts/stories).

Creator (Influence)

IG Post + Story Pack, TikTok Post + Duet/Stitch, YouTube Short +
Community Post with posting window & min live duration (autoverified per
§3.5).

Addons (crossrole): extra edits/looks, rush 48h, studio addon (price per
hour), HMUA partner, assistant, BTS content, extended licensing, raw
file addon (limited), travel matrix tiers, overtime (per 30m).

D\) Availability, Calendar & Touring

Instant Book windows: sellers choose days/times eligible for IB; buffers

Blackouts & holds: dragtoblock; softhold expires after X hours if buyer

E\) Inbox & Lead Pipeline (built on §1.4 Messaging)

Delivered → Completed → Archived.

K\) Seller Analytics (launch set)

Funnel: search appearances → profile views → messages → quotes sent →

N\) KPIs & Targets (first 90 days / city)

Activation: ≥ 50% of new sellers publish ≥1 package within 7 days.

P\) Why this works

Less friction, more bookings: sellers launch fast, quote faster, and
