§3.7 --- Reviews, Reputation & Incentives

Goal: Capture highsignal, lowfriction feedback after every booking; turn
reliability and respect into visible trust; reward great behavior with
small but meaningful advantages---without creating paytowin or review
gaming.

A\) Principles

Only from verified interactions. Reviews and references originate only
from completed onplatform bookings (or marked "Completed --
TFP/Collab").

Doubleblind & timeboxed. Both sides review; neither sees the other's
until both submit or the window closes.

Roleaware & fair. Reviews are per role
(Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSubscription Creator);
search/rank use rolespecific scores.

Evidence over rhetoric. Objective signals (attendance, deliverable
manifests, timing) carry more weight than freetext opinions.

Positive incentives, not paywalls. Rewards for reliability and
verification; never for positive sentiment specifically.

B\) When & how reviews happen (flow)

Trigger: When a booking moves to Completed (acceptance or autoaccept),
both parties receive review prompts.

Window: 7 days to submit; if one party submits, the other has 7 days
from that moment; then publish simultaneously.

Noshow / cancelled: If a side is deemed NoShow or Provider/Buyer Cancel
-- Late, the counterpart may leave a review; flagged with an Event label
(e.g., "Noshow").

TFP/Collab: Reviews allowed; labeled "Collab (no cash)".

Dispute coordination: If a dispute is open, the system delays
publication until resolution; reviews then publish with a Resolved
badge.

C\) Review structure (roleaware rubric)

Star rating (overall): 1--5 stars (halfstars allowed).\
Subratings (1--5, shown on profiles; weight into Reputation Score):

For Providers (e.g., Photographers/Videographers/Creators/Models as
hired talent)

Professionalism & Respect (onset conduct; comfort boundaries honored).

Communication (pre/during/post).

Reliability (ontime, prepared; aligns with checkin/checkout).

Quality vs Scope (deliverables matched the agreed brief/manifest).

Safety & Comfort (Models/Creators) (for bookings with talent; chaperone,
privacy).

For Buyers/Brands (visible to providers)

Clarity of Brief (scope, references, decisions).

Communication.

Reliability & Timeliness (arrived, stayed on schedule).

Respect & Safety (professional set, boundaries honored).

Payments & Approvals (escrow, acceptance, change orders handled
promptly).

Attachments (optional, storagesane):

Up to 3 preview images or short proxy clips (for context), or link to
public proof URL (e.g., verified promo post).

All attachments follow the artisticonly policy; no explicit content.

Private feedback to platform (not public): single freetext box for
safety/moderation signals.

D\) What displays on profiles & search cards

Overall role rating (e.g., 4.8) + rating histogram + \# of verified
reviews.

Recent highlights (last three reviews, 2line excerpts).

Badges & signals: ID Verified, Trusted Pro, Studio Verified,
SocialVerified, FanSubscription Creator (18+ gated).

Operational stats (last 90 days):

Ontime rate (arrived/start on time), Completion rate (jobs finished),
Dispute rate, Response time (median).

Verified references counter: number of completed onplatform
collaborations.

For buyers: a Buyer Rep panel is shown to providers (see §H).

Search cards include: Rep Score ring, average rating, count, last90day
ontime %, and badges.

E\) Reputation Score (0--100) --- computation & decay (refined)

Purpose: A quick, explainable trust signal; used in ranking as a
tiebreak (never overrides relevance/filters) and to gate certain
privileges (e.g., Boost eligibility, Instant Book).

Inputs & weights (roleaware; timeweighted):

Reviews & volume --- 40%

Bayesianadjusted average of overall star ratings (per role) using a
Wilson score prior, with recency weighting (last 90 days ×1.5).

Reliability & policy --- 25%

Ontime start %, completion rate, noshow/cancel strikes (negative weights
with decay), doc compliance before checkin.

Responsiveness --- 10%

Median first response time; reply rate to invites/RFP.

Verifications --- 15%

ID (base), Trusted Pro (+), Studio Verified (+), SocialVerified (+
small).

Recent performance --- 10%

Last 90day job NPS ("Would you book again?" Yes/No), dispute outcomes.

Decay & floors:

Strikes and poor events decay 25% per 90 days of clean activity.

New accounts show "New --- building reputation" until ≥3 verified
reviews (prevents low initial scores).

Gaming protection:

Volume weighting cap: one job cannot change score by \>3 pts.

Reciprocal review detection: correlated 5star exchanges get
downweighted.

Anomaly flags: suspicious IP/device overlaps; cluster analysis for ring
behavior; autoaudit queue.

F\) Incentives & achievements (behavior shaping)

Universal (roleagnostic):

Complete your first 3 jobs on time → "OnTime Streak" badge + +10 DM
credits.

\<1hour median response for 30 days → "Fast Responder" badge + search
tiebreak +1 (only in equal matches).

Complete ID → Instant Book + +20 DM credits.

Trusted Pro → Provider fee --0.5%, RFP priority, \$15 Boost coupon (per
§3.3).

Studio Verified → appears in studio filter; prioritized in "Studios in
\[City\]" carousels.

Rolespecific bonus nudges (examples):

Models/Creators: "Boundary Pro" (5 bookings with 'Safety & Comfort'
≥4.8) → profile highlight chip.

Photographers/Videographers: "Spec Perfect" (10 jobs with 100% manifest
pass, ≤1 revision) → small search nudge in equal ties.

FanSubscription Creators: "Promo Deliveries 10/10" (all posts verified
within window) → featured eligibility in "Reliable Promo" carousel.

Review completion incentives (neutral):

Completing any review within window → +5 DM credits (regardless of
rating).

No incentives for positive ratings (to avoid bias).

G\) Antigaming, moderation & appeals

Content policy filters: NLP and rulebased filters for
hate/harassment/doxxing/explicit content; block or route to moderation.

Defamation & proof: Fact claims (e.g., "stole equipment") must include
evidence (moderator can request); otherwise convert to opinion phrasing
or remove.

Extortion policy: Prohibit "change deliverables or I'll leave 1★";
report → fast moderation; outcomes: warning → strike → suspension.

Right of reply: Public owner reply allowed once per review; edit window
for typos 30 minutes postpublish.

Appeals: If review violates policy or is demonstrably false, removal or
redaction; SLA ≤5 business days.

Shadowweighting: Reviews from accounts with anomaly flags contribute
reduced weight without visible deletion (preserves transparency while
limiting harm).

Killswitch: If toxicity rate \> 0.8% of reviews in a 7day window,
tighten filters and increase human sampling.

H\) Buyer/Brand Reputation (visible to providers)

Buyer Rep (0--100) components:

Payments & approvals: escrow timely, acceptance within window.

Reliability: ontime arrival/start, cancellation/noshow rate.

Respect & Safety: subrating from providers; safety flags (sealed).

Dispute rate & outcomes.

Display to providers: Buyer Rep ring, recent labels ("Pays on time",
"Clear briefs"), and counts (repeat rate).

Gates: RFP Broadcast requires IDVerified; poor Buyer Rep can trigger
manual review on broadcasts.

I\) How Reviews & Rep affect ranking & access (guardrails)

Search ranking order: relevance → availability → distance → price fit →
Rep tiebreak → minor nudges (Verified/Trusted/Studio).

Boost eligibility (per §3.3): Rep ≥75 and IDVerified; safety flags
disable paid delivery.

Instant Book gating: Rep \<70 or recent strike → IB disabled until 30
clean days or after remediation.

Visibility throttles: Repeated disputes/late cancels lower impression
share temporarily (gradual recovery with clean activity).

J\) Notifications & UX copy (snippets)

"Review ready": "Your project with {Name} is complete---share how it
went (2 minutes). Your feedback publishes after both sides submit or in
7 days."

"Keep it respectful": "Reviews should be factual and professional. We
remove harassment, doxxing, or explicit content."

"Appeal received": "Thanks. Our team will review and respond within 5
business days. We may request evidence."

"Streak earned": "OnTime Streak unlocked: +10 DM credits and a profile
badge visible in search."

K\) KPIs & targets (first 90 days / city)

Review completion rate: ≥70% (bothsided) within 7 days.

Median time to first review: ≤24h postcompletion.

Toxicity rate: ≤0.5% of reviews flagged; confirmed violations ≤0.2%.

Disputeadjusted bias: rating drift after disputes ≤0.3★ (fairness).

Correlation to outcomes: Rep Score topquartile → ≥20% higher
inquiry→booking vs baseline.

Appeals SLA: ≤5 business days average resolution.

Noshow reduction: repeat noshows drop ≥30% after streak/strike logic.

L\) Acceptance criteria (mark 3.7 FINAL)

Doubleblind reviews with 7day window, simultaneous publish, and
disputeaware delay.

Rolespecific subratings live; attachments limited to previews/proxies;
private feedback channel.

Profile displays: overall & histogram, recent highlights, badges,
last90day ops stats, verified references.

Reputation Score computed per role with Bayesian/Wilson, recency
weighting, decay, and antigaming caps.

Buyer Rep visible to providers with components above; broadcast gates
enforced.

Incentives (streaks, fast responder, verification rewards) wired;
neutral reviewcompletion credits.

Moderation & appeals tooling: filters, evidence requests,
redaction/removal, public reply, SLAs.

Ranking integration and feature gates (Boost eligibility, Instant Book
thresholds, impression throttles).

Analytics & alerts for completion rate, toxicity, fairness, anomaly/ring
detection.

M\) Why this works

Trust you can see: Reviews are verified by bookings; objective ops stats
back up the story.

Fair to new users: Bayesian/Wilson and recency avoid "coldstart"
penalties and onereview whiplash.

Behavior improves: Streaks and small nudges reward what
matters---ontime, respectful, responsive, within scope.

Hard to game: Doubleblind, anomaly detection, and evidenceweighted
scoring blunt collusion and retaliation.

Brandsafe: Clear policy lines, 18+ gating for sensitive roles, and fast
moderation keep content and tone professional.

§3.8 --- Growth Loops & Retention

Goal: Turn first actions into habits and habits into repeat bookings.
Build crossside loops (buyers ↔ sellers), selfreinforcing trust loops
(verification → bookings → reviews → ranking), and content loops (feeds,
boards, case studies) --- without paywalls and without harming fairness.

A\) Principles

Value → habit: Every loop must deliver immediate value (leads, clarity,
or time saved) within a user's first 7--14 days.

Crossside by design: Features should create interactions that pull the
other side back (invites, tags, verified posts).

Trust amplifies growth: Verification, ontime behavior, and clean
delivery unlock visibility---not payment.

Polite, predictable comms: Fewer, better notifications with frequency
caps and onetap controls.

Roleaware, safe: One account, multiple roles; feeds and alerts respect
18+ Safe Mode and artisticonly policy.

B\) Lifecycle Model & Health Metrics (how we decide what to trigger)

Stages (per side):

New (days 0--7): Profile/brief created; hasn't sent a quote (seller) or
award (buyer).

Activated (days 7--30): ≥1 meaningful action (seller: Quick Quote sent;
buyer: Smart Invite/RFP sent).

Habit (30--90): ≥2 completed bookings; reply median ≤ 2h; repeat rate ≥
25%.

Risk: 14 days of inactivity and pending leads or saved searches.

Churn: 45 days no meaningful action.

Core health metrics:

Activation rate, time to first inquiry/quote/award, repeat bookings %,
time between bookings, saved search alerts → booking %, winback %.

C\) Core Loops (what pulls users back)

1\) Supplyside loops (sellers: Models/Photogs/Videographers/Creators)

Profile → Discovery → Lead → Quote → Booking → Review → Rank lift → More
Discovery

"Improve fit" hints on profile (pricefit index, missing ID, response
time) show impact estimate ("+12% more invites").

Tagging loop: after each booking, both parties can tag each other in
1--3 portfolio items; tagged approvals add those posts to both profiles
and surface to each other's followers.

Case study loop: postcompletion, onetap "Create case study" (cover + 3
images + 150 words). Case studies populate city/role showcases and boost
discovery.

Rebooking loop

Auto "Book again" button appears to the buyer 7/30/90 days after certain
packages (e.g., monthly content), prefilled with last scope + adjusted
dates.

2\) Demandside loops (buyers/brands)

Saved Search → Alert → Smart Invite/RFP → Compare → Award → Favorite →
Board revisit

Saved Searches with ANY/ALL filters (incl. social metrics, nudity tiers,
Verified/Trusted) send newmatch alerts (1/day max per search).

Board updates: when a profiled provider updates availability, gains a
badge, or posts a relevant case study, boards with that provider show a
"Fresh" chip and optional digest.

Template briefs: last 3 briefs saved as templates; 1click Reopen brief
and Rebroadcast (consumes credits per §3.5).

3\) Content loops (feeds & follow)

Follow → Feed → Inquiry → Booking → Tag → Feed

Single unified feed per user with role tabs
(Model/Photog/Vid/Creator/FanSub Creator). Posting is once, tagged by
role(s); viewers filter by role.

Feed pulls: new case studies, availability cards ("Now booking
Saturday"), touring chips ("Visiting Austin 11/20--11/22"), Verified
Studio open slots, and Verified influence posts delivered (SFW preview +
"Verified" tick).

Safe Mode default keeps 18+ content hidden until toggled; feed respects
nudity tiers & policy.

4\) Social share loop (offplatform → onplatform)

Sharecard generator: onetap export of profile/case study as socialready
images (IG/TT) with QR + booking link.

Linkinbio minisite (autogenerated) shows packages, availability, contact
CTA; UTM tags attribute inbound traffic.

5\) Verification loop (trust → visibility → bookings)

Completing ID unlocks Instant Book + DM credits → higher
inquiry→booking.

Trusted Pro (BG) grants fee nudge, RFP priority, Boost coupon → more
awards → more reviews → Rep Score up → ranking tiebreaks.

D\) Retention Features (per user type)

Sellers

Lead Inbox nudges: "Reply within 2h to keep Fast Responder badge."

Utilization alerts: "You have 4 open IB slots this weekend; enable
LastMinute Fill for +18% leads."

Smart "Raise price" hints when win rate \>70% and price well below city
median.

Touring assist: suggest nearby cities and dates based on follower
heatmap; autocreate "Visiting \[City\]" chip.

Buyers

Shortlist intelligence: "3 of your saved photogs now Instant Book next
Friday."

Availability windows: "Top models in your board opened 8--10pm Fri."

Budget guardrails: recommendations to adjust range for ≥3 qualified
responses.

"Book again" reminders synced to last project cadence.

E\) Referrals & Credits (twosided, abuseresistant)

Provider invites provider: both get +20 DM credits after invitee
publishes a package and completes 1 booking.

Buyer invites buyer: inviter gets 1 RFP credit when invitee posts a
brief and awards a booking.

Crossside referrals: if a provider invites a buyer who books them, both
get \$15 buyer credit toward next booking (used on buyer fee only).

Guardrails: peruser monthly caps; ID required to redeem; same device/IP
fraud detection; clawback if first booking is refunded for fraud.

F\) Saved Searches, Alerts & Digests

Saved search alerts: new matches batched 1/day/search; "turn off for 30
days" easy toggle.

Weekly city digest (optin): featured case studies, Verified Studios with
open slots, "Top rising creators" (Rep + recent growth).

Postbooking digest: 7 days after completion---review reminder, case
study prompt, "book again" CTA.

G\) Follows, Favorites & Boards (organization that retains)

Follow counts on profiles; Following tab shows only updates from
accounts you follow.

Favorites folders/Boards: draganddrop; status tags autoupdate
(Invited/Proposed/Awarded).

Share boards externally (readonly) with optional NDA gate; activity
pings when providers on a board go Verified or open IB slots.

H\) Notifications & Frequency Caps

Channels: inapp, email, push (optin), SMS (critical only).

Global caps: max 2 push/day, 3 email/week by default; digest merges
alerts.

User controls: pertopic toggles (Saved searches, Boards, Touring, Case
studies, Instant Book windows).

Quiet hours: localtime 10pm--8am (nonurgent push deferred).

Respect Safe Mode: 18+ gated content never appears in public emails;
only visible inapp with toggle ON.

I\) WinBack & Churn Save

Risk cohort (14 days idle): send "quick action" emails ("Publish 1
package template in 60s" / "Send 3 Smart Invites from your board").

Churn cohort (45 days idle): offer \$15 buyer credit or +20 DM credits
if they complete a booking within 14 days.

Exit survey on deactivation: reasons (price, low leads, complexity,
safety). Autocreate remedial tasks (e.g., "Enable ID to unlock IB").

Pause mode: let users pause discovery (hide from search) without
deleting; set autoresume.

J\) Feed & Posting (roleaware, one post → many views)

One composer with role tags; viewers filter by role.

Post types: Case study, Availability card, Touring card, "Looking
for..." (LFM/LFP rolegated), Verified promo delivered (SFW preview).

Ranking: follows → samecity trending → recommended (Repweighted).

Moderation: AI + human; artisticonly policy; Safe Mode hides 18+ until
toggled.

K\) Experiments (first 8--12 weeks)

Saved search alert frequency: immediate vs daily batch.

"Book again" reminder timing: +14 vs +30 days.

Case study autoprompt: shown at acceptance vs at review submission.

Referral reward mix: DM credits vs \$ buyer credits impact on bookings.

Feed ranking weights: followheavy vs citytrending weight.

Touring chip CTR: prominent vs subtle card.

L\) KPIs & Targets (90day per city)

Activation: sellers sending a first Quick Quote ≥ 55%; buyers sending a
first Smart Invite/RFP ≥ 60%.

Habit: ≥ 30% of activated users complete 2+ bookings in 60 days.

Repeat: ≥ 35% of bookings are repeat buyer↔provider pairings by month 6.

Saved searches: alert → click ≥ 18%; click → booking ≥ 6%.

Boards: ≥ 45% of active buyers maintain ≥1 board; board revisit rate ≥
2×/month.

Referrals: ≥ 15% of new users join via invite; fraud rate on referrals
\< 1%.

Winback: ≥ 12% of risk cohort reactivated; ≥ 8% of churn cohort return
within 30 days.

Feed: poster → inbound inquiry uplift ≥ 10% vs nonposters; toxicity \<
0.5%.

M\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.8 FINAL)

Saved searches with ANY/ALL logic (incl. social metrics and nudity
tiers), daily batched alerts, onetap unsubscribe.

Follows/Boards with status tags, external share links, and board refresh
"Fresh" chips.

Unified feed with role filters, Safe Mode gating, availability/touring
cards, case studies, verified promo posts.

Referral system (twosided) with caps, KYC gating, fraud checks, and
credit types (DM, RFP, buyer fee credit).

Rebooking buttons with prefilled scopes; brief templates and onetap
rebroadcasts.

Lead & utilization nudges, pricefit hints, touring assist.

Comms controls & caps (channels, quiet hours, Safe Mode email policy).

Winback flows for risk/churn; pause mode; exit survey & remediation
tasks.

Analytics: lifecycle stage dashboards, loop performance (saved search →
booking, referral ROAS, feed → inquiry).

N\) Why this works

Selfreinforcing: Each completed job seeds reviews, tags, case studies,
and "book again" triggers that bring both sides back.

Buyer clarity = speed: Saved searches, boards, and brief templates
shrink timetoaward.

Fair & safe: Visibility comes from trust and performance; Safe Mode
protects brand and compliance.

Costefficient: Credits (DM/RFP/buyer fee) and smart nudges drive
retention without monthly paywalls.

§3.9 --- Support, Refunds, Disputes & Knowledge Base

Goal: Resolve issues quickly and fairly, protect users in urgent
situations, keep most cases selfserve, and preserve trust & margins.
Make outcomes predictable (clear matrices), evidencebased (manifests,
checkin/out, verified posts), and brandsafe.

A\) Principles

Selfserve first, human when needed. Most changes/cancellations/refunds
can be initiated inthread and settled automatically under clear rules.

Evidence \> rhetoric. We rely on Delivery Room manifests, autochecks,
checkin/out, and Smart Docs to decide.

Timeboxed resolution. Cure windows and decision SLAs keep money and
media from lingering.

Safety has priority. P0 lifesafety routes to Safety team immediately;
fees are waived where appropriate.

Transparent playbook. The same refund matrix applies to everyone; it's
visible in the KB.

B\) Contact Channels & Triage

Channels (launch):

Inthread "Get help" (contextual flows for that booking).

Account Help (global: billing, verification, policy).

Email/webform fallback.

Triage & priority:

P0 --- Safety/Emergency (live/just occurred): response target ≤ 5 min,
24/7 oncall.

P1 --- Timecritical booking (\<24h): response ≤ 30 min during coverage
hours.

P2 --- Active booking / delivery in progress: ≤ 4 h.

P3 --- General/billing/policy: ≤ 1 business day.

Selfserve flows available from "Get help":

Change date/time, add/remove addons, adjust travel, request refund,
report noshow, report safety issue, delivery problem, chargeback info,
verification help.

C\) Refund & Adjustment Matrix (default policy)

Packages can raise/lower strictness within allowed bands; stricter terms
must be surfaced at checkout and inside Smart Docs.

1\) Cancellations & NoShows

2\) Delivery Shortfalls & Quality

3\) Influence/Promo Deliverables (IG/TT/YT/X)

4\) Travel & Location

Safety exception: If a party flags unsafe conduct (harassment, unsafe
set), we waive platform fees, refund appropriately, and open a Safety
case.

D\) Dispute Process (structured & fast)

Open from "Get help" → choose reason.

Collect evidence: system preattaches manifest, autochecks, checkin/out,
chat. Parties add statements & files.

Cure window: provider gets 48h for technical shortfalls; buyer gets 24h
to supply missing info (e.g., link URLs).

Neutral Review (if unresolved): trained specialists compare against
Smart Docs & manifest; may request targeted files only (no fishing).

Decision: prorata refunds, reedit orders, or uphold delivery.

Payouts adjust automatically; receipts reissued.

Appeal (facts or policy error only): ≤ 5 business days SLA.

E\) Chargebacks & Payments Ops

Prechargeback rescue: autopropose settlement to buyer if they initiate
dispute with their bank; surface evidence inapp.

Representment kit (if chargeback filed): signed SOW/release, manifest,
acceptance logs, checkin/out, comms timeline.

Fees: platform absorbs processor dispute fees unless clear abuse →
losing party may be charged a small dispute handling fee (see §3.1).

Risk dials: newprovider reserve; rolling reserves for highrisk cohorts;
Early Payout eligibility aligns with Rep ≥ 85 (see §3.2/§3.1).

Thresholds: keep chargeback ratio \<0.8%; above that → cohort risk
review; instant IB disable for outliers.

F\) Safety & Content Policy Escalations

SIRT (Safety Incident Response Team): oncall; responds ≤ 5 min to P0;
preserves evidence; may freeze funds.

Interim measures: temporary Instant Book disable, ad/boost suppression,
search visibility throttle.

Enforcement: threestrike model; immediate suspension for severe policy
breaches (e.g., explicit sexual content, violence, doxxing).

Law enforcement: cooperate under valid legal requests; strict privacy
controls.

G\) Knowledge Base (KB) & InProduct Help

KB structure (public):

Booking & Payments: escrow, milestones, payouts, fees, taxes.

Cancellations & Refunds: matrices, examples, timelines.

Deliverables: Delivery Room, manifests, previews vs originals, external
storage (Drive/Dropbox), checksum tips.

Influence Deliverables: posting windows, OAuth linking, URL proof,
dispute examples.

Documents: Smart Docs packs, esign, minor/guardian, safety addendum,
licensing.

Verification: ID, Background (Trusted Pro), Studio Lite, Social.

Search & Roles: nudity tiers, Safe Mode, FanSubscription Creator policy.

Safety: onset guidelines, reporting, chaperone policy, what happens
after a report.

City promos & credits: RFP credits, buyer credits, DM credits.

Legal & Privacy: data we store (attestations), retention, appeals.

Inproduct help:

Tooltips for fee math, cancel windows, deliverable specs.

Inline checklists (e.g., "Pass autochecks: JPEG sRGB, 3000px+").

"Why this decision?" link on outcomes.

H\) Internal Tools (Agent Console)

Unified case view (thread + booking + payments + verification).

Oneclick outcomes: prorata refund %, reedit order, fee waivers.

Evidence viewer: manifests, checkin/out map, file autocheck results,
social verification logs.

Policy macros: cancellation matrix variants, safety scripts,
adverseaction (BG) templates.

Account controls: IB toggle, visibility throttle, boost suppress,
temporary hold.

Ledger safety: doubleentry adjustments; immutable audit log.

I\) SLAs, Coverage & Staffing

Coverage: Safety 24/7; general support 16×5 at launch (expand to 24×7 by
city #3).

Response targets: P0 ≤ 5 min; P1 ≤ 30 min; P2 ≤ 4 h; P3 ≤ 1 biz day.

Resolution targets: P1 ≤ 12 h; P2 ≤ 48 h; P3 ≤ 3 biz days.

Houston pilot staffing: 1 Safety lead (oncall rotation), 2--3
generalists (day/evening), parttime adjudicator for Neutral Reviews.

J\) Metrics & Guardrails

CSAT: ≥ 4.6/5; FRT & TTR on target per priority.

Autoresolution rate: ≥ 50% of cases resolved selfserve.

Refund leakage: within plan; buyer fee refunds only on provider
fault/safety.

Dispute reopen rate: \< 8%.

Chargeback ratio: \< 0.8%; representment win rate \> 55%.

Safety: P0 median ≤ 3 min, repeat offenders caught; policy violations \<
0.3% of bookings.

Fairness: outcomes distribution consistent across roles/cities (monitor
for bias).

K\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 3.9 FINAL)

Selfserve flows live: date/time change, addons, travel adj, refund
request, noshow, delivery problem, safety report.

Refund engine implements matrices above, with autocure windows and
prorata calculations.

Dispute center inthread: evidence collection, timers, Neutral Review
workflow, decision & receipts reissue.

Chargeback kit generator; reserves & IB gating rules wired.

Safety pipeline: P0 hotline, IB/boost suppress toggles, evidence
preservation.

KB published; inline tips & "Why this decision?" links live.

Agent console: macros, ledger adjustments, audit logs.

Analytics dashboards: CSAT, FRT/TTR, refund leakage, reopen, chargeback,
safety SLA.

L\) Why this works

Predictable & fair: Users see the same rules we apply; most outcomes are
obvious from the matrix.

Fast & scalable: Selfserve, timers, and autochecks keep humans for edge
cases.

Trustpreserving: Safety first, evidencedriven decisions, and fee
policies aligned with fault.

Marginaware: Buyer fee refunds only on provider fault; prorata logic
prevents overrefunds; chargeback playbooks contain losses.

Addendum --- §3.9 Support, Refunds, Disputes & Knowledge Base (Studios)
--- FINAL

Scope: Minimal but required clarifications so §3.9 cleanly covers Studio
bookings and Linked Booking Groups (Talent + Studio in one checkout),
without changing previously approved talent policies.

A\) SelfServe Flows (additions)

Add the following quick actions under Inthread ▸ Get help:

Studio ▸ Access issue (can't enter / code not working)

Studio ▸ Damage claim (hostinitiated; requires photos & description)

Studio ▸ Postbooking adjustment (overtime / crewsize overage / rule
violation)

Linked Group ▸ Propose reschedule (sync both bookings)

Linked Group ▸ Split or cancel (show sidebyside outcomes per policy)

B\) Refund Matrices (references & summary)

Talent cancellations & disputes: unchanged (see main §3.9 matrix).

Studio cancellations: use the Studio matrix (default bands: \>7d=100%
refund; 7--48h=50%; \<48h/noshow=0%).

Linked Booking Groups (LBG): outcomes are computed per booking and shown
in one summary (e.g., "Talent: 50% refund • Studio: 0% refund"). Support
agents use the LBG outcome view when editing/issuing refunds.

C\) Evidence Sets (studiospecific)

For Studio disputes we prioritize the following system evidence
(autoattached where available):

Checkin/out timestamps + geofence pass/fail.

House Rules & Property Release esign audit logs.

Access logs (door code release/time sent; if integrated).

Before/after photos (host; timestamped).

Overtime/overage indicators (End time vs booked End; crew count notes).

Calendar state at booking time (to counter "doublebooked" claims).

(For Talent deliverable disputes, continue using Delivery Room
manifests/autochecks as primary evidence.)

D\) Standard Outcomes (studiospecific)

Access failure (host fault): buyer full refund of studio; waive buyer
fee for that booking; goodwill credit allowed.

Amenity misrepresentation: cure if feasible (e.g., provide blackout
curtains), else partial refund aligned to value impact; repeat issues →
host strike.

Overtime/crew overage/rule violations: process via Postbooking
adjustment; approve with clear evidence; refund if host lacks evidence.

Damage claim: up to the deposit hold cap; see §H.

E\) SLAs & Timers (studiospecific)

Access issue (live) → P1 (≤ 30 min response; aim to resolve on the
spot).

Damage claim window: host must open ≤ 24h after checkout; buyer response
window 48h.

Adjustment window (overtime/overage): host opens ≤ 24h; buyer response
48h.

Neutral Review (if contested): decision target ≤ 5 business days.

F\) NoShow & Early Exit (studio)

Buyer noshow: apply Studio matrix (often 0% refund); deposit is not
captured unless damage/violation claimed.

Early exit: no prorata refunds unless host agrees; overtime may still
apply if late start pushes past booked end.

G\) Chargebacks (studio specifics)

Representment kit must include: checkin/out logs, rules/release
signatures, access log evidence, house rules, before/after photos, and
any approved adjustments.\
Deposit captures are separate charges; submit damage evidence with
capture receipt.

H\) Deposit Holds & Damage Claims (operational notes)

Authorize at checkout (or 24h prior, host setting); release
automatically 48h postcheckout if no claim.

On approved claim, capture partial/full up to cap; no platform fee on
captured amount (see §3.1 addendum).

Abuse guard: frequent denied claims reduce host visibility and may
remove deposit privileges.

I\) Knowledge Base (new/updated articles)

Add/refresh articles:

Studios 101: rules, access, deposits, cleaning fees, Instant Book vs
approval.

Attach a Studio to your shoot: how the inflow picker works; what "Linked
Booking Group" means.

Damage deposits & claims: timelines, evidence, how captures work.

Overtime & adjustments: what qualifies, how to dispute.

LBG refunds explained: examples showing different outcomes for Talent vs
Studio in one checkout.

All KB entries should link to corresponding policy matrices and timers
above.

J\) Agent Console (microtooling)

LBG outcome view: sidebyside (Talent \| Studio) with autocalc; one click
to apply both outcomes.

Deposit actions: authorize/void/capture with reason codes; evidence
viewer.

Templates: "Access failure (host remedy/credit)", "Adjustment
approved/denied", "Damage capture approved/denied".

Sanctions: toggle IB off for studio; reduce visibility; flag host for
quality review.

K\) Acceptance Criteria (mark §3.9 addendum FINAL)

New selfserve actions appear for Studio & LBG cases.

Studio matrix referenced & enforced; LBG summary surfaces perbooking
outcomes.

Evidence packs autoattach for Studio disputes (checkin/out, rules,
access, photos).

Deposit lifecycle supported in Support tooling (authorize/void/capture)
with audit logs.

Timers & SLAs implemented (24h/48h/5day) for claims/adjustments/neutral
review.

KB articles created/updated; links wired from help flows.

Agent console: LBG outcome view, deposit actions, message templates,
IB/visibility sanctions.

L\) Why this is "tiny" but necessary

It reuses §3.9 structure---just adds Studiospecific buttons, timers, and
evidence.

It keeps group bookings easy to explain and adjudicate: two bookings,
one summary.

It ensures deposits don't become support landmines (clear windows,
tools, and receipts).

Section 4 --- Product Architecture & Page Map

Goal: Define a coherent, scalable UX architecture that turns our
marketplace rules into screens and flows. Keep the system roleaware
(people vs places), cityaware, SafeModebydefault, and storagesane. Bake
in trust (verification ladder, reputation), fairness (no paytowin
ranking), and booking clarity (escrow, Smart Docs, Delivery Room).\
Studios launch as space listings (not roles): a subhub + AttachinFlow
(brief/checkout), with separate bookings and policies, tied by Linked
Booking Group when purchased with talent.

A\) What Section 4 guarantees (scope & outcomes)

Every jobtobedone has a page & path. Search, profile/listing, booking,
delivery, review, dispute---no "dead ends."

One account, many offerings. A user can operate multiple Service
Profiles (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSubscription
Creator) and optional Studio listings.

Clear separation of entity types. People (roles) vs Places (studios)
remain distinct in search, reviews, policies, and payouts.

Mobilefirst, desktopstrong. A tight 5icon mobile nav; desktop topbar +
action shortcuts; both share the same mental model.

Performance, safety, and accessibility are global requirements, not
afterthoughts.

B\) Core entities (objects the UX revolves around)

Account --- one login; owns assets and settings.

Service Profile (Role) --- personbased offering: Model / Photographer /
Videographer / Creator / FanSubscription Creator.

Studio Listing (Space) --- placebased offering; can earn Verified Studio
(Lite).

Search Query --- role selector + filters; saved search + alert cadence.

Board --- buyer's collection of candidates (talent and studios) with
statuses.

Brief / RFP --- buyer's scope; generates invites/broadcasts.

Booking --- Talent or Studio booking; each has escrow, policy, timeline,
documents.

Linked Booking Group (LBG) --- bundle of a Talent booking + Studio
booking in one checkout; independent rules, synchronized time.

Thread --- messaging with attachments, quotes, docs, decisions.

Smart Docs --- SOW/License/Release/Property & House Rules; esign;
autoamend.

Delivery --- Delivery Room manifest, previews/proxies, external links,
acceptance window.

Verification --- ID, Background (Trusted Pro), SocialVerified, Studio
Lite; badge ladder.

Reputation --- 0--100 score per role; separate space reputation for
studios.

Promotion --- optional paid boosts/featured (guardrailed).

Support Case --- refund/dispute/safety workflow with evidence packs.

C\) Crosscutting UX principles (apply everywhere)

Safe Mode default ON: gates 18+ people roles & feed; studios are never
18+ gated (content must remain SFW).

Roleaware everywhere: Search, cards, reviews, analytics all show the
relevant role/space context.

AttachinFlow: When a shoot brief has a time & city, suggest compatible
studios before checkout.

Evidencefirst resolution: manifests/checkin/out/autochecks \> rhetoric.

Storagesane: previews on platform; originals via
Drive/Dropbox/OneDrive/S3 links (captured as a manifest).

Accessibility (AA) & performance budgets: keyboardable filters, strong
contrast, TTI \< 2.5s on 3G Fast, route codesplitting.

Cityaware: location chips, city selector, and saved searches all obey
the current city context.

D\) Global flows (from first visit to review)

Discover → Home/Category/Case Studies → Search (role selector + filters)
→ Profile/Listing card → Message or Instant Book.

Plan → Brief (Quick/Full) → smart invites/RFP → Compare & Boards →
Award.

Book → Checkout (escrow, docs) → (optional) Attach a Studio → Payment →
confirmation.

Work → Thread (prep) → Checkin/out (time evidence) → Delivery Room →
Acceptance.

Close → Payout → Doubleblind Reviews → Reputation updates → Growth loops
(follow/favorite/feed/case study).

If needed → Refund/Dispute/Safety → outcome per matrix with evidence.

E\) Surface families (we'll enumerate pages in §4.0)

Public

Landing, Category hubs (roles + Verified Studios (Lite) subhub), Search,
Profile (role), Studio Detail (space), Case Studies, Help Center, Auth.

Buyer

Brief Composer (Quick/Full), Compare/Award, Boards, Threads/Messages,
Checkout, LBG Summary, Delivery (read), Smart Docs (read/sign), Buyer
Dashboard (spend, teams).

Seller (roles)

Onboarding wizard (per role), Packages/Addons, Portfolio/Tagging,
Availability/Calendar, Threads, Delivery (author), Smart Docs
(author/sign), Seller Dashboard (analytics, payouts).

Host (studios)

Create/Edit Studio listing (wizard), Studio Dashboard (calendar, rules,
bookings, deposits, claims), Verification Lite status.

Crosscutting

Notifications, Verification Center, Payments & Tax, Settings & Privacy,
Support/Dispute Center.

Admin (essentials)

Support console, Safety, Promotions config, Verification review.

F\) Navigation model (the contract; full spec later in §4.1)

Desktop header: Logo • Browse (roles + Verified Studios (Lite)) • Search
• Boards/Packages (context) • Messages • Notifications • Create • Safe
Mode toggle • City • Account.

Mobile tab bar: Home • Search • Create • Messages • Profile.

Create adapts: Buyer (Brief), Seller (Package/Post), Host (Studio
Listing).

G\) Ranking & fairness contract

Result order = relevance → availability → distance → price fit → Rep
tiebreak → tiny nudges (Verified/Trusted/Studio).

Promotions never bypass filters; density caps (e.g., ≤2 in top 20) and
"Promoted" labels are mandatory.

Eligibility gates: IDVerified, Rep ≥ threshold; safety strikes suppress
IB and paid delivery.

H\) Global system rules we won't violate

Separate bookings & ledgers for Talent vs Studio (even in one checkout).

Pertype policies (refunds, deposits) applied independently; the UI shows
one LBG outcome summary to the user.

No forced subscriptions at launch; monetization is takerate + optional
boosts, verification addons, and peruse Early Payout.

I\) Performance, privacy, and safety baselines

Perf: image lazyload, skeleton cards, background prefetch for next
route, defer OAuth SDKs until needed.

Privacy: exact addresses hidden until confirmation; studio surveillance
disclosures required; minors require guardian docs.

Safety: P0 hotline, checkin/out evidence, hazard toggles inject Safety
Addendum, instant IB/boost suppression during investigations.

J\) Analytics & observability (event families)

Nav & search: nav.click, search.open, search.apply_filters,
saved_search.create/alert.open.

Discovery & boards: board.add, compare.open, invite.send, rfp.broadcast.

Bookings: booking.create.talent\|studio, booking.group.linked/split,
checkout.complete.

Docs & delivery: doc.esign, delivery.manifest_pinned,
delivery.accepted/auto_accept.

Reputation: review.submit, rep.update, strike.add/remove.

Studios: studio.create/publish/verify_lite,
studio.deposit.authorize/capture/release,
studio.adjustment.open/resolve.

Promotions: boost.purchase, featured.book.

Support: dispute.open/resolve, chargeback.open/represent.

All events include role_or_listing_type, city, and user cohort tags for
citybycity rollout measurement.

K\) Risks & mitigations (known issues, bakedin controls)

Scope creep with Studios → Mitigation: subhub + attachinflow only;
capped city inventory; clear KPIs/killswitch.

Policy confusion in LBG → Mitigation: separate booking lines, sidebyside
outcomes, pertype receipts.

Growth vs brand safety → Mitigation: Safe Mode default; artisticonly
policy; clear surveillance & hazard disclosures.

Infra cost (media) → Mitigation: previews only; externallink manifest;
virus scan on previews; cap perthread size.

Fairness perception → Mitigation: transparent ranking rules; labeled
promotions; eligibility gates.

L\) Acceptance Criteria (mark Section 4 FINAL)

Entity model (Account, Service Profile, Studio Listing, Booking, LBG,
Thread, Smart Docs, Delivery, Verification, Reputation, Promotion,
Support Case) defined and referenced consistently.

Global flows (Discover → Plan → Book → Work → Close → Support)
documented with no missing steps.

Surface families enumerated (public/buyer/seller/host/cross/admin) to
drive the Page Map in §4.0.

Nav model defined (desktop/mobile) with Safe Mode and city context
always accessible.

Ranking & fairness contract documented (relevance first; promotions
capped & labeled).

Safety/privacy/perf baselines established (Safe Mode, address privacy,
hazard toggles, perf budgets).

Analytics event families declared (to wire telemetry from day one).

Studios confirmed as space listings with subhub + AttachinFlow only at
launch; LBG contract in place.

Nongoals (full venue marketplace features) explicitly excluded from
launch scope.

M\) Why this works

Clarity → speed: Clean entities and flows make the UI obvious and the
marketplace predictable.

Scales by addition, not revision: New roles or more studio inventory
slot into the same model.

Trust is structural: Verification, Safe Mode, and separate booking
ledgers are baked into the architecture, not bolted on.

Launchable: We can ship citybycity with confidence and expand without
rewiring the product.

§4.0 --- Page Map (HighLevel)

Contract: Every user task has a screen and a clear next step. Pages are
grouped by Public, Buyer, Seller (roles), Host (studios), Crosscutting,
and Admin. Each entry lists route pattern, owner, key sections, and
primary CTAs. Mobile uses the same routes; some interactions open as
drawers/modals.

Route shape: kebabcase; city context as query (?city=houston) or chip;

Safe Mode: default ON. Hides FanSubscription Creator role & 18+ nudity
tiers; studios are unaffected (SFW media only).

L\) Why this Page Map works

Nothing missing: Every accepted feature from Sections 1--3 has a page, a
route, and a CTA.

People vs Places clarity: Service Profiles vs Studios are cleanly
separated yet connect via AttachinFlow.

Launchable & scalable: Focuses on Houstonfirst while keeping the IA
ready for multicity expansion and future categories.

Trust & safety are visible: Docs, deposits, checkin/out, and dispute
paths are firstclass---not hidden.

§4.1 --- Global Information Architecture & Navigation

Contract: Make it obvious where to go for any task. Keep People vs
Places distinct in IA, keep city & Safe Mode always available, and keep
create actions contextual (buyer vs seller vs host). All navigation
choices must support the Houstonfirst rollout and scale to multicity.

A\) IA Overview (mental model & global state)

Entities:

People (Service Profiles / roles): Model • Photographer • Videographer •
Creator • FanSubscription Creator

Places (Space listings): Studio (can be Verified Studio via Studio Lite)

Global state persistent in nav: City (chip), Safe Mode (toggle), Auth
(account), Search entry.

Discover → Plan → Book → Work → Close → Support flows are reachable from
any context within ≤2 clicks/taps.

B\) Desktop Navigation (top bar + browse)

Top bar (left → right)

Logo → Home (cityaware modules)

Browse (megamenu; hover/click)

People: Models • Photographers • Videographers • Creators •
FanSubscription Creators (18+)

Places: Verified Studios (Lite) (subhub; not a toplevel pillar)

By City: quick list (current city first)

Case Studies

Search (prominent) → opens Role/Listing selector + filters drawer

Context area (autoswitches by user type and current route)

Buyer context: Boards

Seller context: Packages

Host context: Studios (quick link to studio dashboard)

If multirole: a small dropdown to switch the context link (Boards \|
Packages \| Studios)

Messages (badge)

Notifications (bell; grouped)

Create (primary CTA dropdown; contextaware)

Buyer: New Brief (Quick) • New Brief (Full)

Seller: New Package • New Post (case study/availability)

Host: New Studio Listing

Safe Mode toggle (default ON; age confirm required to OFF)

City selector (Houston default; typeahead)

Account menu

Profile switcher (tabs: Model, Photographer, Videographer, Creator,
FanSub Creator, Studio host)

Buyer Dashboard • Seller Dashboard • Studio Dashboard

Verification Center • Payments & Tax • Settings • Help • Sign out

Header behavior

Sticky on scroll; Search and Create remain visible.

When viewing saved searches/boards, a context bar under the header shows
chips for active filters and provides Save / Edit controls.

C\) Mobile Navigation (tab bar + overflow)

Bottom tab bar (5 items)

Home (cityaware feed + modules)

Search (role selector + filters drawer)

Create (FAB; buyer/seller/host contextual)

Messages

Profile (owner view w/ role switcher tabs at the top)

Header controls (mobile)

City chip left; Safe Mode shield icon right (tap → age confirm +
toggle).

Overflow (⋯) menu: Boards, Notifications, Verification, Payments,
Settings, Help.

Sticky action bars

On Profile/Studio detail: sticky Book/Request bar.

On Search: sticky Filters / Save bar.

On Checkout: sticky Pay & Confirm bar.

D\) Search Entry Pattern (everywhere consistent)

Clicking/tapping Search opens a compact selector with six tabs:\
Model \| Photographer \| Videographer \| Creator \| FanSub Creator \|
Studio

Tabs = People (first five) and Places (Studio) --- visually separated
with a divider label.

Filters drawer (right on desktop; fullscreen on mobile) includes:

Common: city/radius, availability window, budget/price, distance,
minimum Rep, Verified/Trusted toggles.

Rolespecific (People): look & comfort (models/creators), specialties &
deliverables (photographers/videographers), promo posting windows
(FanSub Creators), perplatform social metrics (IG/YT/TT/X).

Studio (Places): price/hr, min hours, capacity, creative amenities
(natural light, cyc wall, blackout, ceiling height, loadin/parking,
makeup/dressing room, grip/lighting, etc.), Instant Book, Verified
Studio toggles.

Saved Search: clearly visible Save button with cadence control (daily
batch); confirm sheet explains alerts & Safe Mode behavior.

AttachinFlow pill: when a People search includes date/time, show "Attach
a Studio" pill above results; opens a prefiltered Studio drawer.

E\) Context Switching & Role/Host Awareness

Profile switcher (Account menu on desktop; top segmented control on
mobile Profile) lists all enabled roles and Studio host if the account
has at least one studio listing.

Context link in the header (Boards \| Packages \| Studios) automatically
reflects the most relevant workspace for the current route; quick
dropdown to change it.

Create menu always matches the current persona: posting a brief (buyer),
creating a package/post (seller), or adding a studio (host).

F\) Where key actions live (global "where do I...?" map)

View & edit my offerings (People): Account ▸ Seller Dashboard ▸
Packages/Portfolio/Calendar.

Create a studio listing (Places): Create ▸ New Studio Listing → wizard;
manage via Studio Dashboard.

Post a brief (buyers): Create ▸ New Brief (Quick/Full); invite or
broadcast from the brief.

Attach a studio to a shoot: From Brief or Talent Checkout, tap Attach a
Studio (drawer) → returns a Linked Booking Group summary.

Find inspiration: Browse ▸ Case Studies; deep link to People & Places.

Get help: Thread ▸ Get help (contextual flows) or Help Center.

G\) Safe Mode & Gating (global)

Default ON for guests and new users.

People: FanSubscription Creator and profiles with nudity tiers beyond
"Lingerie/Swim" are hidden when Safe Mode is ON.

Places (Studios): never gated by Safe Mode (studio media must remain
SFW).

Emails/push: never include 18+ previews; 18+ content visible inapp only
with Safe Mode OFF.

H\) CrossLinks & Shortcuts (reduce path length)

Profile → Invite opens Smart Invite prefilled with role, city, date
window.

Talent profile with linked studio shows "Owns/Has Studio" chip → deep
link to the Studio detail.

Studio detail shows Host card → deep link to host's People profile(s).

Boards cards expose Compare, Invite, Attach Studio, Book shortcuts.

Case Study tiles link to both the talent and any tagged studio.

I\) Header Context Bar (chips below header)

Appears on Search, Saved Search, Boards, Brief, Compare.

Shows active filter chips, city/date/time chips, and Saved state; inline
Edit and Clear actions.

On Linked Booking Group checkout, shows a twochip summary: Talent \|
Studio (tap to expand each).

J\) Error States & Auth Walls (consistent pattern)

Authrequired actions (book, message, create) route through /auth with a
return URL; copy explains benefits and Safe Mode.

404 gracefully links to Search by role with city preselected.

403 uses policy copy (e.g., 18+ gating, suspended features); provides
Help link.

K\) Accessibility, Localization & Performance (global baselines)

AA: keyboard navigable menus & drawers; ARIA on tabs/filters; obvious
focus states; colorcontrast linting in CI.

Localization: strings via i18n; USEnglish at launch; localeaware
currency/date.

Performance: routebased code splitting; image lazyload; deferral of
OAuth SDKs until needed; search TTI \< 2.5s on 3G Fast.

L\) Telemetry (navigation & IA events)

nav.click (item, location), browse.open (section), search.open
(tab=role\|studio), filters.open/apply, saved_search.create/toggle,\
context.switch (Boards\|Packages\|Studios), create.open
(brief\|package\|studio), safe_mode.toggle, city.change,\
attach_studio.open/select, lbg.checkout.open, header_context_chip.click.

M\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.1 FINAL)

Desktop header implements Browse, Search, Context link
(Boards/Packages/Studios), Messages, Notifications, Create, Safe Mode,
City, Account with Profile switcher.

Mobile tab bar implements Home, Search, Create, Messages, Profile;
overflow contains Boards, Notifications, Verification, Payments,
Settings, Help.

Role/Listing selector in Search includes
Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSub Creator/Studio with
People vs Places divider; filters drawers reflect rolespecific vs
studiospecific fields.

Attach a Studio pill appears only when a People search has date/time;
opens a prefiltered Studio drawer; selected studio persists to Linked
Booking Group checkout.

Safe Mode default ON; hides FanSub Creator and nuditybeyondLingerie for
People; does not hide Studios; email/push remain 18+safe.

Context switching works: Profile switcher (roles + host), header context
link (Boards/Packages/Studios), Create menu adapts to persona.

Crosslinks: People↔Studio chips; Invite from profile; Board shortcuts;
Case Study deep links.

Header context bar shows active chips and supports Save/Edit/Clear; LBG
shows twochip summary.

Auth walls and error states follow the documented patterns;
accessibility, i18n, and performance budgets enforced.

All telemetry events above are emitted for
nav/search/safemode/create/context interactions.

N\) Why this IA works

People vs Places clarity: Users always know whether they're looking at a
person or a space, yet can combine them fluidly via AttachinFlow.

Contextual creation: The Create menu and the context link reduce
cognitive load for multirole/host users.

Safety & brand protection: Safe Mode is omnipresent and conservative by
default; studios stay visible but SFW.

Scalable: Adds cities, roles, or more studio inventory without changing
the mental model.

Fast paths: Crosslinks and sticky action bars trim steps from discovery
to booking.

§4.2 --- Global Components & Design System

Goal: Ship a coherent, performant, accessible component library that
makes every flow in §4.0/§4.1 consistent and fast to build. Components
are role/spaceaware, SafeModeaware, cityaware, and optimized for
mobilefirst. Everything here is implementationagnostic (works whether
you use React/Vue/etc.).

A\) Design Foundations (tokens)

Color (semantic):

Primary (actions): \--primary-600, hover -700, focus ring -300

Neutral (text/ui): \--neutral-900/700/500/300/100

Accent (info): \--info-600

Success: \--success-600

Warning: \--warning-600

Danger: \--danger-600

Verification (badges): \--verify-600

Promoted (labels): \--promo-600 (used only for the "Promoted" chip)

Type ramp:

Display, H1--H6, Body L/M/S, Caption, Mono (numbers). Use rem with
1.6--1.8 lineheight for body.

Numerals: tabular for prices, ratings, reputation rings.

Spacing & radii:

Spacing scale: 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 32, 40

Radius scale: 4, 8, 12 (cards/buttons), 999 (pills/chips)

Elevation: Card (1), Popover (2), Drawer (3), Modal (4)

Breakpoints:

XS \<480, SM \<768, MD \<1024, LG \<1440, XL ≥1440

Motion (reducemotion friendly):

Duration: 120--200ms (hover), 200--300ms (modals/drawers)

Easing: standard cubicbezier; respect prefersreducedmotion.

Icons (consistent set):

Roles (Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSub), Studio, Instant
Book (⚡), Verified (✔︎), Trusted Pro (shield), Safe Mode (shield18),
Social (IG/YT/TT/X), Amenities (sun, cyc, blackout, height, parking,
makeup, grip, sound), Hazards (strobe, haze, flame, ladder).

B\) Layout Patterns

Page shell: Sticky header; 12column grid at MD+; single column at SM.
Side drawer for filters on desktop; fullscreen on mobile.

Sticky bars: Search (Filters/Save), Profile/Studio (Book/Request),
Checkout (Pay & Confirm).

Cards first: All lists (search, boards, invites) render cards with
consistent skeletons.

C\) Global Components (catalog)

1\) Cards

PersonCard(role) --- for People
(Model/Photographer/Videographer/Creator/FanSub)

Top: cover image/video thumbnail (3:2 crop), Role chip, Location chip

Meta row: Name, Reputation ring (0--100 with tooltip "Why this score?"),
price band, distance

Chips: Verified (ID), Trusted Pro (if BG), Instant Book, Has/Owns Studio

Social chips: IG/YT/TT/X (followers; ER% if verified connection)

Actions: View, Message, Add to Board; Promoted label (when applicable)

StudioCard --- for Places

Top: hero image (3:2), Neighborhood, Price/hr, Min hours

Chips: Verified Studio, Instant Book, amenity set (Natural light • Cyc
wall • Blackout • 14' ceilings • Parking)

Meta: Capacity, rating ★ count, host card hover

Actions: View, Add to Board; Promoted label (when applicable)

BoardCard

Works with mixed types (People + Studios); shows type icon, status chip
(Invited/Quoted/Awarded/Booked).

CaseStudyCard

Before/after thumbnails, tags, city; links to featured People/Studios.

SkeletonCard (both types)

Media gray box + 2--3 text bars + placeholder chips; shimmer at 60fps.

2\) Chips & Badges

Role chip (Model/Photographer/...) --- colorcoded

Verified (ID) --- checkmark chip

Trusted Pro --- shield chip

Verified Studio --- building/check chip

Instant Book --- ⚡ chip

Safe Mode gated --- subtle lock on nuditytier chip (only visible to
owner)

Nudity tier --- None/Lingerie/Artistic; SafeModeaware (never shown in
emails)
