§4.14.1 --- Access Governance & Security

Goal: Ensure admins can do their jobs safely, quickly, and accountably.
Enforce leastprivilege, protect PII, require explicit justification for
sensitive actions, and make every change auditable and alertable.

A\) Principles

Least privilege by default --- roles get only what they need.

PII is special --- tax/identity data behind extra gates; mask by
default.

Justintime elevation --- timeboxed, reasoned elevation for highrisk
actions.

Twoperson rule --- critical money/safety moves require a second
approver.

Full traceability --- immutable audit for who/what/why/when, with diffs.

Separation of duties --- no single role can initiate and approve the
same highrisk change.

Environment clarity --- bright "Sandbox/Prod" labeling; no
crosscontamination.

B\) Roles & Permission Scopes (RBAC)

Roles (no nesting; combine if needed):

Super Admin (restricted to founders/CTO): feature flags, configs,
emergency kills.

Trust & Safety: verifications, sanctions, strikes, IB toggle, content
quarantine.

Support: tickets/disputes, policybound refunds (within caps), message
redaction.

Finance: payouts/reserves, manual adjustments (with twoperson approval),
chargebacks, coupons.

Tax & Compliance: W9/TIN dashboard, 1099 runs, nexus map overrides
(dualapproval).

Content: reviews/profile/feed moderation, keyword lists, SafeMode
thresholds (preview only).

Ops (City/Market): promos, CPC floors, Featured slots, foundingcity
perks.

Marketing: homepage modules, email templates, coupon creation (no money
moves).

ReadOnly Auditor: dashboards/exports; masked PII; no changes.

Permission scopes:

PIIBasic: email, phone (masked by default; unmask requires reason).

PIISensitive: address, DOB (unmask gate).

PIITax: TIN, W9 PDFs, 1099 (Tax role only; dualapproval to unmask).

PIIBackground: consumer report artifacts (Trust only; FCRA training
required).

MoneyCritical: manual payout, fee override, deposit capture \>\$1k
(twoperson rule).

SafetyCritical: IB suppression, account hold (reason & SLA tag).

C\) Login, Session & Device Controls

SSO (admin): enforce SSO (e.g., Okta/Google), 2FA required (TOTP or
hardware key).

IP/Geo rules (optional): block risky geos; allow admin office IPs.

Session policy: 12hour max; 15minute idle timeout; reauth for sensitive
actions.

Device trust: label devices; new device prompts email confirmation.

Environment banner: persistent "PROD"/"SANDBOX" badge with color coding.

D\) JustinTime Elevation & TwoPerson Approvals

JIT elevation: click "Request elevation" → select scope (e.g.,
MoneyCritical), add reason + ticket link → manager/peer approves →
30--120 min token granted → autorevoke and log.

Twoperson rule: actions requiring cosign (examples):

Manual payout, fee override, deposit capture \>\$1k, tax nexus
overrides, adverse action finalization (background), permanent account
disable.

UI shows "Awaiting cosign" chip; approver sees payload diff before
confirming.

E\) PII Handling & Redaction

Masked by default: show •••• for sensitive fields; "Unmask (reason)"
button with scope check.

Download controls: exporting tables with PII requires scope + download
reason; big red banner with "Contains PII."

Inline redaction: Support/Content can redact userposted PII from
threads/reviews (stores original hashed reference; shows "Redacted
(Support)" tag).

PII view ledger: who accessed what PII, when, and why; exportable for
audits.

F\) Impersonation vs. ViewAs

ViewAs (safe default): renders the UI with PII masked; no write actions;
used for reproducing UI issues.

Impersonate (restricted): requires JIT elevation + reason; write actions
allowed, but money moves disabled in impersonation; session banner
"IMPERSONATING {user}"; all actions doublelogged (actor + target).

Guardrails: cannot impersonate Super Admins; timeboxed; logs include
IP/device.

G\) Audit & Change History

Immutable audit log capturing: actor, role, IP/device, route, entity
IDs, before/after diff, reason code, linked ticket/case.

Entity Timelines: on users, bookings, payouts, disputes, promotions:
chronological stack of admin/user/system events.

Searchable audits: by actor, entity, reason, time range; export to
CSV/PDF; retention policies applied.

Legal hold: mark entities to suspend purge (links to §4.14.15).

H\) Admin UI Patterns (Safety by Design)

Action drawers with required reason, preview of impact, and secondary
confirmation for risky moves.

Risk badges (P0/P1/P2) appear on threads/safety cases; timers visible.

Kill switches (flagged in §4.14.2): big, red, twostep with summary (what
services will pause, who's impacted).

Environmentaware copy: SANDBOX disallows emails/payouts; "simulation
only" labels.

I\) Alerts & Anomaly Detection

Highrisk action alerts to Slack/email: manual payouts, deposit captures,
fee overrides, permanent disables, tax overrides.

Anomaly monitors:

"TIN views by a single admin \> N/day"

"Refunds issued \> \$X in 1h"

"IB suppressions \> Y/day by same actor"

"Mass role changes"

Daily digest: PII views, highrisk actions, failed JIT requests; link to
audits.

J\) Telemetry (Admin Access Events)

admin.login.success/fail (role) • admin.session.timeout •
admin.device.trust.add

admin.elevate.request/approve/deny/expire (scope, reason)

admin.twoperson.request/approve/deny (action)

admin.pii.unmask (field, reason) • admin.export.download (scope)

admin.viewas.start/end • admin.impersonate.start/end

admin.alert.sent (type) • admin.anomaly.detected (rule_id)

audit.view (filters) • audit.export

K\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.1 FINAL)

SSO + mandatory 2FA for all admin roles; session/timeouts enforced;
environment banner shows clearly.

RBAC roles & scopes implemented; sensitive scopes (PIITax,
PIIBackground, MoneyCritical, SafetyCritical) enforced at API and UI.

JIT elevation with reason and approver; timeboxed tokens; logs captured.

Twoperson approval on manual payouts, fee overrides, deposit capture
\>\$1k, tax nexus overrides, final adverse actions.

PII masked by default; unmask requires scope + reason; PII access ledger
visible and exportable.

ViewAs (readonly, masked) vs Impersonate (restricted, no money moves)
implemented with banners and dual logging.

Immutable audit with before/after diffs on entities; searchable and
exportable; legal hold flag present.

Alerts & anomaly rules active; Slack/email wiring; daily digest
generated.

UI safety patterns: action drawers require reasons; confirmations for
risky actions; killswitch pattern in §4.14.2.

Telemetry events fire for all listed actions.

L\) Why this works

Prevents accidental harm (leastprivilege, masked defaults,
confirmations).

Stops malicious misuse (JIT + twoperson rule + anomaly alerts +
immutable audits).

Speeds legit work (viewas to debug safely; impersonation gated for rare
cases).

Regulatoryfriendly (PII access ledger, legal holds, full diffs).

§4.14.2 --- Config & Feature Flags

Goal: Give Ops the nocode levers to launch, tune, and safeguard the
marketplace citybycity and rolebyrole. Ship a typed Config Registry,
targeted Feature Flags, safe rollouts/rollbacks, and guardrails so the
team can change policy, pricing, ranking, promos, and safety without
deployments.

A\) Scope & Principles

Single source of truth: a versioned, typed registry consumed by all
services (search, booking, billing, trust, promos).

Targeted overrides: global \< US \< state \< city \< role \< cohort
(most specific wins).

Safety rails: validation, min/max bounds, twoperson approvals for
money/safety keys.

Observable: every read/write logged; diffs, rollbacks, and blastradius
previews.

Fast & reversible: staged rollouts, scheduled publishes, oneclick
revert.

Auditfirst: immutable history with actor, reason, before/after.

B\) Config Registry (model & precedence)

Entity: config_set

Keys: namespaced (fees.provider_pct, refunds.talent.bands,
search.weights.rep ...).

Value types: boolean, int, float, money, string, enum, json (schema
enforced).

Scope: global\|US\|state\|city\|role\|cohort (compound scopes allowed,
e.g., city=HOU,role=studio).

Versioning: semantic increment; store diffs and publish notes.

Validation: schema + business rules (e.g., fees.provider_pct \>= 0.09).

Precedence: mostspecific scope overrides broader scopes; unresolved keys
inherit.

Workflows

Draft → Validate → Preview → Approve (2person for sensitive) →
Schedule/Publish → Monitor → Rollback.

Preview: simulate impact on last N searches/bookings; show KPI
guardrails.

Rollback: pick prior version; instant invalidate caches; autonotify
services.

C\) Feature Flags (targeting & kill switches)

Flag types: boolean (on/off), percentage (staged rollout), variant
(A/B), targeting (by scope/attribute).

Targeting: by city, state, role, cohort, rep_score, verified,
trusted_pro, ab_cell.

Kill switches (hard off with graceful fallbacks):

flags.instant_book.enabled

flags.promotions.boosts.enabled / flags.promotions.featured.enabled

flags.ach.enabled (fallback to card; buyer fee reverts to 5%)

flags.studio.deposits.enabled

flags.safe_mode.enabled (enforce strict previews)

flags.lbg.enabled (Linked Booking Group off → separate flows)

D\) Editable Keys by Domain (typed, with guardrails)

All keys accept overrides at any scope unless noted. "(S)" requires
twoperson approval.

E\) Rollouts, Scheduling & Guardrails

Staged rollout: 1% → 10% → 50% → 100% (by city/role/cohort); automonitor
KPIs (dropdown presets).

Scheduling: publish windows (start/end), local timezone awareness.

Guardrails: block publish if validations fail (e.g., provider fee \<
floor) or if simulated KPI deltas exceed thresholds (e.g., est. takerate
−\> −3%+).

Rollback: oneclick revert; auto cachebust; notify affected modules
(webhooks).

Approvals: twoperson approval required for fees, promo pricing, tax
category map, nexus list, NSFW visibility.

Dryrun: compute outcomes (no apply) for 24h; log deltas to admin
dashboard.

F\) Admin UI (Editor)

Form + JSON dual view; live validation; inline hints; example payloads.

Diff viewer (before/after) with reason code & ticket link.

Impact preview: sample searches/rankings, bookingfee math, promo
inventory fill.

Scope picker: breadcrumb of inheritances; "show effective value" at any
scope.

History & rollback: timeline of publishes; pin "golden" configs.

G\) Service Consumption & Caching

Read path: services request effective_config(scope, key); library
resolves precedence + local cache.

Caching: inmemory TTL + eventdriven invalidation (pub/sub); 99p read
latency \< 5ms.

Bootsafe: services start with last known snapshot; failopen defaults for
noncritical keys; failclosed for safety/money keys.

Schema shared package to avoid drift; CI blocks breaking changes.

H\) Observability & Alerts

Config read metrics: hit/miss, stale fetch, latency; perservice
dashboards.

Drift detection: compare service snapshot vs registry head; alert on
mismatch.

Anomaly rules:

"Fee change \> 1% absolute in 24h across \>2 cities"

"NSFW visibility toggled in Safe Mode city"

"CPC floors moved \> \$0.20 in 1h"

Slack/email alerts on publish/rollback for sensitive domains.

I\) Telemetry (config events)

config.edit.start/validate/fail/success

config.preview.run/result (KPI deltas)

config.publish.request/approve/deny

config.publish.start/done/rollback

config.read (service, scope, key) • config.cache.invalidate

flags.toggle (name, targeting, % rollout)

J\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.2 FINAL)

Typed Config Registry with scopes, precedence, validation, versioning,
and immutable history.

Feature Flags with targeting, staged rollout, and kill switches wired to
fallbacks.

Editable keys implemented for Fees, Refunds/Delivery, Travel,
Search/Ranking/Safe Mode, Promotions, Verification/Rep,
Support/Disputes, Tax, Messaging/Storage, Studios, City Perks.

Twoperson approvals enforced for sensitive keys; guardrails prevent
outofbounds settings.

Preview & simulation tools display impact on recent searches/bookings;
KPI thresholds gate publishes.

Scheduling & rollback operational; cache invalidation with pub/sub;
service snapshots bootsafe.

Observability dashboards + alerts for config publishes, drift, and
anomalies.

Telemetry events fired for edits, previews, publishes, reads, and
rollbacks.

K\) Example Playbooks (no code required)

Houston buyerfee holiday: set fees.buyer_pct=0.00 for city=HOU with end
date → publish staged → autorevert.

Tighten Safe Mode: raise classifier.threshold.preview to 0.85 for
state=TX after a spike; rollback if CTR drops \>5%.

Add travel fee band: append 25--50mi at \$60 for city=DAL; preview
geosim; publish.

Ranking tune: bump search.weights.rep_tiebreak from 1.0→1.2 in
HOU:model; A/B 50/50; evaluate conversion.

Deposit policy update: increase studio.deposit.cap_money to \$400 for
LA; schedule for tomorrow 09:00 local; rollback link armed.

Boost economics: lift promos.boosts.cpc_floor.city_role\[\"HOU:model\"\]
to \$1.00; monitor ROAS; revert if invalid clicks \>7%.

§4.14.3 --- Trust & Safety Ops

Goal: Prevent harm, respond fast, and preserve marketplace integrity.
Provide Ops with clear triage, evidencedriven decisions, proportionate
sanctions, and auditable outcomes---while protecting user privacy and
complying with policy and law.

A\) Scope & Inputs

What flows in:

Safety reports (from chat, booking, profile, studio)

Automated risk signals (rate limits, device anomalies, classifier flags)

Verification results (ID, Background, Social, Studio)

Content flags (handoff to §4.14.4 for final content actions)

Dispute escalations with safety context (handoff from §4.14.5)

Case types (examples):

P0: Imminent harm, threats, stalking, underduress, doxxing, sexual
coercion, child safety.

P1: Onprem access failures, harassment, boundary violations, unsafe
location, escorting/illegal solicitation.

P2: Misrepresentation (age/identity/portfolio), spam/scams, offplatform
payment steering, policy nudity violations (previews).

B\) SLAs & Queues

P0 queue: 15 min first response, 60 min mitigation target (freeze,
contact, takedown).

P1 queue: 30 min first response, 24 h resolution target.

P2 queue: 24 h first response, 72 h resolution target.

Queue view includes: severity chip, time since opened, linked
booking/thread, user roles, location (city), verification badges, prior
strikes, and live status (e.g., "IB suppressed," "payouts frozen").

C\) Triage & Intake (Agent Playbook)

Verify severity (P0/P1/P2) from report details; upgrade severity if
signals suggest escalation.

Is there an active/linked booking? Pull: SOW/House Rules, checkin/out
timestamps, areashare logs, studio rules, delivery manifest.

Preserve evidence (oneclick): chat transcripts, attachments, IP/device,
booking metadata, profile revisions → writeonce storage with hash
(chainofcustody).

Immediate controls (if needed):

Payout freeze (partial) on involved bookings.

IB suppression on reported party (auto for P0).

DM ratelimit for suspected spam.

Profile quarantine (search hidden) pending review.

Contact counterparties via case thread (templated, safe language).

Decide: resolve, sanction, or escalate to Neutral Review Panel
(multiagent decision) for ambiguous, highimpact cases.

D\) Evidence: What Good Looks Like

System logs: booking creation/acceptance, checkin/out, location fuzz
logs, deliverables acceptance, payment attempts (incl. offplatform
keywords).

Conversations: timestamped chat, read receipts, media (with original
metadata), message redactions visible in audit.

Studio artifacts: house rules, access codes, deposit photos/evidence,
door logs if provided.

Verification: ID/Background outcomes, studio proofs, social connect
status.

User history: cancellations/noshows, prior strikes, dispute outcomes,
responsetime stats.

Agent tooling: sidebyside view, sensitive PII masked by default; "Unmask
(reason)" gated by §4.14.1 scopes.

E\) Sanctions & Remedies (Proportionate Ladder)

Soft controls:

Education notice (policy excerpt + safer alternative).

DM throttling (reduced newconversation credits for 7--30 days).

IB off for N days (auto for P1/P2; indefinite for P0 until cleared).

Boost suppression (removes promoted eligibility temporarily).

Strikes (expire after N days unless renewed):

Strike1 (30 days): visible internally; mild ranking dampening.

Strike2 (90 days): IB off, search demotion, promotions blocked.

Strike3 (180 days): account hold or suspension; payout freezes resolved
per policy.

Hard outcomes:

Account suspension (reversible with review)

Permanent disable (twoperson approval; limited to egregious or repeated
harm)

Studio delisting (Studio Verified badge revoked)

Law enforcement referral (via §4.14.15 workflow)

Autosanction triggers (configurable in §4.14.2):

≥2 P1 cases in 90 days → auto Strike2

Any P0 credible harm → Strike3 + suspension

Repeated offplatform payment attempts after warnings → IB off + DM
throttle

F\) Risk Rules Engine (ConfigDriven)

Signals: newaccount velocity, message spam patterns, offplatform payment
phrases, device mismatch, sudden rating bursts, selfclick promos, NSFW
keyword hits.

Actions: autothrottle DMs, quarantine profile, flag to T&S queue,
suppress IB, block Boosts, require reverify.

Explainability: every auto action records rule_id, inputs, and
confidence; surfaced in case panel; tunable via §4.14.2
(weights/thresholds).

Failures safe: false positives decay; manual override clears the flag
and adds rule feedback.

G\) Background & Identity (Link to §4.13)

Background "Consider/Review" → T&S evaluates role fit, recency,
rehabilitation; adverse action flow (preadverse notice, 7day response).

Underage concerns: immediate suspension, ID reverify, documentation
gate; report via child safety playbook if credible.

Impersonation/catfish: require live selfie/ID recheck; quarantine
portfolio; strike if intent to defraud.

H\) StudioSpecific Safety

Access failure (P1): verify instructions sent, code validity; if failure
owed to host → refund policy path + deposit void; if guest misconduct →
partial capture per rules.

Unsafe conditions: hazards misrepresented → Strike & delist until
corrected; require updated photos.

Thirdparty conflicts: landlord complaints or neighbor incidents →
temporary delist; require documentation.

I\) Buyer & Provider Protections (Immediate Mitigations)

Trusted Contact ping (if enabled) for delayed checkout / SOS keywords.

Relocation: for studio lockout, offer curated alternates (Houston
list) + goodwill credit (config limits in §4.14.2).

Emergency path: surface "Get help now" → safety card (nonlawenforcement
resources) + prompt to contact 911 for imminent danger (we don't
intercept emergencies).

J\) Appeals & Neutral Review

Appeal window: 14 days from sanction; one appeal per case unless new
evidence.

Neutral Review Panel: 2 T&S agents + 1 crossfunction (Support/Legal);
majority rule; document rationale.

Outcome: uphold, downgrade sanction, or overturn; update strike count
and Reputation (§4.10).

Transparency: user receives outcome with policy citations; internal
notes logged.

K\) Integrations & Handoffs

Content: NSFW/preview violations routed to §4.14.4 with case linkage;
content removal reasons synchronized.

Support/Disputes: safetycolored disputes use this case ID; refund
calculators reflect sanctions/policy.

Finance: payout freeze flags; chargeback evidence packs pull T&S
evidence.

Legal & Records: LE requests, subpoenas, child safety referrals via
§4.14.15 with limited PII access.

L\) Metrics & Quality

Operational KPIs

P0/P1 firstresponse SLA hit rate

Time to mitigation (P0 median ≤ 60m)

Safety incident rate per 1,000 bookings (target downward trend)

False positive rate (autosanctions)

Appeal overturn rate (target \< 10%)

Repeat offender rate (strike recurrence within 180 days)

IB suppression count & duration (monitor collateral impact)

Quality controls

Weekly case sampling; peer QA rubric; calibration sessions.

Rule feedback loop: promote/demote rules based on accuracy.

M\) Admin UI --- Trust Console (Key Interactions)

Case detail: timeline, linked entities, evidence panel, sanctions drawer
with reason codes, strike history.

Oneclick controls: IB off/on, DM throttle, Boost suppression, payout
freeze toggle (with reason).

Evidence pack builder: export ZIP/PDF for chargebacks or legal (hashed
manifest).

Policy helper: inline matrix preview (refund/cancellation) based on
city/role at incident time.

N\) Telemetry (Trust & Safety)

ts.case.open (severity, source) • ts.case.upgrade (P1→P0) •
ts.case.resolve (outcome)

ts.evidence.attach (type) • ts.freeze.payout.toggle • ts.ib.toggle

ts.sanction.apply (type=strike1/2/3\|suspend\|disable) •
ts.sanction.expire

ts.rule.fire (rule_id, confidence) • ts.rule.override

ts.appeal.open/resolve (result) • ts.export.pack (purpose)

O\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.3 FINAL)

Queues & SLAs for P0/P1/P2 with severity chips and timers.

Triage workflow with evidence preservation (hashed), booking/thread
linkage, and immediate controls.

Sanctions ladder implemented (education → throttles → strikes →
suspension/disable) with expiries and autotriggers.

Risk rules engine active; configurable thresholds/weights via §4.14.2;
explainable rule hits.

Background/ID links honored; adverse action flow for background checks.

Studio safety flows: access failure, unsafe conditions, delist/reverify.

Appeals & Neutral Review process with documented outcomes and updates to
Reputation.

Integrations to Content, Support/Disputes, Finance, and Legal; payout
freeze flags honored.

Trust Console UI supports oneclick controls, evidence packs, and policy
helper.

Metrics & QA dashboards live; Telemetry events fire as listed.

P\) Why this works

Fast where it matters (P0/P1 timers, oneclick mitigations) and fair
where it's complex (evidence, neutral review, expiring strikes).

Prevention + response: a configurable rule engine reduces incidents;
strong playbooks resolve the rest.

Auditable endtoend: preserved evidence, hashed manifests, reasoned
decisions, and measured quality.

§4.14.4 --- Content Moderation

Goal: Keep the platform SFW by default, protect users from harmful or
deceptive content, and maintain highquality discovery. Combine automated
screening, human review, clear policies, and appeals---with auditable
outcomes and city/role tunability via §4.14.2.

A\) Scope & Content Types

Moderated surfaces

Profiles (avatar, cover, bio), Service Profiles (per role), Portfolio
(images/videos), Feed posts, Reviews & responses, Studio pages (photos,
amenities), RFP briefs (buyer text), Gig listings/cards (search cards,
ribbons).

Not public but scanned

DM attachments (virus only; policy checks on reported threads),
Deliverables manifests (names/sizes/hash only), House Rules/SOW text
(for prohibited clauses).

Policy anchors (SFW)

Allowed: artistic, nonsexual imagery; fashion/fitness/glamour; implied
nudity that remains SFW in previews.

Prohibited: explicit sexual content; pornographic poses; fetish content;
solicitation of sexual services; child/younglooking sexualized content;
hateful symbols; doxxing/PII in public fields; offplatform payment
steering.

OnlyFans / Fansubscription creators: supported as "Creators", but no
explicit content is uploaded or displayed; metrics/identity only (per
§4.13).

B\) Pipeline Overview (Upload → Screen → Publish)

Upload → temporary pending state (placeholders with skeletons).

Automated screening (subsecond):

NSFW classifier (preview threshold from §4.14.2
classifier.threshold.preview).

Nudity mask: detects areola/genital zones; triggers autocrop/blur
overlay tool.

OCR for embedded PII (emails, phone #, payment handles).

Text filters on titles/captions/hashtags (slurs, sexual solicitation,
offplatform payment phrases).

Duplicate/perceptual hash check (copyright/banlist).

Virus/malware scan (for videos).

Policy decision:

Autopublish if fully SFW (green).

Borderline → autoblur/autocrop; publish with "sensitive" overlay;
enqueue human review SLA ≤ 24h.

Block & queue if explicit/illegal or disallowed text (red).

Human review (moderation queue) → Approve / BlurandPublish / Remove with
reason / Escalate to T&S (§4.14.3).

Publish → search cards always use SFW thumbnails; portfolio detail uses
SFW or blur taptoreveal (if marked sensitive but allowed).

Firsttime uploader policy: premoderate first N=10 portfolio items
(editable via §4.14.2) to set quality baseline.

C\) Queues & SLAs

Priority A (P0/P1 handoff from T&S): explicit sexual/child
safety/violent threats → immediate takedown, SLA 15--30 min.

Priority B (policy/borderline): nudity boundaries, hate symbols,
offplatform payment steering → SLA 24 h.

Priority C (quality/metadata): miscategorization, spam,
duplicate/loweffort → SLA 72 h.

Queue cards show: surface (profile/portfolio/feed), uploader role, city,
verification badges, classifier confidence, prior violations, and report
count.

D\) Rules by Surface

Profiles & Service Profiles

Avatar/cover must be SFW; bios may not include contact handles or
payment details; location granular to city (no home address).

Role tags and NSFW switches are not usercontrolled; they derive from
content classification and policy.

Portfolio

Must remain SFW in preview. If artistic nudity is present, the system
enforces autocrop/blur for thumbnails and grid previews.

No exposed genitals; female nipples not visible in previews; implied
nudity ok with strategic coverage.

Feed posts

Same preview constraints as portfolio; no explicit calltooffplatform
payments; collaboration tags require consent (accept/deny).

Reviews

Disallow slurs, harassment, doxxing, explicit language; allow
experiencebased criticism.

Only verified booking participants can post (per §1.4).

Studios

Images show space/amenities only; no explicit sets; safety disclosures
required for hazardous features.

RFP briefs

Disallow sexualized gig requests; disallow offplatform payment
instructions; require budget ranges.

E\) Automated Signals & Thresholds (configurable via §4.14.2)

NSFW classifier with three bands: allow, sensitiveallow (blur), block.

OCR PII detection: email/phone/payment handles → autoredact in public
captions; warn uploader.

Keyword denylist (nsfw.keyword_denylist): sexual solicitation, hate
slurs, offplatform payment verbs/handles.

Hash banlist: known abusive images (internal + partner lists).

Spam heuristics: rapid identical posts, URL stuffing, engagement bait →
throttle.

F\) UserFacing UX

During upload: live preview shows autocrop/blur; user can adjust crop
within SFW bounds (hard stops).

After decision:

Approved: normal publish.

Sensitiveallow: blur overlay with "Tap to view" + policy tooltip.

Removed: user receives reason code, policy excerpt, and appeal link.

Tagging: tagged collaborators must accept before content shows on their
profile/feed.

Education nudges: "Previews must be SFW---here's how to crop/cover."

G\) Enforcement & Escalation

Autoactions on violation counts (rolling 30 days):

2 content removals → Content warning + education card.

3 removals → DM throttle + search demotion.

4 removals → IB off and Boost suppression; queue to T&S.

Hard violations (explicit sexual content, child/younglooking sexualized,
hate symbols) → immediate takedown + Strike2/3 (T&S ladder) and
potential suspension.

Appeals: within 14 days; reviewed by a separate moderator or Neutral
Review if highimpact.

H\) Tools for Moderators

Sidebyside original vs preview thumbnail; crop grid overlay; sensitive
area heatmap.

Redact inline (captions/hashtags); system stores hash of original.

Batch actions for spam waves; bulk restore/remove with single reason.

Simulateas card: preview how a search card will render postdecision.

Policy helper: quick links to current §1.5 rules and cityspecific
appendums.

I\) Integrations & Handoffs

Trust & Safety (§4.14.3): escalations (P0/P1), sanctions ladder updates,
strike sync.

Search (§4.14.2): demotion flags, sensitiveallow affects ranking weights
(minor).

Support (§4.14.5): user communications, appeal tickets, macros.

Promotions (§3.3): promoted inventory excludes "sensitiveallow" unless
explicitly allowed by config.

Verification (§4.13): repeated misrepresentation → require reverify.

J\) Metrics & Quality

Operational KPIs

Autoapprove ratio (target ≥ 85% after first10 gating phase)

Timetodecision median (Priority B ≤ 8h)

Appeal rate & overturn rate (goal \< 10% overturn)

Repeat violation rate (per 30/90 days)

Sensitiveallow share and CTR impact (ensure buyer trust)

Offplatform payment phrase incidence (monthovermonth ↓)

Quality

Weekly calibration sessions; golden set refresh; reviewer agreement
rate.

Classifier drift monitor (precision/recall on labeled sample).

K\) Telemetry (Moderation)

mod.upload.scan.start/result (nsfw_band, ocr_hits)

mod.auto.crop/applied • mod.auto.blur/applied

mod.queue.enqueue/dequeue (priority) • mod.decision
(approve\|blur\|remove\|escalate, reason)

mod.appeal.open/resolve (upheld\|overturned)

mod.violation.count.update • mod.auto.sanction.trigger

mod.hash.ban.hit • mod.keyword.hit • mod.redact.caption

L\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.4 FINAL)

Endtoend upload→screen→publish pipeline with placeholders and subsecond
automated screening.

NSFW classifier, OCR PII, keyword denylist, hash banlist, and virus scan
wired; thresholds configurable via §4.14.2.

Autocrop/blur for previews; hard stops to keep thumbnails SFW; user crop
UI present.

Moderation queues with Priority A/B/C SLAs; decision actions
(approve/blur/remove/escalate).

User notifications with reason codes and appeal flow; taggedcontent
acceptance.

Autosanctions for repeated violations; hard violations escalate to T&S.

Integrations with Search, T&S, Support, Promotions, Verification.

Metrics dashboards and calibration workflow; Telemetry events emitted.

M\) Why this works

SFW by design keeps payment partners comfortable and buyers confident,
while still enabling artistic expression.

Fast automation + human judgment gives scale without losing nuance.

Clear user tools (crop/blur, appeals) reduce friction and educate
creators.

Tunable policies via §4.14.2 let Ops adjust thresholds citybycity
without code

§4.14.5 --- Support & Disputes

Goal: Resolve issues fast, fair, and policyaccurately---with minimal
engineering. Give agents nocode tools to calculate outcomes, capture
evidence, coordinate with Trust/Safety and Finance, and issue amended
receipts/credits with a clear audit trail.

A\) Channels & Intake

Inapp Help → "Report/Resolve a Problem" from: Booking, Chat thread,
Delivery screen, Studio page.

Email & Web form (for loggedout users on brand accounts).

Autocases from signals: missed checkin/out, late/no delivery,
accessfailure events, chargeback opened, payment duplicate, travelfee
dispute, offplatformpayment attempt (flagged).

Intake schema (prefilled from context): booking IDs (LBGaware), role(s),
city, timestamps, house rules/SOW version, deliverables manifest, chat
transcript link, deposit status, verification badges, prior strike
history.

B\) Case Types & Routing

Operational: reschedule, change order, pricing correction, travel fee
dispute.

Nondelivery/Quality: late/no delivery, partial delivery, unusable media.

Attendance: buyer/provider noshow, late arrival (both sides).

Access (Studios): code/lock failure, unsafe conditions, damages/deposit
claims.

Money: duplicate charge, overcharge, refund request, invoice edits, ACH
retry.

Safetycolored: harassment, boundary violations, escorting solicitation
(autolink to §4.14.3).

Payments network: chargeback (card issuer) → evidence pack &
representment.

Routing rules

Safetycolored → T&S queue with Support shadow.

Deposit claims → Support + Finance bin.

LBG cases → "Group" handler with perleg subtabs.

C\) SLAs & Priorities

Priority 0 (Safety): first response ≤ 15--30 min (T&S lead, Support
copilot).

Priority 1 (Access/Noshow/Active booking): first response ≤ 1 h;
resolution target ≤ 24 h.

Priority 2 (Money/Delivery/Quality): first response ≤ 8 h; resolution ≤
72 h.

Priority 3 (General): response ≤ 24 h; resolution ≤ 5 d.

Timers display in case header; breaches flagged and escalated.

D\) Agent Workspace (Case View)

Header: severity, SLA timer, booking chip(s), role(s), city, deposit
state, payouts frozen?, promotions eligibility, strikes.

Timeline: booking events, chat excerpts (expand), delivery manifest
(hashes, sizes), acceptance/rejection log, studio rules snapshot,
location (fuzzed).

Evidence panel: upload files, link docs, annotate; chainofcustody hash.

Policy helper: pulls effective config from §4.14.2 (refund bands,
acceptance window, travel fee bands, deposit defaults).

Calculators drawer (see next).

Actions: refund/partial, credit, deposit capture/void, change order,
reschedule, amended receipt, sanction shortcuts (IB off/DM throttle).

E\) Calculators (nocode, policyaccurate)

Refund Calculator\
Inputs: role, cancel timing or lateness, price lines
(packages/addons/license/travel), policy bands.\
Output: buyer refund \$; provider clawback \$; platform fee adjustments;
who pays processor fees per policy.\
Oneclick Apply → posts ledger events + issues amended receipt (§4.12).

Delivery/Acceptance Calculator\
Inputs: due date, posted date, items delivered vs promised, acceptance
window, revision rounds left.\
Output: "Eligible for partial refund X%" or "Request revision" path;
sets autoreminder in the thread.

Travel Fee Calculator\
Inputs: geo distance (map link), city override bands from §4.14.2.\
Output: allowable travel fee or adjustment recommendation.

Deposit Claim Calculator (Studios)\
Inputs: evidence, claimed damages types, cap %, expiry.\
Output: capture up to \$Y; requires twoperson approval when \>
threshold.

F\) Standard Workflows (Playbooks)

1\) Reschedule / Change Order

Propose new time; pricing delta autocomputed; both parties accept → SOW
updates → amended receipt.

2\) Buyer Noshow

Confirm arrival logs; provider/studio present?

Policy outcome: buyer forfeits %; provider paid per bands; strike
optional if abuse.

3\) Provider Noshow / Late

Confirm location logs; attempt contact in thread.

Outcome: refund buyer; provider forfeits; strike (T&S); remove Boost
eligibility window.

4\) Late / Partial Delivery

Run Delivery calculator; offer revision first if within rounds;
otherwise partial refund per matrix.

5\) Quality Dispute

Require 3 examples & rationale; compare to SOW.

If subjective with adequate delivery, educate + deny; if objective miss,
partial refund.

6\) Studio Access Failure

Validate instructions sent and code logs; if host fault → full/partial
refund; deposit void.

Offer Relocation (city curated list) + goodwill credit (config caps).

7\) Deposit Claims (Studio)

Require timestamped photos, house rules match; capture up to cap;
disputed? move to Neutral Review.

8\) Duplicate/Overcharge

Verify processor logs; refund excess; issue amended receipt.

9\) Chargebacks

Freeze related payouts; assemble evidence pack (receipts, chat,
acceptance logs, deliverables hashes, location fuzz logs); submit; track
outcome; if lost, apply platform loss policy.

10\) LBG: Talent ok / Studio failed (or vice versa)

Prorate group: refund failed leg; preserve valid leg; issue Group
amended receipt.

G\) Neutral Review Panel (Ambiguous / Highimpact)

Composition: 2 Support seniors + 1 crossfunction (T&S/Finance) →
majority decision.

Inputs: timeline, evidence, calculators' outputs, policy excerpt,
customer narratives.

Outcomes: uphold/modify/overturn; optional goodwill credit; document
rationale; update Reputation and strikes if applicable.

H\) Credits & Goodwill (Guardrails)

Goodwill credits are marketingfunded, scoped to city/role, with percase
and peragent monthly caps (from §4.14.2).

Autoexclusion: users with active strikes or abuse patterns.

On apply: credit line appears in receipt; expiry date; cannot be
withdrawn as cash.

I\) Automation & Triggers

Autoopen case: missed checkin/out, no delivery by T+X hours,
accessfailure signal, duplicate charge, chargeback.

Autosuggest macros: populate opening message using case type & policy;
agent reviews/edits.

Autoreminders: revision requested → followup in 48h; acceptance window
about to expire.

J\) Comms & Templates

Template packs (editable in §4.14.10): safetyneutral, plainEnglish,
localized.

Macros per case type with dynamic fields (names, amounts, dates, policy
links).

Tone checks: disallow blamey or legalese phrases; suggest neutral
alternatives.

K\) Integrations & Handoffs

Finance (§4.14.6): refunds/credits/deposit captures post to ledger;
payout holds released on resolve.

T&S (§4.14.3): safetycolored cases mirror to T&S; sanctions reflected
back.

Content (§4.14.4): if dispute reveals policybreaking content → removal &
strike handoff.

Tax (§4.12): amended receipts reflect tax deltas; yearend summaries
updated.

Analytics (Section 5): case and resolution data to warehouse.

Ops KPIs

Refund error rate (target \< 1%).

\% cases resolved selfserve (target ↑ over time).

Chargeback win rate; deposit claim success rate.

CSAT after resolution; NPS impact for buyers/providers.

Quality

Weekly case reviews; coaching notes; macro hygiene; consistency checks

Fast, fair, consistent outcomes without engineering.

§4.14.6 --- Finance & Payouts Ops

Goal: Run money ops safely and fast---payouts, reserves,
refunds/credits, deposits, chargebacks, promos---without code changes.
Keep books clean (escrow/recognition), minimize leakage and loss, and
provide auditable, reversible actions with dualapproval where needed.

A\) Scope & Roles

Who uses this: Finance, Support (limited), Ops/Marketing (promos),
Readonly Auditors.\
What it controls: payout batches & reserves, Early Payouts,
refunds/credits, studio deposits, chargebacks/representment,
coupons/promos, daily reconciliation, revenue recognition exports.

Guardrails: Moneycritical actions require twoperson approval per §4.14.1
(manual payout, fee override, deposit capture \> \$1k, tax category
overrides).

B\) Ledgers & Money Objects (model)

Money objects (immutable IDs)

Booking (talent or studio leg; LBGaware)

Escrow (liability)

Fees: provider fee, buyer fee, processor estimate/actual

Taxes (passthrough)

Deposits (auth hold; studio)

Payout (batch line items; per payee)

Refund/Credit (buyerside)

Adjustment (postbooking change order)

Chargeback (case + amounts, stages)

Journaling (highlevel)

At charge: Dr Cash / Cr Escrow + Taxes + Buyer fee (revenue)

At completion (accept/autoaccept): move Escrow → Payable to provider;
Provider fee recognized (revenue)

At refund: reverse appropriate portions; taxes per jurisdiction rules

At payout: Dr Payable / Cr Cash; reserves retained as liability

Deposits: not GMV; separate liability "Deposits held"; capture/void
moves between liabilities and cash.

All journaling exported; detail remains in data warehouse (Section 5).

C\) Payouts, Reserves & Early Payout

Payout batches

Views: Queued / Sent / Failed / On hold (reserve/chargeback)

Filters: provider, date, city, role, bank status, amount ranges

Actions: Retry, Change bank (with KYC check), Split batch for compliance
timing

Failures: display processor reason; allow oneclick retry after method
update

Reserves

Newprovider reserve: first N payouts delayed up to 7 days (config in
§4.14.2)

Rolling reserve: hold X% for Y days; adjustable by cohort/risk
(twoperson approval to change)

Reserve ledger shows applied, released, scheduled releases

Early Payout (peruse)

Eligibility: Rep ≥ 85 + ID Verified (gate in §4.12)

Finance can override eligibility with reason (dualapproval)

Fee: 0.5% on provider fee component only; calculator shows amount before
confirm

Telemetry and reporting on takerate impact

D\) Refunds, Adjustments & Credits

Refunds

Triggered by Support calculators (§4.14.5) or Finance directly (edge
cases)

Autorecompute: provider/buyer fees, taxes, processor costs per policy
matrix; regenerate amended receipt (§4.12)

Partial refunds supported per line (packages, addons, license, travel)

ACH/card: refund path chosen based on original method; if method
expired, create credit memo

Adjustments (Change Orders)

Price deltas (time overage, addon, travel); pushes delta charge to
buyer; fee math applied to delta only

Credits (Goodwill / Ops)

Noncash platform credits with expiration; scoped by city/role; caps in
§4.14.2

Not withdrawable; applied at checkout; tracked as marketing expense

E\) Studio Deposits (Auth Holds & Captures)

Dashboard

Columns: Booking, Host, Amount, Auth expiry, Evidence, Status
(Held/Captured/Void/Released)

Actions

Capture (with evidence attach) → separate deposit receipt (no platform
fee)

Void/Release on resolution or expiry

Twoperson approval if capture \> \$1k or \> default cap in §4.14.2

Rules

Captures must occur before auth expiry; system warns at T24h

Partial capture allowed up to cap; multiple captures if processor
supports incremental

F\) Chargebacks & Representment

Case flow

Ingest webhooks: Opened → Evidence due → Represented → Won/Lost

Autofreeze related payouts (partial) on open; unfreeze on resolution

Representment pack builder: receipts, amended receipts, SOW/House Rules,
chat excerpts, checkin/out logs, deliverables manifest hashes, location

KPIs

Win rate, average liability, time to representment, scheme reasons top10

G\) Coupons & Promotions (Money Ops)

Payout batches with retry/changebank and reserve visibility; Early

M\) Why this works

§4.14.7 --- Tax & Compliance Ops

Goal: Operate U.S. taxes and compliance without code changes: collect
W9s, resolve TIN mismatches, run and deliver 1099s, manage marketplace
salestax (destinationbased) with a tax engine, file remittances on time,
and keep a defensible audit trail---with dual approvals on sensitive
moves.

A\) Scope & Roles

Who uses this: Finance (lead), Tax & Compliance, Readonly Auditor;
limited Support (view-only for ticket replies).\
What it covers: W9 onboarding & edelivery consent, TIN matching, 1099
generation/efile/delivery/corrections, marketplace salestax nexus
tracking, tax category mapping, calculation monitoring, return filing
calendar, audit pack exports.

Guardrails: Changes that affect tax exposure (nexus list, category map,
backdated overrides, rate overrides) require twoperson approval per
§4.14.1.

B\) Dashboards & Queues

Tax Overview (/admin/tax)

Tiles: W9 coverage %, TIN mismatch open, 1099 run status, states with
nexus, calc error rate, next filings due.

Trendlines: taxable vs nontaxable share by role; effective tax collected
by state/city.

Queues

W9 Missing/Invalid (payoutblocking on): missing, expired name/TIN,
signature not captured.

TIN Mismatch: new mismatches, under review, resolved.

1099 Exceptions: address issues, duplicate TINs, threshold edge cases,
bounced emails, paper mail required.

Calc Exceptions: timeouts, "no code found," zero tax where expected,
jurisdiction mismatch.

C\) W9 / TIN / EDelivery Management

W9 Control Panel

Status filters: Not started • In progress • Submitted • Valid • Needs
correction.

Actions: Request W9 (nudge), Resend link, Block payouts toggle
(automated default ON when missing), Mark corrected after user
resubmits.

Evidence: signed PDF, submission timestamp, IP/device, consent texts.

TIN Match (soft)

Batch and ondemand checks; results classified: Match • Mismatch •
Indeterminate.

Workflow: On mismatch → Notify user (selfserve fix) → if unresolved in 7
days, escalate to Support for assisted correction → remain
payoutblocked.

Audit: history of match attempts, result codes; no raw SSN ever shown
(PII scope gates per §4.14.1).

EDelivery Consent

Global percentage, by cohort.

Actions: Request consent template, Revoke on user request.

If no consent or unopened by deadline, queue paper mail fulfillment with
address verification.

D\) 1099 Runs & Corrections

Config (no code)

Thresholds: dynamic edition (managed by Finance) with notes; never
hardcoded into receipts.

Form type: platformissued 1099NEC vs processorissued (if using PSE
route) --- select per tax season.

Run windows: preclose (draft), final generate, efile, deliver (by Jan 31
target).

Run Workflow

Preflight: snapshot gross payouts, exclude refunds/chargebacks as policy
dictates; show exceptions (missing W9, TIN mismatch, missing address).

Preview: perpayee summary with deltas vs prior drafts; download sample
PDFs; dual approval to proceed.

Efile: submit batch to filing provider (IRS + Combined Federal/State
where applicable); capture submission IDs.

Deliver: email with secure link to PDF for consented users; queue mail
for the rest; track opens and bounces.

Corrections: create CCORR entries with reason (address fix, amount
update, TIN correction); refile and redeliver; maintain version chain.

Status & Controls

States: Draft • Pending approval • Filed • Delivered • Correction
pending.

Bounced/undeliverable queue with address change flow (Support can help).

Export 1099 Ledger CSV: payee, TIN masked, gross, box amounts, file IDs.

E\) SalesTax Nexus & Category Mapping (Marketplace Facilitator)

Nexus Map

States list with toggles: Collect & remit ON/OFF, basis
(economic/physical), notes.

Economic triggers monitor: GMV and transaction count by state vs
configurable thresholds; alert if approaching.

Twoperson approval to mark a state ON/OFF; prompt to schedule effective
date/time.

Category Mapping (what is being taxed)

Role/service to tax code mapping (e.g., Talent service,
Photography/Videography service, Studio shortterm rental, Cleaning fee,
Digital license).

Editor: pick codes from tax engine catalog; perstate overrides where
needed; reason required; dual approval for overrides.

Simulation: price example shows expected tax in a target city/county;
compares before/after.

Exemptions (Phase 2)

Buyer tax exemption certificates: upload, verify, expire; statespecific
validation; apply per booking only if valid and applicable; audit record
kept.

F\) Calculation Monitoring & Exceptions

Live Monitor

Success %, latency p95/p99; top states/cities by volume.

"Zero where expected" detector: service/location combos historically
taxable now returning 0.

Timeouts: fallback policy (failclosed for money safety) blocks checkout
or shows "Tax unavailable---please retry"; agent override path (rare)
requires dual approval and postfix reconciliation.

Exception Resolution

No code found: add/adjust category mapping; rerun calc; annotate case.

Jurisdiction mismatch: verify location; correct geocode; recalc.

Engine outage: enable grace mode flag (killswitch in §4.14.2) →
temporarily suspend new checkouts or switch to backup strategy;
autonotify Eng/Ops.

G\) Filing Calendar & Remittance

Calendar

State filing frequencies (monthly/quarterly/annual) with due dates;
owner assigned; reminders at T14/T7/T2 days.

Each filing stores: period, gross taxable, tax collected, returns
submitted, confirmation numbers, PDFs.

Rollups: city/county breakdowns; shortpaid/overpaid trackers.

Payments

Record ACH/epay confirmations; reconcile remitted vs collected; variance
report.

Exports

Jurisdiction CSV for the period (state/county/city), taxable base, tax,
count, exempt amount; importready for filing portals or CPA.

H\) Knowledge Base & Policy Text (External)

KB articles linked from receipts/Tax Center: "Where we collect tax",
"Why was tax charged?", "How 1099 works", "How to fix a W9 mismatch".

Templates maintained via §4.14.10 Smart Docs CMS; localized; review by
Tax.

I\) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

W9 coverage ≥ target (e.g., 98% of active payees).

TIN mismatch resolution median (≤ 7 days).

1099 ontime issuance rate (target 100%).

Calc error rate \< 0.5%; average calc latency \< 1.5s.

Tax collected vs remitted variance (target \< 0.5%).

Nexus trigger alerts resolved within 5 business days.

Alerts

New state approaches economic nexus threshold (≥80%).

Calc exceptions \> threshold in any state.

1099 bounce rate \> target; undelivered forms \> N.

Filing due in ≤ 2 days and not marked "Submitted."

J\) Telemetry (Tax Ops)

tax.w9.request/sent/submit/valid/invalid

tax.tin.match.run/result

tax.edelivery.consent.on/off

tax.1099.prefight/preview/efile/deliver/correct

tax.nexus.state.enable/disable (actor, reason)

tax.category.map.update (before/after, scope)

tax.calc.request/response/timeout/error

tax.filing.create/submit/confirm

tax.alert.trigger (type, state)

K\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.7 FINAL)

W9/TIN module with payoutblock, consent capture, mismatch workflow, and
signed PDFs stored with audit.

1099 run system: preflight, preview, dualapproval, efile,
edelivery/paper fallback, corrections flow with version chain.

Nexus map and economic triggers; twoperson approval to toggle; scheduled
effective dates.

Category mapping editor with simulation; perstate overrides; approvals &
audit.

Calc monitor with latency, errorrate, and "zero where expected"
detectors; outage grace mode.

Filing calendar with reminders, submission records, confirmations, and
jurisdiction exports.

KB links & templates maintained via §4.14.10; Support sees statuses for
ticket replies.

Metrics & alerts dashboards; Telemetry events for all listed actions.

L\) Why this works

Automates the heavy lifting (forms, calcs, filings) while keeping humans
in the loop where judgment matters.

Prevents surprises with nexus monitoring, exception queues, and dual
approvals on exposurechanging edits.

Auditable & defensible: signed forms, efile IDs, mapping changes, and
filing confirmations are all in one place.

§4.14.8 --- Promotions & Marketplace Economics

Goal: Give Ops/Marketing a nocode control tower for paid visibility that
drives incremental bookings without corrupting relevance: configure CPC
floors and Featured pricing citybycity, tune Quality Score (QS) weights,
enforce density/frequency caps, manage eligibility/safety, run
experiments, and measure true incrementality (ROAS)---all with
guardrails, audits, and rollbacks.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Ops (city/market), Marketing, Finance (billing/credits),
Trust & Safety (eligibility), Readonly Auditor.\
What it controls: Search Boost (CPC), Featured Carousels (weekly flat),
eligibility gates, QS weighting, density/frequency caps, citytier CPC
floors, delivery guarantees & makegoods, experiments, fraud controls,
wallet credits.\
Guardrails: "Never paytowin"---paid units must match query/filters; caps
enforced (≤2/20; ≤1 above fold); Promoted label shown; safety
eligibility in effect (ID Verified + Rep ≥ 70 + no recent strikes).

B\) Inventory Model (what can be sold)

Search Results Boost (CPC)

Placement: inline search cards; ribbons autogenerated ("Instant Book",
"Trusted Pro", "Available this week").

Capacity controls: density cap per page and frequency caps per buyer
(config in §4.14.2).

Charging: per valid click (invalid click credits autoapply to wallet).

Featured Carousels (Weekly Flat)

Placement: Home + category landing ("Featured in Houston"; "Featured
Photographers").

Slots: 10--16 per carousel; rotational pacing with impression guarantees
& makegood logic.

Creative rules: No custom creatives. We render the standard profile
card + approved ribbon variants only (prevents deception and review
load).

C\) City Tiers & Pricing Governance

City tiers: A (e.g., HOU/DAL/LA/NYC/ATL), B (growth metros), C
(smaller).

CPC floors per city×role (e.g., HOU:model = \$0.90) and weekly Featured
prices per city×role (e.g., \$69/wk).

Scheduling: price changes can be scheduled (start/end) with local
timezone; staged rollouts.

Review cadence: monthly CPC floor review (±\$0.10--0.20) based on fill
rate, CPB, ROAS; quarterly Featured pricing review (impression delivery
& bookings/slot).

Dual approval: any CPC floor increase ≥ \$0.20 in 24h, or Featured price
change ≥ 20% requires twoperson approval (per §4.14.1).

Keys live in §4.14.2: promos.boosts.cpc_floor.city_role,
promos.featured.weekly_price.city_role.

D\) Eligibility, Targeting & Safety

Eligibility rule (configurable DSL): default id_verified && rep\>=70 &&
!recent_strike.

NSFW/Safe Mode: paid units respect city NSFW visibility and Safe Mode
thresholds (from §4.14.2).

Targeting knobs: city, radius, role; negative keywords (provider can
exclude).

Autosuppression: any active Safety investigation or miscategorized
profile → campaign paused until cleared.

E\) Ranking Inside Paid Caps (fair ordering)

Within paid slots only:

Quality Score (0--1) components (weights tunable in §4.14.2):

Exact filter match fit (role/location/price/availability)

Responsiveness (firstresponse time & rate)

Rep Score

Instant Book enabled

Price fit to query median

Historical CTR (timedecayed)

Paid Order Score: score = log(bid) \* α + QS \* (1−α) (default α=0.5;
guardrails 0.3--0.7).

Tiebreak: lower effective CPC (bid ÷ QS) wins to reward relevance.

Keys: promos.boosts.qs_weight_bid, promos.boosts.qs_weight_quality.

F\) Fraud, Quality & Budget Protection

Invalid click detection: rapid repeats, zerodwell bounces, selfclick
signatures, coordinated patterns; invalidated charges autocredit within
24h to wallet.

Frequency caps (buyerside): 2 impressions/session, 5/day/provider, 4h
cooldown.

Budget safety: daily overspend guard (≤5%); autopause if anomaly; alert
Ops.

Abuse flags: misleading pricing or availability → autopause all promos;
route to T&S.

G\) Admin UI --- Controls & Flows

1\) Floors & Pricing Editor

Table per city×role: CPC floor \$, avg QS, fill %, median CPC, CPB,
ROAS; edit floors inline; schedule changes; staged rollout slider.

Featured grid: weekly price ladder; slots booked vs inventory;
impression guarantees; set makegood rules (auto credit or extension).

2\) Eligibility & Caps

Toggle eligibility DSL (with validator), set density/frequency caps; set
ribbon allowlist.

3\) QS Weights & Preview

Adjust α and QS subweights (guardrails); simulate ordering on last N
queries; diff view vs current.

4\) Experiments

Create A/B cells: density caps A(2/20) vs B(1/20); QS α 0.5 vs 0.3;
ribbon text variants.

Set success metrics (ROAS lift, CPB↓, buyer CTR↑); autostop on trust KPI
breach (e.g., "Hide promoted" \> 3%).

5\) Credits & MakeGoods

Issue wallet credits (invalid clicks, makegood for underdelivered
Featured); caps and reasons required; ledger posted to Finance.

6\) Reporting

Dashboards: adoption %, spend, CPC distribution, CPB, bookings
attributed, incremental GMV (holdout), ROAS percentiles, invalid click
rate, buyer "Hide" rate, revenue contribution.

H\) Measurement & Incrementality

Attribution: click → inquiry → booking → GMV; 7day postclick window;
firsttouch within paid.

Holdout design: rolling 10% eligible supply suppressed from paid to
estimate incremental bookings/GMV; configurable (5--10%).

Core KPIs: median ROAS ≥ 2.5×, CPB targets by role, invalid click rate
\< 7%, buyer "Hide promoted" ≤ 3%, paid revenue mix 10--15% by month 6.

Cohort views: new vs returning providers; city cohorts; role cohorts.

I\) Finance & Billing Integration

Wallet ledger: CPC charges (valid clicks), Featured weekly charges,
invalid click credits, makegoods.

Prepaid vs payasyougo: support both; card on file; lowbalance alerts.

Refund policy: only invalid clicks autocredit; Featured makegoods issued
on short delivery (impressions) or outages.

J\) Alerts & Safeguards

Spend spike \> X% houroverhour in a city/role.

Invalid clicks \> 10% for any provider in 24h.

Buyer "Hide promoted" rate \> 3% dayoverday.

ROAS median \< 2.0× for 7 days in a city → suggest floor drop or QS
tuning.

Inventory saturation: density cap hits 90% for 3 days → consider raising
floor or adding slots cautiously (with A/B).

K\) Telemetry (Promotions)

promo.boost.floor.update • promo.featured.price.update •
promo.eligibility.update

promo.qs.tune (alpha, weights) • promo.simulation.run

promo.experiment.start/stop (caps\|alpha\|ribbon)

promo.charge.click.valid/invalid • promo.credit.makegood

promo.metrics.roas.update • promo.alert.trigger (type)

L\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.8 FINAL)

CPC floors and Featured weekly pricing editable per city×role;
scheduled; dualapproval for large changes.

Eligibility rule editor with validator; safety gating enforced (ID
Verified + Rep ≥ 70 + no strikes).

Density & frequency caps configurable; respected at runtime; Promoted
labeling present.

QS weights tunable with simulation; ordering formula log(bid)\*α +
QS\*(1−α) enforced within paid slots only.

Fraud controls: invalid click detection with autocredits; overspend
guard; abuse autopause.

Experiments on caps, QS α, ribbons; autostop on trust KPI breach.

Reporting: spend, CPC, CPB, attributed bookings/GMV, incremental ROAS
via holdout, invalid click & hide rates, revenue contribution.

Wallet & Finance linkage for charges, credits, makegoods; audit trail
intact.

Alerts on spikes, quality thresholds, low ROAS, inventory saturation;
Telemetry events firing.

M\) Why this works

Citybycity control without code lets you stabilize early markets and
price inventory rationally.

Fairness preserved: relevance first, paid only in marked slots, strict
caps---so buyers trust results.

Provable value keeps spend durable (holdoutmeasured ROAS).

Operationally safe: fraud shielding, autocredits, experiments with
guardrails, and quick rollbacks.

§4.14.9 --- City Ops & Supply Seeding

Goal: Give Ops a nocode cockpit to launch and grow each city: set supply
targets by role, seed highquality providers and studios, run
foundingcity perks, balance demand vs. supply, and keep
rotations/spotlights fair---without code changes.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: City/Market Ops (lead), Marketing (copilot), Trust &
Safety (eligibility), Finance (budgets), Readonly Auditor.\
What it controls: city cohorts, supply targets, foundingcity perks,
verification subsidies, invite/referral programs, "Top in {City}"
rotations, studio seeding, demand seeding (brands/RFP), local events
("Collab Day"), and city health dashboards.

Guardrails: All perks that change fees or issue credits draw from
approved budgets and obey eligibility (ID Verified, Rep ≥ 70, no
strikes). Fee/price changes use §4.14.2 approvals.

B\) City Dashboard (at /admin/city/{city})

Health tiles (last 28 days, rolesplit: Models / Photographers /
Videographers / Creators)

Active supply (# with packages + availability) • Verified % • Instant
Book %

Buyer demand (searches, inquiries, bookings) • Fill rate (% inquiries →
bookings)

Repeat bookings % • Median response time • Cancellation/noshow rates

Pricing bands median vs target • Bookings heatmap by neighborhood •
Studio availability

Alerts

Supply/demand imbalance (e.g., photogs \< target ratio to models)

Verified % below threshold • Response time drift • High cancel/noshow
pockets

Studio coverage below target • Budget burn approaching 80%

C\) Targets & Ratios (editable, guardrailed)

Supply targets by role (absolute \# and % verified):

Example (Houston P0): Models 300 (≥60% ID Verified), Photographers 220
(≥55%), Videographers 120 (≥50%), Creators 200 (≥55%).

Balance ratios (min/max):

Model:Photographer target 1.2--1.8 • Model:Videographer 2.0--3.0 •
Creator:Photographer 0.7--1.3.

Studio coverage: ≥25 Verified Studios across ≥8 neighborhoods.

Responsetime goal: median ≤ 2h; Instant Book share ≥ 35%.

(All thresholds live as keys in §4.14.2; dashboard shows current →
target with color coding.)

D\) Cohort Builder & Invites

Filters (role, distance radius, verification status, Rep, perplatform
social metrics, price band, availability, touring flag).\
Actions

Generate invite cohort: preview list, dedupe by email/social handle;
export or send.

Invite send: email/SMS templates (from §4.14.10), optional boost coupon
attachment.

Autoinvite rules: "When a provider in HOU links IG ≥ 25k & ID Verified →
send 'Founding Creator' invite + \$15 Boost."

CSV import: offplatform prospect lists (studios, creators). Merge/match
to existing accounts; privacysafe.

Tracking

Conversion funnel: sent → opened → signup → verified → first package →
first booking.

E\) FoundingCity Perks & Budgets

Perks (config via §4.14.2)

Buyer fee holiday (e.g., 0% buyer fee) --- windowed

Provider fee nudge (e.g., −2% for 60 days) --- capped by cohort

Verification subsidies: first N ID or Background passes funded

Boost starter credits: \$15 on Trusted Pro pass (once)

Budgets

Tiles: allocated vs spent vs slated; alerts at 80/100%.

Makegood credits draw from promo budget; ledger posts to Finance
(§4.14.6).

Eligibility

Enforce: id_verified && !recent_strike (and Trusted Pro where
applicable).

Cityscoped caps per user (e.g., max \$30 in credits/30 days).

F\) "Top in {City}" Rotations & Merchandising

Carousels: "Top Models in Houston", "...Photographers...",
"...Videographers...", "...Creators...", "Verified Studios".

Rotation logic: weighted roundrobin among eligible profiles (Rep ≥
threshold, IB on, recent positive reviews).

Fairness caps: max X impressions/week per profile; enforce diversity (no
duplicates in adjacent tiles).

Manual pin (rare): Ops can pin up to 2 slots for timeboxed campaigns
(record reason; autounpin).

A/B: carousel order and labels (e.g., "Available this week" vs "Instant
Book").

G\) Studio Seeding & Coverage

Neighborhood heatmap with target coverage; shows Verified Studios and
peak booking windows.

Studio outreach cohort builder (amenities needed: cyclorama, natural
light, dressing rooms, parking).

Deposit defaults & House Rules templates pulled from §4.14.10; autoapply
on onboarding.

Studio perks: reduced Featured price for first 4 weeks; extra visibility
in LBG flows.

Quality gate: minimum photo set + safety disclosures; Studio Verified
required to appear in checkout selector.

H\) Demand Seeding (Brands, Agencies, SMBs)

Brand prospecting: import CRM lists; tag by vertical
(fashion/beauty/fitness/real estate).

RFP Broadcast rules: prebuilt briefs per vertical; budget presets; city
target; send to Verified + Rep ≥ 70 supply.

Buyer incentives: firstbooking credits, ACH fee discount callouts;
concierge assist flag.

Casestudy pipeline: select completed bookings → request permission →
publish (adds to city landing page).

I\) Local Events: "Collab Days" & Tours

Event builder: schedule Collab Day at a Verified Studio (capacity, time
slots, optin roles).

RSVP & waitlist: eligibility (ID Verified), slot allocation, reminders;
optional nominal fee to reduce noshows.

Touring calendar: surface "Visiting talent" weeks; suggest Smart Invites
to local buyers/providers.

Afteraction: collect references; feature top outcomes in city carousels.

J\) Playbooks (oneclick templates)

City Launch (8 weeks)

W8 to W6: invite wave #1; studio outreach; press list.

W5 to W3: foundingcity perks on; verification subsidies live; Boost
floors set low; "Top in HOU" rotation starts.

W2: Collab Day #1; Brand RFP sprint; ACH discount banner.

W1: content blitz; early bookings showcase.

W+1 to W+4: tighten floors, raise QS weight; adjust perks based on
budget & ROAS.

Supply Dip Repair

Identify missing role pocket (e.g., videographers); run targeted
invites + \$15 Boost coupon; pin 2 carousel slots; set IB radius +5
miles; host Collab Day #2.

Studio Gap Fix

Heatmap → neighborhoods with 0 coverage; studio outreach pack; temporary
Featured discount; LBG promos.

Response Time Rehab

Message providers with slow responses; enable responsetime score nudge;
suggest Quick Replies; rotate out of carousels until improved.

(Each playbook sets flags/keys in §4.14.2 and schedules comms/templates
in §4.14.10.)

K\) Integrations

Promotions (§4.14.8): CPC floors per city×role, Featured price ladders,
eligibility.

Verification (§4.13): subsidy counts, Trusted Pro gating.

Support (§4.14.5): relocation list for studio access failures.

Finance (§4.14.6): budgets, credits, ledger posting.

Smart Docs (§4.14.10): invite templates, event emails, House Rules
packs.

Search (§4.14.2): facet toggles (e.g., show "Touring talent" filter in
launch window).

L\) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

Activation: % of invited providers who publish packages in 7 days
(target \> 50%).

Verified coverage by role (target ≥ thresholds above).

Inquiry→Booking conversion (target ≥ 35% by W+8).

Repeat booking % (target ≥ 30% by M3).

Responsetime median ≤ 2h; IB share ≥ 35%.

Studio coverage (neighborhood count) and LBG adoption.

Perk efficiency: CAC per verified, cost/booking from subsidies, Boost
ROAS by cohort.

Alerts

Balancedratio violation \> 2 weeks.

Verified coverage dips \< threshold.

Budget burn ≥ 80% with \< 60% target achieved.

Carousel impression concentration (top 10 profiles \> 40% impressions).

M\) Telemetry (City Ops)

city.cohort.create/send/convert

city.perk.enable/disable/budget.update

city.carousel.rotate/pin/unpin

city.studio.outreach/send/verify

city.event.create/rsvp/no_show_rate

city.ratio.alert • city.coverage.alert • city.budget.alert

N\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.9 FINAL)

City Dashboard with rolesplit health, heatmaps, alerts.

Targets & ratios editable with guardrails; live comparison to actuals.

Cohort Builder & Invites with filters, CSV import, dedupe, autoinvite
rules, and conversion tracking.

Foundingcity perks (buyerfee holiday, provider nudge, verification
subsidies, Boost credits) with budgets and eligibility.

Rotations for "Top in {City}" with fairness caps and optional manual
pinning (timeboxed).

Studio seeding tools (coverage map, outreach, Verified gating, LBG
integration).

Demand seeding (brand RFP broadcast, concierge pipeline, casestudy
publishing).

Local events builder (Collab Days, tours) with RSVP/waitlist and
postevent followups.

Playbooks that programmatically set flags/keys and schedule comms;
oneclick apply/rollback.

Metrics, alerts, telemetry implemented and visible; budgets enforced.

O\) Why this works

Citybycity control aligns product knobs with ground truth (coverage,
ratios, response time).

Seeding at scale: invites, perks, and events run from one place with
budgets and eligibility baked in.

Fair discovery: rotations with caps prevent "winnertakeall," improving
breadth of bookings.

Tight integration with Promotions, Verification, Finance, and Support
ensures moves are both effective and auditable.

§4.14.10 --- Smart Docs & Templates CMS

Goal: Let Ops/Legal/Marketing manage contracts, releases, SOWs, House
Rules, and comms (email/SMS) without code---using a versioned clause
library, safe variables, approvals, localization, and oneclick
rollout/rollback. All documents and messages should be policyaccurate,
esignable, and auditable, and slot cleanly into booking, delivery,
disputes, and receipts.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this:

Legal (owner of legal templates) --- clauses, SOW defaults, releases,
House Rules patterns.

Ops/Support --- dispute macros, houserules packs, city addenda, safety
notices.

Marketing --- email/SMS copy, onboarding & lifecycle.

City Ops --- localized notes, studio packs, event mailers.

Guardrails:

Twoperson approval required to publish legal docs or change variable
sets (Legal + Ops).

Live preview + "blastradius" diff for all publishes.

Version pinning per booking (the exact doc text is frozen on
create/accept).

B\) Document Types & Catalog

Legal/Operational docs (rendered as PDF & HTML):

SOW (Statement of Work) --- per role, roleaware fields
(talent/photog/videographer/creator) + LBG aware.

Model Release / Talent Release --- 18+ only; IDverified signers; alias
display but legal name on signature page.

IP & License Addenda --- commercial/editorial usage, term, geography,
exclusivity, buyout options.

House Rules (Studio) --- access, usage, equipment, noise, parking,
deposit grounds.

Safety Addenda --- chaperone policy, emergency contact, areashare
consent, code of conduct.

Change Orders --- schedule/price adjustments midthread.

Refund/Delivery Acknowledgements --- standardized acceptance/refund
confirmations.

Tax Consent Texts --- edelivery consent language (links with
§4.12/§4.14.7).

Messaging templates (transactional & lifecycle):

Checkout/escrow, acceptance, reminders, reschedule, deliverables
due/accepted, revision prompts, dispute opened/closed, payout
queued/sent, 1099 available, verification nudges, city launch,
promotions.

C\) Clause Library & Safe Variables

Clause blocks:

Atomic, reusable paragraphs with conditions (role, city, studio, NSFW
state, presence of deposit, licensing tier).

Tags: #legal, #ops, #safety, #tax, #studio.

Deprecation with automigration suggestions (never changes older, pinned
documents).

Variable catalog (strongly typed & validated):

Examples: {{booking.start_datetime_local}}, {{booking.city}},
{{party.buyer.display_name}}, {{party.seller.legal_name_masked}},
{{pricing.subtotal}}, {{license.scope}}, {{studio.deposit_cap}}.

Validators: required/optional, regex, min/max, enum; preview with sample
data before publish.

Forbidden variables in public surfaces (email/phone/payment handles) are
blocked.

D\) Template Editor UI

Block editor (left: clause library, right: doc outline).

Conditions panel to include/exclude clauses by role/city/flags.

Variables inspector with type checks and autofill suggestions.

Diff viewer (before/after) + impact preview on 10 sample bookings.

Version header: author, reason code, linked Jira/issue, publish window
(start/end), scopes (global/state/city/role).

Rollback button restores prior version in one click (future bookings
only).

E\) Versioning, Approvals & Publishing

States: Draft → Legal Review → Ops Review → Scheduled/Published →
Archived.

Approvals: Legal must approve legal doc changes; Marketing approves
comms; Ops approves city addenda.

Scope & scheduling: publish per city/role/cohort with local timezone;
staged rollout (1%→10%→100%).

Pinning: each booking pins doc versions at create (SOW/House Rules) and
accept (releases/license).

Audit: immutable log with actor, reason, diffs, affected scopes, and
rollback link.

F\) ESignatures & Records (Docs)

Signature methods: typedname + checkbox + timestamp, or embedded esign
capture (hosted by provider).

Signer identity: ties to platform account; legal name private, shown
only on signature page and receipts.

Cosigners: both sides sign; LBG: talent/studio sign their respective
docs.

Records: render to PDF, hash & store, link from booking and receipts;
download available to both parties.

18+ enforcement: release templates block minor language; ID Verified
required to sign talent releases.

G\) SOW Generator (RoleAware)

Packages & addons expanded with plainEnglish summaries; license clause
assembled (scope/term/geography/exclusivity).

Travel & overtime clauses pulled from §4.14.2 policy matrices.

Deliverables: count/type, format, due date/time; acceptance window;
revision rounds.

Cancellation bands summarized from policy; clear fee consequences by
timing.

LBG awareness: automatically emits Talent SOW and Studio House Rules;
ties to a Group Receipt (§4.12).

H\) Studio Packs

House Rules templates with required fields: access, hazards, occupancy,
noise, equipment, cleaning, deposit basis.

Autoinsert deposit clause when deposit is enabled; photo evidence
checklist printed on receipt.

Neighborhood privacy: exact address withheld until confirmation; docs
display neighborhood + arrival instructions postaccept.

I\) Dispute & Support Macros

Reusable macro library for Support (approve/deny, partial refund,
revision required, deposit capture notice).

Variables: amounts, dates, links to receipts, policy excerpts; tone
guard flags accusatory/legalese; suggests neutral phrasing.

Appeal templates with timelines and escalation language aligned to
§4.14.5/§4.14.3.

J\) Email/SMS Templates (Comms CMS)

Transactional: booking request, acceptance, reminders, deliverables
due/accepted, payout events, tax forms, verification status.

Lifecycle: onboarding nudge, verify your ID, Trusted Pro invite,
responsetime coaching, city event invites, ROAS tips for boosts.

Localization (Phase 2): perlanguage variants; righttoleft support.

A/B variants for subject/preview lines; guardrails: transactional emails
cannot be suppressed below 100%; marketing adheres to unsubscribe laws.

Ratelimit & quiet hours (cityaware).

K\) Localization & City Addenda

City addenda blocks autoappend local rules (e.g., building access, noise
windows) selected by City Ops; translations linked.

U.S. only at launch; keep language keys prepared for expansion.

L\) Integrations & Embedding

Checkout (§4.7/§4.12): SOW and House Rules visible before pay;
acceptance checkboxes required.

Messaging (§1.4): change orders & deliverables acceptance posted into
the thread with signed doc links.

Receipts (§4.12): link to the exact SOW, releases, House Rules on the
receipt and group receipt.

Disputes (§4.14.5): calculators reference the pinned policy text;
outcome templates autopopulate.

Promotions (§3.3): ribbon text snippets come from CMS allowlist (no
adhoc copy).

M\) Governance & Compliance

Legal owner for legal docs; Marketing owner for comms; Ops owner for
operational clauses.

Change windows for highrisk edits (e.g., not during peak booking days
unless emergency).

Readonly view for auditors; export of doc versions used per booking.

PII minimization: public doc bodies never include emails/phones;
signature pages allowed but masked in previews.

N\) Metrics & Quality

Adoption: % bookings with SOW + release signed preshoot (target 100%).

Dispute defensibility: % disputes where pinned docs directly support
outcome; chargeback win uplift postCMS update.

Comms performance: open/click for transactional (informational),
lifecycle conversion to verification/IB.

Error rate: variable resolution failures (\<0.1%), publish rollbacks
(\<1% of publishes).

Localization quality (Phase 2): language QA score; bounce rates by
locale.

O\) Telemetry (Docs & Comms)

cms.template.create/update/publish/rollback (type=legal\|comms, scope,
actor)
