P\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.10 FINAL)

Clause library with conditions; typed variable catalog with validation
and previews.

Template editor with diff, impact preview, approvals, scoped publish,
schedule & rollback.

SOW generator (roleaware, LBGaware) including deliverables, license,
travel/overtime, cancellation summary.

Releases (18+ enforced) and IP/license addenda; esign capture; PDFs
hashed and linked to bookings/receipts.

House Rules packs with deposit clauses; neighborhood privacy; studio
evidence checklist.

Support macros & appeal templates with tone guard and variables.

Email/SMS CMS with A/B variants, quiet hours, unsubscribe compliance;
transactional never suppressed.

Integrations to Checkout, Messaging, Receipts, Disputes, Promotions;
pinned document versions by booking.

Governance: owners, change windows, audits, legal approvals enforced.

Metrics & telemetry dashboards for adoption, disputes defensibility,
comms performance.

Q\) Why this works

Opsspeed changes without code keep docs and comms aligned with live
policy and city conditions.

Pinned, signed, and hashed records raise trust and win
disputes/chargebacks.

Role and cityaware assembly means one source supports many scenarios,
cleanly.

Guardrails & approvals prevent risky edits from slipping into
production.

§4.14.11 --- Studios Ops

Goal: Operate the studio side of the marketplace without code changes:
verify studios, enforce House Rules & deposits, manage coverage by
neighborhood, keep checkin smooth and safe, and tie studios cleanly into
LBG (Linked Booking Group) flows with talent---while preserving SFW
standards and strong audit trails.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Studios Ops (lead), Trust & Safety, City Ops, Support,
Finance, Content Moderation, Readonly Auditor.\
What it controls: studio onboarding & verification, listing standards,
amenities taxonomy, House Rules packs, deposit defaults & captures,
access/"lockout" handling, safety & compliance fields, visibility in
search/featured, coverage heatmaps, and LBG ties.

Guardrails:

"Studio Verified" badge requires documentation + photo checks; twoperson
approval to revoke badges or capture deposits \> cap (§4.14.6).

No explicit sets; previews must remain SFW (enforced via §4.14.4).

Address privacy: exact address never public preconfirmation;
neighborhood shown until accept.

B\) Studio Onboarding & Verification

Onboarding checklist (adminconfigurable in §4.14.10):

Identity & ownership (choose 1+): lease/utility bill, business
registration, or property manager letter.

Address proof: document + GPSstamped photos (entrance, main room, key
amenities).

Minimum photos (≥12): wide + detail shots; safety items (first aid,
exits) included.

House Rules pack applied (from CMS) with required fields (access,
occupancy, noise, hazards).

Deposits setting (optional): % + cap (defaults from §4.14.2).

Safety & compliance fields: smoke detectors, fire extinguishers, ADA
access, elevators/stairs, parking, neighborhood notes.

Contact method for dayof (masked relay); optional codelock provider
field (logs may be uploaded).

Verification console actions:

Approve / Request changes / Reject (with reasons & examples).

Badge: Studio Verified; badge expires on reverify cadence (12--18 mo).

Reverify queue with reminder emails, autodowngrade if overdue.

C\) Listing Standards & Amenity Taxonomy

Amenity taxonomy (managed in §4.14.2): cyclorama, natural light,
blackout, sound treatment, dressing room, kitchenette, showers, parking,
freight elevator, seamless paper, Cstands, strobes, modifiers,
backdrops, props.\
Blacklisted amenities/rules: hidden cameras, explicit/sexual sets,
escorting/solicitation, dangerous stunts without licensed supervision,
weapons, pyrotechnics (unless permitted), smoking indoors (unless
ventilation + permit), offplatform payment instructions.\
Photo guidelines: no explicit imagery; show space, not people in
sexualized poses; watermarks permitted but unobtrusive.

Moderation: studio listings flow through §4.14.4 queues;
misrepresentation → strike ladder (§4.14.3) and delist until corrected.

D\) House Rules Packs & Safety Addenda (CMSdriven)

House Rules templates (cityaware): access windows, quiet hours,
occupancy cap, gear usage, cleanup, alcohol/drugs, pets, minors on set,
chaperone policy, privacy areas, changing area rules.

Safety Addenda (optional): ladders/rigging rules, fog/haze restrictions,
electrical load limits, mandatory COI for certain rigs.

Autoinsert clauses based on amenities (e.g., cyc wall → no shoes/scuffs;
haze → detectors policy).

City addenda (noise ordinances, loading zones) appended automatically.

E\) Deposits & Damage Claims (with Finance integration)

Defaults (config in §4.14.2):

studio.deposit.default_pct (e.g., 20%); studio.deposit.cap_money (e.g.,
\$250); auth expiry (e.g., 7 days).

Cleaning fee min (e.g., \$25) and overtime rate rules (per 30min
increments).

Operations:

Hold at checkout (separate from GMV); visible in receipts (§4.12).

Claim flow: host uploads timestamped photos + rule reference → Deposit
Claim Calculator suggests capture amount (§4.14.5).

Capture/void/release managed in Finance (§4.14.6); \> cap or \> \$1k
needs dual approval; separate deposit receipt emitted.

Edge cases:

Auth expiring in 24h → alert host + Support; bulk void tool (§4.14.6
runbooks).

Disputed capture → Neutral Review (§4.14.5) with evidence pack.

F\) Access Management & Lockout Handling

Access types: onsite host, code lock, concierge checkin, key pickup;
captured in House Rules.

Lockout signals: repeated code failures, buyer "at door" SOS, phone
relay unanswered.

Playbook: verify instructions sent → check code validity (if logs
provided) → if host fault, refund path + deposit void; if buyer fault,
apply policy bands.

Relocation: surface city's backup studio list; goodwill credit within
caps (§4.14.2).

G\) Availability, Pricing & Visibility Controls

Admin knobs (no code):

Minimum booking duration (e.g., 2h), starttime increments (15/30/60m),
max party size.

Overtime billing rule (per 15/30/60m, grace period).

Cleaning fee band and "reset time" between bookings.

Visibility tier: Verified only appears in "Studio selector" at checkout;
unverified can exist but rank lower or require manual approval.

Featured eligibility (per §4.14.8) and weekly price ladder by city×role.

Search facet toggles: amenities, district/neighborhood, natural light,
sound treatment, max occupancy, deposit required.

H\) LBG (Linked Booking Group) TieIns

Studio + Talent legs autogrouped for cart/checkout; each has its own
SOW/House Rules and receipts but a Group receipt summarizes both
(§4.12).

Change orders allow moving one leg while warning if the other conflicts;
conflict resolution wizard proposes nearest alternatives.

Disputes are legscoped; refund one leg without touching the other;
Support calculators handle prorates (§4.14.5).

I\) Studio Seeding & Coverage (with City Ops)

Coverage heatmap: neighborhoods with bookings vs demand; targets defined
in §4.14.9.

Outreach tools: import local studio lists; template packs for
invitations (discounted Featured, verification subsidies).

Quality gates: require Studio Verified for carousel placement; deposit
defaults autoapplied.

J\) Compliance & Insurance (lighttouch)

COI upload field (optional/required based on amenity---e.g., aerial
rigs); expiry tracking; reminder 30 days prior.

Local regulations: note fields for special permits (fire, drone,
alcohol); checklist acknowledges compliance.

Underage protections: if minors allowed by House Rules, enforce
chaperone clause and IDverified guardian signature.

K\) Support & Safety Integrations

Access failures autoopen Support case (P1) with House Rules and code
logs attached (§4.14.5).

Unsafe conditions reports route to T&S; delist until fixes verified
(§4.14.3).

Moderation: listing images/text scanned per §4.14.4; explicit sets
blocked; appeals possible.

L\) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

Verification coverage (# Verified Studios, % of studio supply).

Access failure rate (per 100 bookings), deposit claim rate & win %.

Dispute rate (studio leg) and time to resolve.

Utilization: hours booked / hours available; overtime incidence.

Image quality pass rate at moderation; COI validity %.

Coverage by neighborhood vs target (green/yellow/red).

Alerts

Lockouts \> threshold/day; deposit auths expiring \> threshold; COI
expiring in ≤30 days; neighborhood coverage gaps; repeated unsafe
condition reports.

studio.access.lockout.signal/resolve

studio.deposit.claim.open/capture/void/release

N\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.11 FINAL)

Onboarding & verification flow with evidence, GPSstamped photos, House
Rules packs, and badge issuance/reverify cadence.

Amenity taxonomy and blacklist enforced; listing photos moderated for
SFW previews.

Deposits configured per city; holds at checkout; claim flow with
evidence and calculator; captures/voids in Finance.

Access & lockout playbooks with relocation option and goodwill credits
within caps.

Availability/pricing knobs (min duration, increments, overtime, cleaning
fee); visibility tiering and search facets.

LBG support: group checkout, legscoped disputes, group receipt, conflict

Compliance fields (COI, permits); reminder system for expiries.

O\) Why this works

Trustable supply (verified, documented, SFW) that plugs directly into
your booking, dispute, and finance rails.

Smooth dayof operations (clear House Rules, access, deposits) cut
Support load and refunds.

City growth ready with coverage targets, seeding tools, and fair
visibility.

Nocode adjustments keep you nimble as you scale studios alongside
talent.

§4.14.12 --- Data & Reporting (Admin UI)

Goal: Give nonengineering teams one place to see how the marketplace is
performing, diagnose issues, and act---without raw SQL. Dashboards are
curated, LBGaware, privacysafe, and tie back to exact definitions in a
shared metric catalog. Exports and alerts are scheduled, and everything
is auditable. (Section 5 will specify the data warehouse schema & event
contracts.)

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Execs, City Ops, Marketing/Promotions, Trust & Safety,
Content Moderation, Support, Finance/Tax, Studios Ops, Product.\
What it covers: Curated dashboards, drilldowns, cohorting/segmentation,
scheduled reports, anomaly alerts, CSV/JSON exports.\
Guardrails:

RBAC mirrors §4.14.1 (Admin Security).

PII masked by default; unmask requires scope + reason.

LBG vs leg metrics are clearly labeled.

All numbers show definition tooltips linking to the Metric Catalog.

B\) Metric Catalog (sourceoftruth)

Catalog entries include: name, owner, business definition, SQL/logic
hash, event sources, time grain, inclusions/exclusions, and version.\
Examples

gmv_total (LBG sum, excludes deposits; refunds netted)

bookings_count (LBG count; includes completed & accepted scheduled)

take_rate_net ( (provider_fee + buyer_fee − processor_fees −
invalid_click_credits) / GMV )

rep_score_avg (roleweighted, timedecayed average)

promos_roas_incremental (holdoutbased; §3.3)

safety_incidents_per_1k (P0+P1 cases / 1,000 LBGs)

calc_error_rate_tax (tax calc exceptions / tax calc requests)

Governance

Every dashboard tile references a catalog key with version (e.g.,
take_rate_net@v2).

Changes trigger deprecation windows and "what changed?" diffs.

C\) Data Freshness & Reliability

Freshness badges on every page: "Updated 8 min ago" with SLA:
nearrealtime (≤15 min) for ops; daily for monthend finance.

Backfill indicators when a replay job is running; "partial" banner on
affected tiles.

Data Quality checks: completeness, duplicate event ratios, referential
integrity (e.g., booking has a city & role), schema drift alarms.

D\) Dashboard Library (curated)

D1. Marketplace Health (Companywide)

Lighthouse tiles (last 7/28/90): GMV (LBG), Bookings (LBG), Net
Takerate, Active Supply by role, Verified %, IB share, Inquiry→Booking
%, Repeat booking %, CSAT, NPS, Safety incidents /1k, Chargeback rate &
win %, Invalid click rate.

Trends: by city & role; stacked time series with YoY/DoW controls.

Drilldowns: click GMV → city→role → provider decile → booking list.

D2. City Ops Dashboard

Targets vs actuals (from §4.14.9): supply targets, ratios, verified

Alerts panel: gaps, overconcentration, budget burn.

Actions: jump links to cohort builder or playbooks.

D3. Growth & Activation

Funnel: Invite → Signup → ID Verify → Publish packages → First booking →
Second booking (retention).

Split by role, city, and acquisition channel.

Cohorts: weekly signup cohorts; time to first booking; weekoverweek

D4. Search & Conversion

Searches, result CTR, contact rate, inquiry→booking rate by role/city.

Ranking diagnostics: distribution by distance/price/rep; effect of Safe
Mode toggles.

Zeroresult queries & top filters used.

D5. Promotions Performance (§4.14.8)

Spend, CPC, CPB, clicks→inquiries→bookings, incremental ROAS (holdout)

Invalid click rate; buyer "Hide promoted" rate.

Featured impressions → clicks → bookings; makegood credits.

D6. Trust & Safety (§4.14.3)

Cases by severity (P0/P1/P2); SLA hit rate; time to mitigation; repeat

D7. Content Moderation (§4.14.4)

Offplatform payment phrase incidence trend.

E\) Filters, Segments & Cohorts

Global filters across dashboards: date range, city/state, role, device

G\) Exports & Scheduling

H\) Alerts & Anomaly Detection

Rules (editable via §4.14.2)

Safety P0 count ≥ 3 in 24h in a city

Payout failure rate \> 0.5% daily

Moderation removal spike \> 3× baseline houroverhour

Destinations: Slack channels (teamspecific) and email; each alert links
to the dashboard deeplink and relevant admin tool.

I\) Privacy, PII & SafeMode Display

PII masking by default; unmask requires scope + reason; downloads

P\) Why this works

§4.14.13 --- Observability & Incident Response

Goal: Detect issues early, respond fast, and recover safely---without
exposing PII or requiring code changes. Provide a unified status
cockpit, clear SLOs/alerts, oneclick degradations/kill switches, tested
runbooks, disciplined postmortems, and links into every admin tool that
matters.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: OnCall (Product/Platform), SRE/Ops, City Ops (read),
Support Leads, Trust & Safety Leads, Finance (payout incidents), Legal
(for P0 comms approvals).\
What it covers: service health, dependency health, synthetic checks,
error budgets, alerts & paging, incident command, comms,
degradations/killswitches (from §4.14.2), runbooks, postmortems, and
status page publishing.

Guardrails:

Paging thresholds & killswitches are configdriven (see §4.14.2) with
twoperson approval for money/safety toggles.

PIIsafe logs only; sensitive views still respect §4.14.1 scopes.

B\) SLOs, SLIs & Error Budgets

Toplevel SLOs (Prod, monthly):

Checkout success (card/ACH): ≥ 99.5% 2xx within p95 latency ≤ 2.5s.

Booking create/accept: ≥ 99.7% success, p95 ≤ 1.5s.

Search: p95 ≤ 800ms, 99.9% availability.

Payout queue: ≥ 99% of eligible payouts queued within 2h of completion;
failure rate \< 0.5%.

Uploads & moderation pipeline: 99% of images/videos scanned within 60s;
backlog \< 2k items.

Tax calc: p95 ≤ 1.5s; exception rate \< 0.5%.

Promotions delivery: spend pacing error \< 5% daily; invalid click
falsenegative rate \< 2%.

SLIs monitored: success rate, latency p50/p95/p99, saturation (queue
depth, CPU/mem), dependency errors, synthetic check pass rate, error
budget burn (1h/6h/24h).

C\) Health Cockpit (Admin → Observability)

Status board tiles: API, Search, Checkout (Card/ACH), Escrow, Payouts,
Promotions, Uploads/Moderation, Tax Engine, Background Check, Studio
Deposits, Messaging, Notifications.\
Each tile shows current SLI/SLO, trend sparkline, errorbudget burn, and
degrade/kill buttons (where safe).\
Dependency pane: external provider status ingest; shows current
incidents & ETA.

Synthetic monitors:

Buyer path: search → profile → add to cart → checkout (card/ACH) →
receipt.

Seller path: accept → deliverables upload → acceptance.

Studio path: calendar → checkout with deposit hold.\
Runs per city (Houston focus + 3 canaries) every minute.

D\) Alerting Policy & Paging

Severities

S0 (P0): Platformwide checkout failure, data loss risk, security breach
→ page immediately (phone/SMS/Slack) to OnCall + Incident Commander
(IC).

S1 (P1): Degraded key flow in any city (e.g., Houston), payout stall,
tax calc outage, promotions overspend → page OnCall.

S2: Elevated error or latency with autoretries; backlog growth; single
dependency degraded → Slack alert to channel; acknowledge within 30 min.

S3: Nonurgent anomalies & dataquality drifts → daily digest.

Threshold examples (editable in §4.14.2):

Checkout success \< 98.5% 10min window (S1); \< 95% 5min (S0).

Tax exceptions \> 2% 15min (S1).

Payout failures \> 1% 30min (S1).

Promotions spend pacing \> +10% houroverhour (S1).

Upload backlog \> 5k or scan p95 \> 120s (S2).

Escalation: IC assigns Ops Lead, Comms/Scribe, and Resolver; if no ack
in 5 min, escalate to secondary.

E\) Incident Lifecycle (declare → close)

Detect (monitor or report) → Declare severity & IC in the tool.

Stabilize: apply degradation/kill switches (see G), raise banners, slow
traffic if needed, open support macro.

Communicate: internal incident room; post to public status page if
S0/S1; cadence every 30--60 min until resolved.

Mitigate & validate: rollbacks, feature flag flips, traffic shifting,
provider fallback.

Resolve: all SLIs normal; remove banners; undegrade; mark "Resolved".

Postmortem: within 5 business days---blameless, action items with
owners/deadlines.

Comms templates (from §4.14.10): internal alert, stakeholder update,
public status page incident, "all clear."

F\) Degradations & Kill Switches (oneclick)

Degrade (preferred) before kill: keeps core value flowing.

Checkout: disable ACH (fallback to card; buyer fee reverts to 5%);
disable multileg/LBG (separate flows) if grouping breaks.

Promotions: pause Featured, keep CPC with stricter caps; or pause all
paid Boosts.

Tax: grace mode---block checkout with clear retry banner (failclosed for
money safety) or delay acceptance with "tax pending" flag (adminapproved
only).

Uploads: switch to queueonly (no preview generation) and lengthen
moderation SLA; throttle size per file.

Payouts: enqueue only, delay send with banner; communicate ETAs to
sellers.

Background checks: switch to IDonly gating temporarily; queue requests.

Studio deposits: disable new auths (fallback to cleaning fee) if PSP
deposit path fails.

Kill switches (hard off; see §4.14.2): Instant Book, Promotions, LBG,
ACH, Deposits, Safe Mode stricton. All require reason + twoperson
approval for money/safety.

G\) Runbooks (top 12)

Card processor incident → route to fallback region; if full outage:
block checkout with banner; open S0; ACH off; autoretry queue.

ACH/Bank link outage → kill ACH; buyer fee back to 5%; announce;
reenable when synthetic passes 30 min.

Tax engine down → enable tax grace mode; hold checkouts or delay
acceptance (policy); alert Finance; reprice none.

Payouts failing → freeze sends; display "payout delayed" in UI; retry
after root cause; notify sellers.

Search index degraded → fall back to cached results/top N; disable
advanced filters; rebuild offline.

Uploads S3/CDN issue → switch to reduced image sizes; queue video; show
"processing longer than usual."

Moderation classifier offline → enforce SFW blur defaults; premoderate
first N items; ramp back after checks.

Promotions overspend anomaly → immediate CPC cap; pause Featured; credit
wallet for overdelivery; rootcause invalid clicks.

Spam/abuse wave → tighten DM caps; block offplatform keywords;
autoquarantine new accounts; T&S mass actions.

Studio lockout spike → open city relocation list; goodwill credit
budget; contact affected bookings.

Feature flag misconfig → oneclick rollback to last known good; diff
viewer; require approver notes.

Data pipeline delay → show "partial" freshness banner; queue scheduled
reports; notify dashboard users.

Each runbook includes: owner, steps, rollback, comms template,
postincident checks.

H\) Change Management & Safeguards

Staged rollout for risky configs (1%→10%→50%→100%); autoabort on
guardrail breach (conversion, checkout, error rate).

Release freeze windows (city launches, holidays).

Preprod synthetic runs parallel to Prod.

Canaries: mirror 1--5% traffic.

Autorollback if error budget 1h burn exceeds threshold.

I\) Logging, Tracing & PII Hygiene

Structured logs with request_id, booking_id, city, role; no plaintext
PII (emails, phones, TINs) ever logged; use tokens only.

Distributed tracing across services; trace viewer limited to Admin
roles; sampling adjustable during incidents.

Retention: app logs 14--30 days; security/finance events 1--3 years (per
policy).

Access: masked views by default; unmask gated by §4.14.1 scopes +
reason.

J\) Backups, Recovery & Continuity

RPO/RTO targets: RPO ≤ 15 min, RTO ≤ 2 h for critical data stores.

Backups: pointintime for primary DB; object storage with lifecycle;
daily job integrity checks; quarterly restore drills.

Event replay: appendonly event bus; replay tools to rebuild search
indexes, counters, and derived aggregates.

External links manifest (deliverables): names/sizes/hashes enable
dispute handling even if thirdparty storage hiccups.

K\) Public Status Page & Comms

Components: API, Checkout, Payouts, Search, Uploads/Media, Promotions,
Tax Engine, Background Checks, Studio Deposits.

Incident workflow: draft → Legal quick review for S0 "wording" →
publish; cadence every 30--60 min; "resolved" with root cause summary
and next steps.

Subscribe: email/RSS.

Transparency guardrails: never include PII; keep copy SFW.

L\) Postmortems (Blameless)

Trigger: any S0, or S1 \> 30 min, or repeat S2 within 7 days.

Structure: what/impact/timeline/where we were blind/root cause(s)/what
helped/hurt/fixes/owners/dates; link to diffs & flags; attach
dashboards.

Action tracking: owners & due dates; reminders; escalation if overdue.

Learning loop: update runbooks/alerts/guardrails; review in weekly ops.

M\) Metrics & Alerts (Observability Program)

MTTD/MTTR (by severity), % incidents detected by monitors vs user
reports (target \> 80% monitors).

Error budget used per SLO; number of autorollbacks; changefailure rate;
paging fatigue (alerts/week/engineer).

Runbook coverage: incidents with matching runbook; time to first
mitigation.

Comms: time from declare → first status page update.

N\) Telemetry (Obs & Incidents)

obs.sli.update (name, value, slo_target) • obs.error_budget.burn

incident.declare (sev, ic, reason) • incident.page/ack/escalate

incident.degrade.on/off (flag) • incident.kill.on/off (flag)

incident.status.update (public\|internal) • incident.resolve

obs.alert.fire/ack/resolve (rule_id) • obs.synthetic.fail/pass

O\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.13 FINAL)

Status cockpit with SLIs/SLOs, error budgets, dependency health, and
oneclick degradations/kill switches.

Alerting policy with severities, thresholds, paging & escalation;
editable via §4.14.2.

Incident workflow (IC assignment, roles, comms cadence, banners, status
page publishing).

Runbooks for top 12 scenarios; linked buttons in cockpit; tested
quarterly.

Change safeguards: staged rollout, guardrails, autorollback; freeze
windows.

PIIsafe logging & tracing with RBAC; retention policies applied.

Backups & restore drills meeting RPO/RTO; event replay tools.

Postmortems with action tracking; program metrics & quarterly review.

Telemetry events emitted; dashboards for MTTD/MTTR, alert volumes, error
budgets.

P\) Why this works

Find fast, fix fast: crisp SLOs and a cockpit that puts degradations and
runbooks one click away.

Safe by design: money/safety toggles require approvals; PII never leaks;
comms stay clear and SFW.

Continuous learning: postmortems feed runbooks and guardrails so
incidents trend down as the platform scales.

§4.14.14 --- Bulk Tools & Migrations

Goal: Give Ops/Support/Finance the power to make large, safe, reversible
changes---without code. Handle duplicates, reindexing, citywide policy
rollouts, mass refunds/credits, campaign adjustments, board/content
moves, and backfills with dryruns, guardrails, approvals, scheduling,
and audit trails. LBGaware, moneysafe, privacysafe.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Super Admin (rare), Ops Leads, Support Leads, Finance,
City Ops, Trust & Safety (specific flows), Content Moderation (specific
flows), Readonly Auditor.

What it can change (entity families):

Users & Accounts (merge, role/profile reparenting, verification status
sync)

Bookings & LBGs (link/unlink legs, acceptance window extensions,
deliverables due date shifts)

Money Objects (bulk refunds/credits/fee adjustments with amended
receipts)

Promotions (boost/featured campaigns: pause/price floor align, budget
edits)

Search/Index & Social Metrics (reindex, backfill, recalc Rep, resync
social metrics)

Boards & Content (move/retag favorites, reassign tagged collaborators)

Studios (policy parameter updates: deposits, cleaning fees, min
durations)

Policy Attachments (SOW/release/House Rules addenda to future/affected
bookings)

Guardrails (always on):

Twoperson approval for money, safety, PIIsensitive, or irreversible
actions.

Dryrun + blastradius preview with sample rows required.

Chunked execution, idempotency keys, resume on failure.

Autogenerate rollback plan (where feasible) + snapshots.

Mask PII in previews; unmask gated by §4.14.1 scopes.

B\) Common Bulk Job Flow (wizard)

Select Operation → entity family + action (see sections below).

Define Target Set → filters (city, role, date range, status,
verification, Rep decile, campaign status, etc.) + optional CSV list
(IDs/emails).

DryRun & Preview → show count, 50row sample (before/after), impacted
KPIs (e.g., total refund \$), dependency checks (e.g., open disputes?).

Risk & Guardrails → flags needed (MoneyCritical, SafetyCritical), limits
(max \$/booking, max \$ total, max rows).

Schedule & Pace → start/end window (local city TZ), batch size,
interbatch delay, offpeak default.

Approvals → second approver with diff viewer.

Execute & Monitor → progress bar, perbatch logs, error bucket with
retry.

Notify (optional) → attach Smart Docs/Comms templates (§4.14.10) to
inform impacted users.

Rollback (if supported) → oneclick create inverse job template prefilled
from snapshot.

Job record includes: actor, reason code, linked ticket, scopes, filters,
dryrun snapshot hash, approvals, schedule, outcome stats, CSV of
affected IDs (downloadable, masked).

C\) Users & Accounts --- Merge & Normalize

Use cases: duplicate signups (email + social), creator with split role
accounts, brand team consolidation.

Actions:

LinkandHold (soft stage, reversible 7 days): mark profiles as aliases;
both URLs redirect to a canonical; present "pending merge" banner in
Admin; no data is moved yet.

Finalize Merge (irreversible): unify login identities, verifications
(highest wins with audit), W9/TIN (prompt to pick primary; alternate
archived), payout method (choose primary), portfolios (dedupe media via
hash), reviews (union), Rep score (recompute with decay), DM threads
(reassign to canonical), promotions wallets (sum balances), boards
(union).

Role/Profile Reparent: move a service profile (e.g., Photographer) from
user A to user B (rare; requires proof + approvals).

Guardrails:

Twoperson approval; no ongoing payout/chargeback on either account; no
active safety cases.

Rollback: only from LinkandHold. After Finalize, a reversal = new merge
job in opposite direction not allowed (must escalate to engineering).

Comms: notify both emails; require reauth next login.

D\) Bookings & LBG --- Relate, Retime, Addenda

Use cases: early legs created separately need grouping; acceptance
window policy changed; stormrelated deliverables extension.

Actions:

Link to LBG: select talent/studio bookings within same buyer + window →
create Group; generate Group Receipt (§4.12).

Unlink leg (rare): leg removed from LBG (keeps its receipts); requires
Support case link.

Acceptance Window Extend: push acceptance due date by N days on open
bookings (config max).

Deliverables Due Shift: move due dates; optional autoaddendum via Smart
Docs; both parties notified.

Policy Addendum: attach a SOW/House Rules addendum to future or open
bookings; requires reaccept in thread.

Guardrails: no money lines altered unless paired with Change Order;
respect city policy keys (§4.14.2); log all changes & notify.

E\) Money --- Safe Bulk Refunds / Credits / Fee Fixes

Use cases: processor outage partial refunds, tax miscalc in one
state/day, goodwill credit wave after access failures.

Actions:

Refunds (partial/full): reasoncoded; perline (packages, addons, travel,
license); recompute fees/taxes; issue amended receipts (§4.12).

Credits (platform wallet): city/role scoped; expirations; ledger post
(§4.14.6).

Fee Adjustment (rare): buyer or provider fee correction for window;
twoperson approval; bounded by floor/cap.

Deposit Voids (studio): mass void for auths expiring due to outage.

Guardrails:

Global caps: max \$ per booking, \$ total, \# rows; chargebackexcluded;
safety cases excluded.

Dual approval; dryrun shows totals; Finance visibility during execution.

Rollback: credits reversible (issue offset); refunds not (issue
countercharge only with consent → avoided).

F\) Promotions --- Campaign Adjustments

Use cases: raise floors citywide; pause Featured during outage; align
active bids to new floors.

Actions:

Pause/Resume active Boost or Featured campaigns (filters: city×role, Rep
tier, budget left).

Floor Alignment: if bid \< floor, autoraise to floor (optin); notify
providers.

Budget & Dates: extend end dates, add makegood credits.

Bulk credit for invalid clicks during incident (ties into §4.14.8
wallet).

Guardrails: eligibility enforced; Finance ledger posts; notify affected
users (template).

G\) Search/Index & Social --- Reindex, Recalc, Resync

Use cases: new facet weights; rep formula tweak; social API outage
recovery.

Actions:

Reindex profiles/search with new §4.14.2 weights or facet toggles;
chunked by city.

Rep Recalc: recompute scores for selected cohorts (e.g., HOU
photographers); publish atomically.

Social Resync: refresh IG/TT/YT/X metrics for affected accounts
(ratelimited; respect API quotas); mark verified/unverified chips
accordingly.

NSFW Rescan: rerun classifier on portfolio thumbnails when threshold
changes; rewrite preview crops.

Guardrails: throttle; backoff on provider API limits; banner "metrics
refreshing" on profiles.

H\) Boards & Content --- Move, Retag, Reassign

Use cases: consolidate user's boards, fix mistagged collaborators after
merge, remove content from feeds.

Actions:

Move items between boards; rename/merge boards; preserve creation dates.

Retag collaborators on content to new canonical user (after merge); send
consent prompt again if needed.

Remove or reprivacy content in policy migrations (e.g., stricter preview
rules) with reason + appeal link.

Guardrails: respect collaborator consent states; moderation rules
(§4.14.4) rerun on moved items.

I\) Studios --- Policy Parameter Updates

Use cases: city raises default deposits; cleaning fee minima update; min
duration changes.

Actions:

Deposit %/cap updates to listings; choose: apply to new bookings only or
also to open (future) bookings via addendum + reaccept.

Cleaning fee minima mass set; min duration increased; starttime
increment adjusted.

Visibility tier: demote unverified studios from carousels.

Guardrails: LBGaware; generate addenda; Finance deposit holds adjusted
only on new checkouts (never silently increased on existing bookings).

J\) Previews, Simulation & Impact Checks

For every job:

Count & sample (before/after columns).

Impact tiles: total refunds \$, \# bookings affected, \# users to
notify, campaigns paused, index rebuild time estimate.

Dependency warnings: "10 bookings have open disputes", "5 users under
safety investigation", "25 payouts queued".

KPI simulation (when applicable): expected takerate delta, ROAS effect
range, search ranking drift.

K\) Scheduling, Chunking & Idempotency

Chunk size defaults (e.g., 500 users; 2,000 bookings; 10,000 index
docs).

Pacing: interbatch delay (e.g., 2--10s), offpeak windows (cityaware).

Idempotency: each batch writes a job_id + batch_id footprint; retries
skip alreadydone rows.

Resume: pick up from last successful batch; Stop is safe; Requeue failed
only.

Rate limits: external API calls (social, PSP) throttled; exponential
backoff.

L\) Communications (optional but recommended)

Attach email/SMS templates (§4.14.10) per job type (refund notice,
policy addendum, campaign pause, merge confirm).

Quiet hours respected; city timezone aware.

"Why you're seeing this" copy autofilled with reason code and policy
link.

M\) Data Integrity & Audit

Snapshot prechange: affected rows (IDs, key fields) hashed and archived.

Immutable job log: inputs, approvals, batches, outcomes, error list.

Entity timelines updated (e.g., "Bulk refund JOB123 applied 20251104").

Downloadables: CSV of results (masked), error CSV, notification list.

N\) Metrics & Alerts

KPIs

Job success %; average retry rate; rollback rate; time to completion.

Money jobs: total \$ moved, variance vs preview (target \< 1%).

Index jobs: doc rebuild throughput, search latency impact.

Comms: open/click/complaint rate on notices.

Safety: user reports spike postjob (guardrail metric).

Alerts

Batch error rate \> threshold; preview vs actual deltas; money cap
nearing; API ratelimit stalls; search p95 \> SLA during reindex.

O\) Telemetry (Bulk Ops)

bulk.job.create/preview/approve/schedule/start/progress/finish/fail/rollback

bulk.scope.resolve (counts) • bulk.sample.fetch

bulk.guardrail.block (reason) • bulk.approval.add

bulk.notify.send/fail • bulk.retry.batch

bulk.money.total_delta • bulk.index.docs_processed

bulk.rollback.create/finish

P\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.14 FINAL)

Unified Bulk Job wizard with filters, dryrun, approvals, schedule,
monitoring, rollback templates.

User merge with LinkandHold → Finalize;
payout/W9/TIN/payout/portfolio/reviews/DMs/boards consolidation;
redirects set; audit logged.

LBG tools: link/unlink legs, acceptance/delivery date shifts, addenda
attach + reaccept flow.

Money jobs: refunds/credits/fee fixes with caps, recomputed fees/taxes,
amended receipts, Finance ledger posts.

Promotions jobs: pause/resume, floor alignment, budget/date edits,
invalidclick makegoods.

Index & metrics jobs: reindex, Rep recalc, social resync, NSFW
rescan---throttled & resumable.

Boards/content: move/merge boards, retag collaborators, reprivacy
content with appeals links.

Studio policy updates: deposit %, caps, cleaning/min duration with
addenda options; no silent increases on existing bookings.

Scheduling/chunking/idempotency and PIIsafe previews; detailed job logs
& snapshots.

Metrics/alerts/telemetry for success, deltas, errors, and performance
impact.

Q\) Why this works

Ops speed, safely: Big changes happen during offpeak with previews,
caps, and approvals.

Reversible where possible: snapshots and rollback templates reduce fear
and downtime.

Money and policyaware: recomputes fees/taxes, issues amended receipts,
triggers addenda and reacceptance where users must opt in.

Scales with growth: chunked, resumable, idempotent jobs keep risk low as
data volume rises.

§4.14.15 --- Legal & Records

Goal: Handle subpoenas/LE requests, litigation holds, datasubject
actions, and retention/deletion safely and defensibly---with
leastprivilege access, full audit trails, reliable exports, and clear
coordination with Trust/Safety, Support, and Finance. Keep engineers out
of the loop for routine matters; make exceptional cases twoperson
approved and PIIsafe.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Legal (owner), Privacy/Compliance, Trust & Safety Leads
(read/assist), Support Leads (DSR assist), Finance/Tax (view for
records), Readonly Auditor.

What it covers:

Intake & verification of subpoenas, warrants, and LE requests (USonly).

Case vaults and legal holds that suspend deletion/retention timers.

Data retention schedules & purge jobs for system records (chat,
bookings, docs, logs).

Data Subject Requests (DSR): access/export, deletion (where allowed),
and optout logging.

Clickwrap & consent logs (ToS/Privacy, Edelivery).

Discovery exports: review sets with PII redaction and hashed manifests.

Guardrails:

Twoperson approval for any data disclosure or hold release (Legal +
Privacy).

PII scopes enforced (see §4.14.1): only Legal role can unmask PIITax and
PIIBackground inside exports.

Chainofcustody hashing on every produced file.

Gag order awareness: suppress user notifications where order shown and
recorded.

B\) Intake & Triage (Subpoenas / LE Requests)

Intake form (upload + metadata): issuer, type (subpoena/warrant/court
order/civil), jurisdiction, case number, served date/time, compliance
deadline, scope (user(s), timeframe), gag order flag, contact info.\
Verification checklist: signature and court details, jurisdiction match
(US), acceptable service method.\
Routing: autoopen Legal case with SLA timers (e.g., acknowledge within 2
business days; faster for warrants).\
Scope precheck: search users/bookings to confirm identifiers; if
insufficient, send clarification template (via Smart Docs §4.14.10).

Case view includes: timeline, documents, internal notes, holds applied,
disclosure decisions, produced packages, and recipients.

C\) Legal Holds (Litigation / Investigations)

Apply hold to: user(s), booking(s)/LBG(s), studio(s), or a time range
across systems.

Effect: freezes deletion jobs, retention clocks, and purge eligibility
for the bound entities; banners appear in Admin entity timelines.

Hold reasons: litigation, LE request, internal investigation, tax/audit.

Release hold: requires twoperson approval; reasons recorded; downstream
purge job reevaluates.

SLA reminders: hold reviews every N days; stale holds flagged.

D\) Retention Schedules & Purge Jobs (USfirst)

Policy profiles (editable, with Legal approval):

Operational data (bookings, receipts, payouts): 7 years.

Chat/message content: 2 years (unless tied to dispute/hold).

Moderation & T&S case records: 5 years.

Logs/telemetry (nonfinancial): 30--90 days depending on sensitivity.

Uploads (thumbnails/manifests): as long as portfolio item exists;
deleted 30 days after account deletion unless under hold.

Tax records (W9/1099 summaries): 7 years; forms stored encrypted with
restricted scope.

Purge engine: nightly job evaluates each record against policy & holds;
performs softdelete → grace → harddelete; writes a purge ledger entry
with counts and IDs (masked).\
Simulation mode: preview impact before policy changes; "blastradius"
diff and rollback window.

E\) Data Subject Requests (DSR) --- Access / Deletion / OptOut

(USonly launch; CPRAstyle patterns to futureproof.)

Access/Export (Data Copy)

Intake: authenticated user or verified requestor; scope (account,
timeframe).

Output: ZIP with JSON/CSV for profile, settings, bookings/LBG, receipts,
messages (thread transcripts), reviews, references, moderation decisions
(nonconfidential summaries), verification statuses (pass/fail),
consents.

Redactions: thirdparty PII (emails/phones) masked unless consent or
legal basis; background/tax data summarized, not raw.

Hash manifest and cover letter (generated via §4.14.10).

SLA target: 45 days (configurable).

Deletion (Right to Delete)

Eligibility rules: block if active booking/dispute/chargeback/hold or
retention obligations (finance/tax).

Partial deletion: remove public content (portfolio/feed), mask profile,
stop discoverability; preserve billing/contract records under retention
and any items under legal hold.

Tombstone logic: display "Deleted User" on historic threads/receipts.

Coolingoff window (e.g., 14 days) with cancellation option; after
window, irreversible purge runs (except retained records).

SLA: 45 days to complete when eligible.

OptOut (Sale/Sharing of data / Marketing)

Track consent and optouts; update messaging lists; record timestamp,
IP/device.

Do Not Sell/Share toggle (futureproof); tie to analytics adsharing flags
if applied later.

Status tracker: per request: received → verifying → in progress →
completed/denied (with reason). Templates for responses in §4.14.10.

F\) Discovery & Production (Civil/Criminal)

Search & collect: entity filters (user, booking range, city), keyword
search across chats and metadata, time bounds.\
Review workspace: preview items with PII masked by default; unmask
gated; tag (responsive/nonresponsive/privileged).\
Redaction tools: blocklist (emails/phones/payment handles), manual
area/line redaction in PDFs, autoredact minors' identifiers.\
Production packages:

Formats: PDF (with redactions), CSV/JSON for structured data, original
media hashes and links (we provide manifests for thirdparty storage like
Drive/Dropbox rather than duplicating large files).

Hash manifest (per file + whole set), cover letter, case metadata.

Chainofcustody: who exported, when, with which scopes; twoperson
approval for release.

Notification rules: where permitted, notify users whose data is
produced; suppressed if gag order recorded.

G\) Policies & ClickWrap/Consent Logs

ToS/Privacy versions, with acceptance timestamps, IP/device, and
surfaces (web/app).

Edelivery consent (tax forms) and marketing consents with granularity
(email/SMS).

Changes: version diffs stored; user reconsent waves scheduled via
§4.14.10.

Download: CSV of acceptance logs by cohort (PII masked) for audits.

H\) Integrations

Trust & Safety (§4.14.3): reference cases, import preserved evidence
into holds; share redacted summaries.

Support & Disputes (§4.14.5): DSR status surface to agents; macro
responses.

Finance & Tax (§4.14.6/§4.14.7): retention overrides for financial/tax
records; W9/1099 forms access gated to Legal.

Docs CMS (§4.14.10): generate cover letters, denial reasons,
clarification requests, and disclosure receipts.

I\) Metrics & SLAs

KPIs

DSR intake volume; % completed on time; average completion days.

Holds applied/active/reviewed; average hold age.

Productions count; average time from verified request → production;
redaction error rate (\<1%).

Purge job throughput and exceptions; records deleted vs retained (by
policy).

Consent coverage: ToS/Privacy acceptance %, Edelivery consent %.

Alerts

DSR backlog \> threshold or any nearing SLA breach (T7/T3/T1 days).

Holds older than review cadence.

Purge errors \> threshold; production export failures.

J\) Telemetry (Legal & Records)

legal.request.intake (type, jurisdiction) • legal.request.verify

legal.hold.apply/release/review

legal.dsr.open/verify/start/complete/deny (code)

legal.purge.simulate/run/fail • legal.policy.update (retention profile)

legal.discovery.search/tag/redact/export

legal.disclosure.approve/release (twoperson)

legal.consent.accept/revoke (tos\|privacy\|edelivery\|marketing)

K\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.15 FINAL)

Intake & verification flow for subpoenas/LE requests with case vault,
SLA timers, and clarification templates.

Legal holds that freeze deletion and display banners; twoperson approval
to release; periodic review reminders.

Retention schedules configurable; purge engine with simulation, nightly
runs, and purge ledger.

DSR: access/export ZIP with redactions & hashes; deletion flow with
tombstones, coolingoff, and eligibility rules; optout toggles logged.

Discovery workspace: search, masked preview, tagging, redaction,
production with hashed manifest and chainofcustody; twoperson release
approval.

Clickwrap & consent logs queryable and exportable.

Integrations with T&S, Support, Finance/Tax, and Smart Docs;
notifications per policy/gag orders.

Metrics & alerts dashboards; Telemetry events emitted for all actions;
RBAC & PII scopes enforced.

L\) Why this works

Defensible: verified intake, documented holds, hashed productions, and
auditable purges.

Practical: redaction and manifests avoid duplicating huge media while
still producing what's required.

Safe by default: masking, leastprivilege, and twoperson approvals keep
sensitive actions controlled.

Lowcode ops: Legal drives routine compliance without engineering; only
edge cases need dev help.

§4.14.16 --- Sandbox & Training

Goal: Give every ops team a safe, realistic playground to learn,
rehearse, and validate workflows---without touching production or real
PII. Provide seeded demo data, simulators for external partners, guided
role training, incident drills, and QA/UAT tooling---with hard
isolation, audits, and oneclick resets.

A\) Scope, Roles & Guardrails

Who uses this: Support, Trust & Safety, City Ops, Finance/Tax, Studios
Ops, Content Moderation, Marketing/Ops, Product, Legal (training),
Readonly Auditors.

What it covers: Environment isolation, anonymized/procedural data,
seeders & scenario packs, fake gateways (payments/tax/ID/background),
webhook simulators, guided curricula, incident drills & chaos tests,
QA/UAT flows, resets & snapshots, reporting.

Guardrails:

No real PII ever enters Sandbox. Exports disabled; screenshots
watermarked "SANDBOX."

Separate SSO & RBAC realms (distinct login & MFA).

Feature flags & configs edited in Sandbox have no effect on Prod
(crossenv writes are blocked).

Network egress from Sandbox limited to simulators and allowlisted
endpoints.

B\) Environments & Isolation

DEV (for builders), SANDBOX (ops training & UAT), STAGE (preprod perf
tests), PROD.

Prominent environment banner + URL subdomain color coding.

Data segregation: unique databases, storage buckets, and API keys per
environment; killswitches default ON in Sandbox for moneymoving actions.

Email/SMS sink: all outbound comms land in a searchable "Message Inbox"
viewer (no real delivery).

C\) Data Strategy (synthetic + anonymized refresh)

Synthetic baseline: cityaccurate Houston cohort plus two satellite
cities; 90day booking history; realistic distributions for roles, Rep
Scores, prices, availability, and social metrics.

Anonymized refresh (optional): scheduled job builds fully anonymized
aggregates from Prod (counts, medians, distributions)---never raw PII.
Deterministic tokenization (formatpreserving) creates realistic but
nonreversible names/handles.

Media: stock & inhouse SFW sets with license to use for training;
thumbnails pregenerated.

Timemachine clock: freeze or advance Sandbox time (±30 days) to simulate
quarterend, 1099 runs, and filing windows.

D\) Seeders & Scenario Packs (oneclick load)

Seeders (idempotent): Users, service profiles, portfolios, studios
(verified/unverified), RFPs, bookings/LBGs, messages, deliverables
manifests, reviews, disputes, deposits, chargebacks, promos.

Scenario packs (choose role, city, difficulty):

Support: "Late delivery & partial refund" --- deliverables shortfall,
acceptance window, amended receipt flow.

T&S: "Boundary violation report" --- autosuppress IB, strike ladder,
neutral review handoff.

Finance: "Processor outage wave" --- bulk partial refunds, recon
variances, payouts delay comms.

Tax: "State X nexus on" --- enable state, category map tweak, calc
exceptions, filing calendar dryrun.

Moderation: "NSFW spike" --- classifier thresholds, blur/crop UI,
appeals triage.

Studios: "Lockout at arrival" --- code logs, relocation list, deposit
void.

Promotions: "ROAS slumps" --- floors tuning, QS weights A/B, makegood
credits.

City Ops: "Coverage gap" --- invites cohort, Founding perks, carousel
pin, Collab Day.

Legal: "Subpoena intake" --- hold creation, discovery workspace,
redacted production pack.

E\) Simulators & Fakes (external dependencies)

Payments Processor Sim: card success/decline matrices, 3DS challenge
emulator, ACH microdeposit flow, payout states (queued/sent/fail),
chargebacks lifecycle with webhook playback.

Tax Engine Sim: city/state rate tables with toggles for timeouts/errors;
"zerowhereexpected" edge cases; efile stubs for 1099 runs.

ID/Background Sim: pass/fail with reason codes; throttling/bulk delays;
FCRA "adverse action" stub.

Content Scan Sim: NSFW classifier bands, OCR PII hits, virus flags.

Notifications Sim: email/SMS/web push sink with opens/clicks.

Maps/Geo Sim: distance & travel fee calculator; studio geocode
anomalies.

Social Metrics Sim: IG/TT/YT/X connectors return tokenized counts,
growth, and ratelimit errors.

Each simulator exposes: dashboard, force state switch, and replay last N
webhooks.

F\) Training Modes & Curricula

Role tracks: Support, T&S, Finance/Tax, City Ops, Studios Ops,
Moderation, Promotions/Ops, Legal.

Guided checklists inside the Admin UI: stepbystep tasks with
autovalidation ("Issue partial refund → amended receipt generated →
totals match calculator").

Inline coach marks & hint videos (60--120s) per task.

Autograding: pass/fail with explanations; require retry when policy
violated.

Certifications: "Sandbox Certified --- Support L1/L2", "T&S L1", etc.;
expire annually; printable PDF badges.

Practice datasets rotate monthly to prevent memorization.

G\) Incident Drills & Chaos Kits

Drill runner: schedule P0/P1 simulations (card processor outage, tax
engine down, promotions overspend).

Chaos toggles: inject latency, error spikes, partial dependency failures
(e.g., 20% payout API errors).

Scoring: MTTD/MTTR, correct use of degradations & runbooks, comms
timing, and adherence to guardrails (twoperson approvals).

Afteraction: autocompiled report; add action items to Observability
postmortem tracker (§4.14.13).

H\) QA & UAT Workflows (nocode)

Flag preview: flip §4.14.2 feature flags safely; simulate staged
rollouts and guardrail aborts.

Docs CMS UAT: assemble SOW/House Rules/releases; esign with fake
signers; pinned versions on fake bookings; PDF render checks.

Promotions UAT: CPC floors and QS weights simulations on a mirror of
last 7 days' synthetic queries.

Bulk Tools UAT: dryrun mass refunds, merges, and reindexes; verify
impact tiles and rollback templates.

Tax UAT: 1099 dryruns with edelivery consent flows; Efile stub returns
filing IDs.

Search & Ranking UAT: compare ranking diffs after rep formula/weight
changes on seeded data.

I\) Resets, Snapshots & Access Windows

Snapshot & restore: nightly baseline + manual snapshots preUAT; restore
in \<15 min.

Oneclick "clean room": wipe personal training footprints
(cases/messages) but keep seeds.

Access windows: training cohorts get timeboxed access; automatic disable
after window.

J\) Guardrails & Safety

Watermarks on every page; copy/paste of IDs adds "SANDBOX" suffix to
prevent misuse.

Downloads limited; CSVs watermarked; large exports blocked.

Money actions are virtual; Sandbox ledger kept separate; no external
funds ever move.

PII masks enforced; unmask buttons removed in Sandbox.

K\) Reporting & KPIs

Training completion rate by role/cohort; firstattempt pass %;
timetocertification.

Drill coverage: \# of drills/quarter; average MTTD/MTTR (Sandbox);
runbook adherence.

UAT throughput: \# of UAT sessions, issues found before Prod, rollback
rate reduction postUAT.

Simulator usage: webhooks replayed, failure modes exercised.

L\) Telemetry (Sandbox & Training)

sb.simulator.state.set
(payments\|tax\|id\|content\|notify\|maps\|social)

sb.drill.start/ack/degrade/resolve/postmortem

M\) Acceptance Criteria (mark 4.14.16 FINAL)

Hardisolated Sandbox with environment banners, email/SMS sink, separate
RBAC/SSO.

Seeders & scenario packs covering Support, T&S, Finance/Tax, Moderation,
Studios, Promotions, City Ops, Legal.

Simulators for payments, tax, ID/background, content scan,
notifications, maps, social; webhook replay & forcestate.

Role curricula with guided checklists, autograding, and certifications.

Incident drills & chaos kit with scoring and afteraction reports.

QA/UAT flows for feature flags, docs CMS, promotions, bulk tools, tax,
and search---all without code.

Snapshots/resets; oneclick clean room; timeboxed training access.

Guardrails (no PII, no exports, no real money movement); watermarking
everywhere.

Reporting & telemetry for training, drills, simulators, and UAT.

N\) Why this works

Teams learn fast and safely on lifelike data.

Integrations behave realistically via simulators and webhooks---no
flakiness, no vendor risk.

Quality rises---UAT & drills catch misconfigs and process gaps before
they hit production.

Culture of readiness---regular drills, certifications, and audits keep
everyone sharp.

§5.0 --- Program Overview & Principles

Goal: Establish a clear, privacysafe, auditable data foundation that
powers ops dashboards, finance/tax accuracy, trust & safety, growth
analytics, and ML---while making schema evolution lowrisk and
predictable.

A\) Scope & Owners

Inscope: Event contracts, IDs & entity graph, ingestion pipelines,
warehouse layers (Bronze/Silver/Gold), metrics catalog & semantic layer,
privacy/PII/retention, dataquality, replays/backfills, lineage, ML
feature store, and cost/perf governance.

Primary owners:

Data Eng (pipelines, storage, contracts),

Analytics (metrics catalog, BI/semantic layer),

Privacy/Compliance (PII/retention/access),

Finance Ops (recon & monthend accuracy),

Product/Obs (event coverage, telemetry).

B\) Design Tenets

Contracts first: Every feature emits versioned events; changes are
additive; breaking changes require new names.

LBGaware by design: The Linked Booking Group is a firstclass key; legs
(Talent, Studio) roll up cleanly.

Bronze → Silver → Gold: Raw immutable logs → clean typed models →
businessready facts/dims.

Privacy by default: PII masked at rest; sensitive tables in restricted
schemas with RBAC scopes (per §4.14.1/§4.14.15).

Dual freshness: Sub15minute ops freshness; dayaccurate finance close
each morning.

Single source of truth: All dashboards pull from a Metrics Catalog with
versioned definitions.

Replays are normal: Idempotent loads and event replays make
audits/backfills safe.

Costaware: Partition by date/city/role, columnar storage, lifecycle
policies, and materialized views for heavy tiles.

C\) What Section 5 Will Deliver (roadmap)

§5.1 Event contract & naming (envelope, namespaces, required fields,
versions).

§5.2 Canonical IDs & entity graph (LBG/leg joins, referential rules).

§5.3 Ingest & pipelines (stream for ops, batch for finance).

§5.4 Warehouse layers & privacy zones.

§5.5 Gold schemas (facts & dims for search, bookings, finance, promos,
tax, T&S, studios).

§5.6 Metrics catalog & semantic layer (ties to §4.14.12).

§5.7 Privacy, PII & retention policies (USfirst).

§5.8 Data quality & testing (schema, invariants, reconciliation).

§5.9 Backfills & replays (tooling + runbooks).

§5.10 External systems & lineage (origin → transforms → dashboards).

§5.11 ML feature store & modeling hooks (ranking, risk, Smart Invites).

§5.12 Cost, performance & governance (SLAs, quotas, deprecation).

D\) Success Metrics & SLAs

Freshness: Ops Silver tables ≤ 15 min; Finance Gold closed by 06:00
local daily.

Reliability: Event loss = 0 (idempotent loads); pipeline success ≥ 99.9%
daily.

Data quality: Finance recon variance \< 0.5%; schema DQ failures \< 0.1%
runs.

Governance: 100% dashboard tiles reference a catalog key@version;
PIIrestricted access logged 100%.

Performance: BI p95 query \< 5s for core tiles; warehouse cost within
monthly budget (tracked).

E\) Change Management & Governance

PR checklist: includes event diffs & metric impact note.

Schema registry: semver + backwardcompatible evolution checks in CI.

Metric versioning: deprecation windows, with "what changed" diffs.

Access control: RBAC scopes (PIIBasic/PIISensitive/PIITax/Background);
masked downloads; watermarked exports.

Retention: nightly purge engine honors legal holds (from §4.14.15).

F\) Risks & Mitigations

Metric drift → enforce catalog & semantic layer; block adhoc SQL in
critical dashboards.

PII exposure → separate schemas + masking + access ledger.

Cost spikes → partitioning, TTL on Bronze, and scheduled
materializations.

Vendor outages → replayable ingest, DLQs, deterministic rebuilds.

G\) Acceptance Criteria (mark §5.0 FINAL)

Principles and scope approved by Data Eng, Analytics, Privacy.

Subsections enumerated with owners assigned.

CI checks for event/schema changes in place ("contracts first").

SLAs & success metrics recorded in Ops runbook and §4.14.12 dashboards.

H\) Why this works

This aligns product, ops, finance, and compliance on one consistent data
language. It preserves velocity (additive contracts, replays) while
keeping privacy and cost under control.

§5.1 --- Event Contract & Naming

Goal: Define a stable, privacysafe event contract so every feature
(Sections 1--4) emits versioned, auditable events that downstream
systems can trust. Contracts are additive, LBGaware, and enforce
consistent types for time, money, IDs, and PII.

A\) Event Envelope (required on every event)

All producers (web, mobile, services, admin) must include this envelope.
Fields are snake_case, UTC timestamps in ISO8601.

{

\"event_id\": \"c3e82a8b-2a1f-4e6a-9bf7-7c9b2b7e0d1a\",

\"event_name\": \"booking.request\",

\"event_version\": \"1.0.0\",

\"occurred_at\": \"2025-11-04T19:22:11Z\",

\"received_at\": \"2025-11-04T19:22:12Z\",

\"actor_user_id\": \"usr_6c2bd1c9\",

\"actor_role\": \"buyer\", // enum:
buyer\|model\|photographer\|videographer\|creator\|studio_host\|admin\|system

\"lbg_id\": \"lbg_01HE9Z7A5S\", // nullable

\"booking_leg_id\": \"leg_01HE9Z8R3C\", // nullable

\"leg_role\": \"talent\", // enum: talent\|studio\|null

\"city_id\": \"city_houston\",

\"state\": \"TX\",

\"country\": \"US\",

\"platform\": \"web\", // enum: web\|ios\|android\|admin\|system

\"app_version\": \"1.3.2\", // nullable

\"session_id\": \"sess_b5f4b2c1\", // nullable

\"request_id\": \"req_7f5c93f4\", // trace/correlation

\"ip_hash\": \"ip_7f6d3b\", // irreversible hash

\"user_agent_hash\": \"ua_1b2c3d\", // irreversible hash

\"privacy_tier\": \"pii_basic\", // enum below

\"payload\": { /\* event-specific schema \*/ }

}

Notes & constraints

Monetary values in minor units (cents) as integers and ISO currency in
payload (e.g., \"currency\": \"USD\").

IDs are stable, opaque strings (see §5.2).

PII (email, phone, TIN, full address) must not appear in payloads; store
tokens/IDs and join in protected tables only.

occurred_at is when the action happened; received_at is ingestion time;
both required.

B\) Naming Rules

event_name is namespace.action in snake_case, e.g., search.query_run,
fin.checkout_pay_success.

Namespaces (toplevel):\
acct, search, profile, msg, booking, deliver, promo, fin, tax, studio,
sup, ts, cms, data, obs, bulk, legal.

Action verbs: run, click, open, send, read, request, accept, decline,
cancel, change_order, upload, accept, queue, sent, fail, charge, credit,
calc_request, calc_response, case_open, decision, publish, rollback,
start, finish.

No breaking renames. If semantics change incompatibly, mint a new
event_name.

C\) Versioning Policy (semver)

event_version = \"MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH\".

MINOR/PATCH: add optional fields, tighten enums with backwardcompatible
defaults.

MAJOR: breaking change → do not bump; create a new event_name (e.g.,
booking.request → booking.request_v2).

Producers must not drop required fields of an existing version.

D\) Types, Enums & Limits (global)

Time: ISO8601 UTC.

Money: integers in cents; currency code \"USD\" at launch.

Distance/geo: meters (int) or \"lat\",\"lon\" floats when needed.

Strings: max 1,024 chars unless noted; free text capped to 5,000.

Arrays: max 1,000 elements; item types defined per schema.

Enums (global):

actor_role:
buyer\|model\|photographer\|videographer\|creator\|studio_host\|admin\|system

leg_role: talent\|studio

platform: web\|ios\|android\|admin\|system

privacy_tier: public\|pii_basic\|pii_sensitive\|pii_tax\|pii_background

E\) Privacy Tiers (enforced at ingest)

public: no PII, safe for broad analytics.

pii_basic: indirect identifiers (user IDs, ip_hash, masked last4).

pii_sensitive: address fragments, DOB (never emitted in events---only
tokens permitted; use for joins if absolutely necessary).

pii_tax: W9/W8/1099 refs (IDs only).

pii_background: background check references (IDs only).

Rule: Raw PII values are forbidden in event payloads; only tokens/IDs
allowed.
