§11.2 --- Trust & Safety Risks (Harassment, Impersonation, Off‑Platform
Harm, Policy Drift)

§11.2 --- Trust & Safety Risks (Harassment, Impersonation, Off‑Platform
Harm, Policy Drift)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management
blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice.
Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any
policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and
must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free
start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict
eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode
defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links
(Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on
acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are
opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags.
Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person
approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:\
• Reduce likelihood and impact of safety incidents involving harassment,
doxxing, impersonation, or off‑platform harm.\
• Keep public content within artistic‑only boundaries; maintain
Safe‑Mode defaults for guests.\
• Ensure consistent moderation with appeals and examples to avoid drift.

Risk statements (top of mind):\
• Harassment/doxxing in DMs or feeds leading to user harm and PR
blowback.\
• Impersonation or fake profiles enabling scams or unsafe bookings.\
• Underage appearance risk; failure to detect minors in media or
accounts.\
• Policy drift causing inconsistent enforcement across cities and
moderators.\
• Off‑platform incidents tied to bookings (safety at shoots).

Primary causes & contributing factors:\
• Insufficient rate limits, weak report tools; unclear consequences.\
• Weak IDV adoption; lax selfie‑to‑ID checks; stock images in profiles.\
• Lack of classifier support; no birthdate consistency checks.\
• Inadequate training; missing examples; subjective decisions without
guidance.\
• Poor venue controls; lack of trusted contact features; unclear house
rules.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:\
• Spike in harassment reports; higher block rates; trending topics
calling out the platform.\
• Chargeback narratives citing impersonation; increased \'scam\'
reports.\
• Reports about age; \'minor\' flags from models; vendor alerts.\
• Appeal reversal rate high; inter‑moderator variance in similar cases.\
• Safety reports post‑booking; law‑enforcement contacts; negative
reviews citing safety.

Preventive controls & mitigations:\
• Stronger rate limits; spam heuristics; \'report & block\' prominent;
doxxing macro and removal.\
• IDV gate for Instant Book; selfie checks; image forensics on profile
media.\
• Age checks in onboarding; minors policy training; escalations to T&S
lead.\
• Policy examples gallery; moderation calibration sessions; QA on
decisions.\
• Trusted contact links; area‑share during booking; studio verification;
house rules.

Incident playbooks (summary):\
• Harassment surge: rate limit new senders; lock threads pending review;
publish anti‑harassment stance.\
• Impersonation ring: mass review of recent signups; require IDV before
messaging; remove offenders.\
• Minor risk: freeze account; verify; remove media; contact authorities
if required.

RACI / Owners:\
• Trust lead, Moderation team, Support, Legal liaison, Studios PM.

Instrumentation & success metrics:\
• Harassment reports per 1,000 legs; appeal reversals; impersonation
takedowns; IDV adoption; safety incident rate.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):\
• Harassment ≥ threshold → enable stricter defaults; impersonation
cluster → require IDV for new DMs.

Dependencies & assumptions:\
• Section 8 policies; §4.14 admin moderation tools; §1.5 signals; §3.4
verification monetization.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):\
□ Calibrated examples live; moderation training complete; appeal SLAs
met; trusted contact & area‑share live.

Scenario Deep‑Dive --- Coordinated harassment campaign:\
Context: External group targets creators after media coverage.\
Trigger: Reports ×3 baseline; social mentions spike.\
Immediate actions: Enable stricter DM limits; block repeat abusive
accounts; comms with safety tips; liaise with PR/legal.\
Communication: Status page + help‑center; direct messages to affected
users.\
Rollback/Forward: Return to normal limits when stable; retrospective.\
Owner: Trust + Comms \| Telemetry: report_rate, block_rate \| Evidence:
Report logs; message excerpts (redacted)

must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free
start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict
eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode
defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links
(Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on
acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are
opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags.
Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person
approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:\
• Protect cash flows with robust processor integrations, reserves, and
dispute playbooks.\
• Minimize tax exposure with allowlists and reconciliations; prevent
miscollection.\
• Keep promotions billing clean with invalid‑click credits and audits.

Risk statements (top of mind):\
• Processor outage or webhook lag causes failed checkouts and delayed
payouts.\
• Chargebacks spike from \'services not rendered\' claims; representment
fails.\
• ACH returns increase; buyer fee discount abused without actual
collection benefit.\
• Tax engine misclassification causes over/under‑collection;
reconciliation variance.\
• Promotions billing errors; invalid clicks; ROAS falls below target.

Primary causes & contributing factors:\
• Single‑threaded webhooks; lack of retries; no queue health monitors.\
• Poor deliverables acceptance; unclear SOW; missing evidence
packaging.\
• Weak bank link verification; unclear ACH discount message.\
• Item category mapping errors; missing city allowlists; tax outage
without fallback.\
• Fraud schemes; mis‑targeted paid delivery; quality score mis‑weights.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:\
• Checkout success drop; payout \'queued\' backlog; settlement variance
alarms.\
• Chargeback rate \> 0.6%; win rate declines; dispute reasons cluster.\
• ACH return codes trend; buyer fee complaints; low ACH adoption despite
discount.\
• Tax quote latency/errors; support tickets on taxes; state variance in
reconciliation.\
• Invalid‑click credit rate \> 7%; buyer hide/report on promoted cards
rises.

Preventive controls & mitigations:\
• Queueing with idempotency; retry workers; multiple processors
readiness; ACH fallback path.\
• Manifest and acceptance flows; chargeback kits; SOW templates; refund
calculators.\
• Strong onboarding for ACH; clear savings math; returns handling
macros.\
• Tax allowlist; pending‑tax banner; nightly reconciliation and credits
memos.\
• Eligibility gates; density caps; QS tuning; holdouts and auto‑credits.

Incident playbooks (summary):\
• Processor incident: prefer ACH; pause promotions; status banners;
drain queues post‑incident.\
• Chargeback wave: strengthen evidence; reach‑outs; review refund policy
adherence; coaching providers.\
• Tax outage: allowlist affected states; capture; amend later; user
notices.

RACI / Owners:\
• Payments PM/Eng, Finance, Tax PM, Growth (promotions), Support.

Instrumentation & success metrics:\
• Checkout success; payout latency; chargeback win rate; ACH adoption;
tax variance; promotions ROAS.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):\
• Sev‑1 for checkout/payout; chargebacks \> threshold; tax errors \>
threshold; ROAS \< 2.5× median.

Dependencies & assumptions:\
• §4.12 payments/tax center; §5 telemetry; §10.3 drills; processor/tax
vendor SLAs.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):\
□ Daily close green 14 days; chargeback kit quality audits ≥95%; tax
reconciliations tight; invalid‑click credits automated.

Scenario Deep‑Dive --- Chargeback ring:\
Context: Clustered BIN and IPs; services not rendered claims.\
Trigger: Chargeback rate spikes; win rate drops.\
Immediate actions: Flag accounts; require IDV; strengthen acceptance
gating; proactive provider coaching; notify processor risk team.\
Communication: Help‑center post on acceptance and deliverables; targeted
provider emails.\
Rollback/Forward: Relax after rate normalizes; keep monitoring for
recurrence.\
Owner: Finance/Payments \| Telemetry: chargeback_rate, win_rate \|
Evidence: Receipts, chats, SOW, manifest, acceptance timestamps

§11.4 --- Data & Security Risks (PII, Admin Abuse, Vendor, Secrets)

§11.4 --- Data & Security Risks (PII, Admin Abuse, Vendor, Secrets)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management
blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice.
Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any
policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and
must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free
start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict
eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode
defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links
(Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on
acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are
opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags.
Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person
approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:\
• Protect user data through least‑privilege, strong auth, encryption,
and auditable admin actions.\
• Reduce vendor and supply‑chain risks with diligence and limited
scopes.\
• Prepare for incidents with clear roles, drills, and communications.

Risk statements (top of mind):\
• PII exposure (name, address, TIN) through misconfigured access or
export.\
• Admin account abuse or credentials compromise leading to unauthorized
actions.\
• Vendor breach affecting processors, tax, IDV, or e‑signature data.\
• Secrets leakage (API keys) causing system compromise.\
• Insufficient logging and monitoring hindering incident response.

Primary causes & contributing factors:\
• Missing RBAC/JIT; broad exports; unmasked PII in UI.\
• Weak 2FA; phishing; shared accounts; poor device hygiene.\
• Vendor lacks SOC/Pentest posture; over‑broad data sharing; missing
DPAs.\
• Keys in source; unmanaged vault; no rotation schedule.\
• Logs without context; missing audit trails; alert fatigue.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:\
• Spike in PII unmask events; large exports; access from new geos.\
• SSO anomalies; failed 2FA; password resets; new device alerts.\
• Vendor incident notices; latency anomalies; unusual API error
patterns.\
• Code scans finding secrets; vault access anomalies; long‑lived
credentials.\
• Missing or failing alerts; gaps in audit logging; delayed incident
detection.

Preventive controls & mitigations:\
• RBAC with PII scopes; masked by default; export reasons; PII access
ledger (§4.14.1).\
• SSO + mandatory 2FA; device trust; phishing training; no shared
accounts; JIT elevation.\
• Vendor due diligence; DPAs; least‑data sharing; breach clauses;
offboarding checklist.\
• Secrets in vault; rotation; static code analysis; CI guards;
break‑glass procedures.\
• Centralized logging; audit immutability; tuned alerts; regular drills;
incident runbooks.

Incident playbooks (summary):\
• Privacy incident: contain; assess; notify per counsel; post‑mortem;
reinforce training.\
• Admin compromise: revoke sessions; rotate secrets; review actions;
force password + 2FA resets.\
• Vendor breach: disable integrations; evaluate blast radius;
communicate if impacted.

RACI / Owners:\
• Security lead (or SRE), Data, Legal/Privacy, Product owners for admin
features.

Instrumentation & success metrics:\
• PII access ledger anomalies; secrets rotation adherence; vendor
attestations current; incident MTTA/MTTR; audit completeness.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):\
• Any confirmed PII exfiltration → Sev‑0; admin compromise → Sev‑1;
vendor breach → Sev‑1 with legal involvement.

Dependencies & assumptions:\
• §4.14.1 access governance; §5.12 observability; vendor SLAs; legal
counsel.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):\
□ RBAC live; PII masked; logs/audits immutable; drills completed; vendor
records current; secrets rotation schedule active.

Scenario Deep‑Dive --- Suspicious PII export:\
Context: Large CSV export by a new admin at odd hours.\
Trigger: Anomaly alert on export size/time.\
Immediate actions: Suspend token; interview admin; check purpose; delete
copies; rotate access; document.\
Communication: Internal only unless exposure confirmed; consult
counsel.\
Rollback/Forward: Restore access with tighter scopes; training
follow‑up.\
Owner: Security lead \| Telemetry: audit_export_events,
pii_unmask_events \| Evidence: Audit log, export file hash, device/IP

§11.5 --- Legal & Regulatory Risks (Content, FCRA, ADA,
Anti‑Discrimination, DMCA)

§11.5 --- Legal & Regulatory Risks (Content, FCRA, ADA,
Anti‑Discrimination, DMCA)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management
blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice.
Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any
policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and
must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free
start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict
eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode
defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links
(Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on
acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are
opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags.
Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person
approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:\
• Reduce litigation and regulatory exposure through clear policies,
training, and admin tools.\
• Operate within US‑only scope with city‑gated rollouts and reversible
flags for policy shifts.\
• Handle notices (DMCA, subpoenas) and FCRA steps correctly.

Risk statements (top of mind):\
• Public content crosses into prohibited explicit territory; moderation
inconsistency.\
• FCRA missteps in background checks (missing notices/wait periods).\
• ADA/accessibility gaps lead to complaints; insufficient
accommodations.\
• Anti‑discrimination violations in listings or conduct.\
• DMCA takedown process failures; repeat infringer policy gaps;
subpoenas mishandled.

Primary causes & contributing factors:\
• Ambiguous examples; Safe‑Mode defaults unclear; edge cases (art vs
explicit).\
• Insufficient training; templates missing; vendor SLAs unclear.\
• Design system not audited; large regressions; insufficient QA.\
• Users write exclusionary criteria; support unsure how to enforce.\
• Intake missing required elements; slow response; poor documentation.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:\
• Appeal reversals trend; inconsistent outcomes between moderators.\
• Trusted Pro appeals citing notice issues; legal inquiries from users.\
• Accessibility tickets; external complaints; screen‑reader bug
reports.\
• Reports of discriminatory language; negative social mentions.\
• Increased DMCA notices; repeat infringer counts; subpoena volume.

Preventive controls & mitigations:\
• Examples gallery and Safe‑Mode; moderator calibration; appeals
workflow.\
• FCRA playbook with timers; pre‑adverse/adverse templates; vendor
integration tests.\
• WCAG 2.1 AA audit cadence; accessible components; accommodation
request flow.\
• Non‑discrimination policy; templates; education first then
enforcement.\
• DMCA agent; intake form; counter‑notice path; evidence storage; legal
review; subpoena intake process.

Incident playbooks (summary):\
• Edge content escalation to T&S + counsel; apply consistent actions;
update examples page.\
• FCRA audit of recent cases; pause badge decisions until gaps fixed;
retrospective training.\
• Accessibility triage; roadmap patch; communicate timelines without
legal admissions.\
• Discrimination report: intake, evidence, proportionate action; publish
learnings (de‑identified).\
• DMCA/subpoena queue; timely responses; transparency reporting.

RACI / Owners:\
• Legal, Trust, Design System, Support, Data (for audits).

Instrumentation & success metrics:\
• Moderation reversal rates; FCRA timing adherence; accessibility defect
backlog; discrimination reports; DMCA SLA adherence.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):\
• Any missed FCRA adverse action window → immediate audit; accessibility
Sev‑1 bug count \> threshold → freeze release until patched.

Dependencies & assumptions:\
• §8 policy docs; §4.14 admin tools; §10 drills; vendor contracts with
SLAs.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):\
□ Public policy pages live; templates/flows tested; audits scheduled;
DMCA agent designated; subpoena process documented.

Scenario Deep‑Dive --- Accessibility complaint from major creator:\
Context: High‑profile creator raises screen‑reader issues publicly.\
Trigger: Social and support spikes.\
Immediate actions: Triage bugs; publish acknowledgment; offer direct
assistance; prioritize fixes; regression tests.\
Communication: Accessible statement and timeline; private outreach.\
Rollback/Forward: None; incorporate feedback into design system.\
Owner: Design System + Product \| Telemetry: accessibility_bug_count,
time_to_fix \| Evidence: Bug tickets; repro steps; user feedback

§11.6 --- Operational & Staffing Risks (Support, Moderation, Vendor
SLAs, Training)

§11.6 --- Operational & Staffing Risks (Support, Moderation, Vendor
SLAs, Training)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management
blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice.
Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any
policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and
must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free
start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict
eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode
defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links
(Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on
acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are
opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags.
Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person
approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:\
• Ensure we have the people, training, and tools to meet SLAs without
burnout.\
• Prevent vendor surprises with clear SLAs, playbooks, and backups.\
• Keep the help‑center and macros aligned with product changes.

Risk statements (top of mind):\
• Support/Trust overwhelmed at launch; SLAs missed; morale drops.\
• Knowledge base drift; macros out of date; inconsistent outcomes.\
• Vendor outages without fallbacks; misaligned SLAs; long recovery
times.\
• On‑call fatigue; unclear incident roles; slow MTTR.

Primary causes & contributing factors:\
• Under‑forecasted volume; insufficient training; admin gaps.\
• Rapid product changes; copy not versioned; lack of ownership.\
• Vendor contracts weak; no status notifications; single points of
failure.\
• On‑call rotations too thin; no drills; tools missing.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:\
• FRT/FRR breaches; reopen rates; CSAT drop; internal escalations rise.\
• Macro usage declines; ticket notes reveal confusion; help‑center views
spike without resolution.\
• Vendor latency and error alerts; outage durations; manual overrides
used.\
• Incident count rises; MTTA/MTTR increases; paging fatigue reports.

Preventive controls & mitigations:\
• Staffing buffers; surge plan; calculators/macros; admin tools; office
hours.\
• KB versioning; DRI for each macro; release notes to support; periodic
reviews.\
• Vendor SLAs; failover tests; status webhooks; backup vendors or
fallbacks.\
• On‑call training; incident roles; drills; better tooling for runbooks
and flags.

Incident playbooks (summary):\
• Support surge: triage queue; prioritize money/safety; extend hours;
auto‑responses for low severity.\
• Vendor outage: switch to fallback; communicate; reconcile later.\
• On‑call fatigue: add backup rotation; lighten non‑incident workload;
coaching.

RACI / Owners:\
• Support lead, Trust lead, SRE, Vendor manager, Product ops.

Instrumentation & success metrics:\
• FRT/FRR; reopen; CSAT; staffing vs forecast; incident MTTR; vendor
uptime vs SLA.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):\
• Two weeks of SLA misses → staffing or scope change; vendor \< 99.9% →
escalation per contract.

Dependencies & assumptions:\
• §4.14 admin tools; §10 launch plans; vendor contracts and status
hooks.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):\
□ Staffing plan signed; training complete; KB and macros versioned;
vendor failover tested; on‑call schedule live.

Scenario Deep‑Dive --- Support backlog post‑PR:\
Context: Large spike in tickets after press coverage.\
Trigger: Backlog \> X for \> Y hours.\
Immediate actions: Enable deflection; reassign staff; extend hours;
templates for common issues; weekly town‑hall webinar.\
Communication: Queue position notices; honest timelines.\
Rollback/Forward: Back to standard hours; retro and staffing
adjustments.\
Owner: Support lead \| Telemetry: queue_size, SLA_breaches \| Evidence:
Ticket logs; macro usage

§11.7 --- City Expansion & Market Risks (Supply/Demand, PR, Competition)

§11.7 --- City Expansion & Market Risks (Supply/Demand, PR, Competition)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management
blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice.
Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any
policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and
must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free
start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict
eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode
defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links
(Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on
acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are
opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags.
Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person
approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:\
• Scale city‑by‑city without diluting quality or overextending
resources.\
• Manage PR around artistic‑only policy while growing creator adoption.\
• Anticipate competitor reactions and prepare counter‑moves.

Risk statements (top of mind):\
• Supply/demand imbalance leads to empty searches or low conversion.\
• PR backlash on nudity policy; misunderstanding of \'artistic‑only\'.\
• Competitor copying features or undercutting fees; paid poaching of
providers.\
• Local regulatory quirks (taxes, studio rules) slow rollouts.

Primary causes & contributing factors:\
• Insufficient seeding; poor neighborhood coverage; mis‑set price
floors.\
• Ambiguous messaging; lack of examples; culture‑specific
sensitivities.\
• No loyalty perks; unclear value vs competitors; weak community.\
• Poor research; lack of local counsel; rushed enablement.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:\
• No‑results rate; S→I and I→B by district; studio attach rate; waitlist
conversion.\
• Press mentions; help‑center views on policy; support tickets querying
policy.\
• Churn of top providers; promotions adoption dips; competitor ads
targeting users.\
• Tax exceptions; studio rejection due to rules; compliance tickets.

Preventive controls & mitigations:\
• City runbook (§10.1); targeted invites; featured carousels; perks;
RFPs.\
• Artistic‑only examples page; Safe‑Mode defaults; local creator
ambassadors.\
• Loyalty (verified boosts, fee discounts for Trusted Pro/Instant Book);
community events; ROAS‑proven promotions.\
• City allowlist; local counsel; studio verification; phased feature
enablement.

Incident playbooks (summary):\
• Thin supply: focus invites, perks; adjust floors; partner with
studios; PR push with ambassadors.\
• PR backlash: publish examples; enforce policy consistently; avoid
adversarial tone; spotlight safety.\
• Competitor move: emphasize escrow, contracts, trust signals, and
fairness of promotions; not a race to the bottom.

RACI / Owners:\
• City GM, Growth, Trust, Legal, Studios PM.

Instrumentation & success metrics:\
• Coverage heatmaps; conversion by area; PR sentiment; share of wallet
among active providers; event attendance.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):\
• City expansion blocked if conversion or safety below thresholds for 4
weeks.\
• PR negativity above threshold triggers comms and creator outreach
plan.

Dependencies & assumptions:\
• §2 GTM plan; §3 monetization; §4 studios; §10 city turn‑up; §8 legal
posture.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):\
□ City readiness gates passed; ambassador program staffed; press kit
updated; compliance checks cleared.

Scenario Deep‑Dive --- Competitor fee cut campaign:\
Context: Local competitor drops fees to poach providers.\
Trigger: Churn increases among top quartile.\
Immediate actions: Targeted outreach; highlight escrow/trust;
limited‑time boosts credits; emphasize earnings after fees.\
Communication: Personalized messages; city page explainer.\
Rollback/Forward: End credits after stabilization; measure sustainable
effect.\
Owner: Growth/GM \| Telemetry: provider_churn, bookings_share \|
Evidence: Exit surveys; earnings comparisons

§11.8 --- Crisis Scenarios & Cross‑Team Drills (Sev‑0/1, Public Comms,
Recovery)

§11.8 --- Crisis Scenarios & Cross‑Team Drills (Sev‑0/1, Public Comms,
Recovery)

Risk & Process Disclaimer: This section is an internal risk‑management
blueprint. It does not constitute legal, tax, or security advice.
Coordinate with counsel and security leaders before externalizing any
policy or committing to obligations. All examples are illustrative and
must be adapted to the realities measured in Section 5 dashboards.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace launch; subscription‑free
start; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with strict
eligibility and caps. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode
defaults for guests. Deliverables are exchanged via external links
(Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed payments release on
acceptance. Instant Book requires ID verification; background checks are
opt‑in (Trusted Pro). Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags.
Admin Console enforces least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person
approvals, and full audit trails.

Goals:\
• Prepare for high‑impact, low‑probability events with rehearsed drills
and clear command.\
• Coordinate public communications that are honest, timely, and
user‑centric.\
• Recover quickly while preserving evidence and trust.

Risk statements (top of mind):\
• Data exfiltration of PII; public leak.\
• Payments freeze (processor outage); delayed payouts; mass refunds.\
• Content policy crisis with press amplification.\
• Law‑enforcement emergency request mishandled or leaked.\
• Tax miscollection discovered post‑fact with state inquiry.

Primary causes & contributing factors:\
• Zero‑day exploit or human error; inadequate segmentation; weak secrets
management.\
• Single point of failure; webhook lag; missing fallbacks.\
• Edge moderation cases; inconsistent enforcement; unclear examples.\
• Poor intake; inadequate counsel coordination; staff inexperience.\
• Allowlist gaps; mapping errors; missed reconciliation signals.

Leading indicators & early warning signals:\
• SIEM alerts; unusual export volumes; media contact; external
researcher reports.\
• Checkout failures; payout backlog; angry tickets; social mentions.\
• Reporter inquiries; creator backlash; surge in appeals.\
• LEA emails; urgent calls; subpoenas without proper service.\
• State notices; reconciliation variances; user complaints about taxes.

Preventive controls & mitigations:\
• Zero‑trust posture; RBAC/JIT; secrets rotation; backups; drills.\
• Multi‑processor readiness; ACH fallback; status page; clear banners;
queue resilience.\
• Examples gallery; Safe‑Mode; training; appeals path; PR playbook.\
• LEA intake process; counsel oversight; audit trails; emergency
disclosure policy.\
• Tax engine allowlists; nightly reconciliation; corrective memos;
disclosure templates.

Incident playbooks (summary):\
• Breach response: contain, assess, notify as required; public
statement; long‑term hardening.\
• Processor incident: prefer ACH; pause promos; display banners;
proactive emails on payouts.\
• Policy crisis: consistent enforcement; examples; supportive tone;
moderator QA; appeal volume handling.\
• LEA mishandling: internal review; reinforce process; counsel‑approved
messaging; training refreshers.\
• Tax exposure: compute liability; consult counsel; amend receipts;
communicate refunds or charges.

RACI / Owners:\
• Incident Commander (IC), Security lead, Payments PM, Trust lead,
Legal/PR, Finance, SRE.

Instrumentation & success metrics:\
• MTTA/MTTR; user sentiment; incident recurrence; post‑mortem action
completion; legal response times.

Thresholds & triggers (Go/No‑Go, rollback, escalation):\
• Sev‑0 declared when user PII confirmed exposed or checkout is broadly
down; Sev‑1 for prolonged partial outages.

Dependencies & assumptions:\
• §10.7 incident drills; §8 legal policies; §4.12 money; vendor SLAs;
status page.

Acceptance checklist (risk under control when):\
□ Drills completed; comms templates approved; status page playbook
tested; evidence capture process verified.

Scenario Deep‑Dive --- Public breach disclosure window:\
Context: Regulatory deadlines and user expectations collide.\
Trigger: Counsel advises notification deadlines approaching.\
Immediate actions: Draft statement; notify affected users; coordinate
with vendors; implement mitigations; open FAQ.\
Communication: Honest, user‑centric; no speculation; link to resources;
provide credit monitoring if appropriate.\
Rollback/Forward: N/A; focus on long‑term hardening and transparency
report.\
Owner: IC + Legal/PR \| Telemetry: notification_sent, MTTR \| Evidence:
Forensic logs; vendor statements; audit trails

§12.0 --- Roadmap Principles & Themes (Trust‑First, Reversible,
Measurable)

§12.0 --- Roadmap Principles & Themes (Trust‑First, Reversible,
Measurable)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• Applies across all phases; updated quarterly after 7/30/90‑day
reviews.

Goals:\
• Ship trust‑critical features early; avoid scaling without safety and
money readiness.\
• Prefer reversible, city‑gated changes; use flags and holdouts for
anything that touches ranking or money.\
• Instrument everything; decisions follow data from §5 dashboards, not
anecdotes.

Product Themes:\
• Trust‑First UX: IDV→Instant Book, Safe‑Mode default, clear
deliverables manifest, transparent fees.\
• Fair Discovery: relevance first; paid boosts capped, labeled, and
eligibility‑gated.\
• Creator Earnings: faster time‑to‑first booking; simple change‑orders;
clear travel fees; Early Payout (per‑use).\
• Operational Excellence: admin operability; two‑person approvals;
immutable audits; status page discipline.\
• City‑by‑City: runbooks, founding perks, local studios and ambassadors,
metrics gates.\
• Sustainable Monetization: take‑rate first; usage‑based promotions;
defer subscriptions until liquidity is proven.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Profiles & Search (role‑aware, social metrics, presets).\
• Booking & Money (escrow, change orders, travel fees, tax engine
allowlists).\
• Messaging & Collaboration (threads, file manifests, checklists).\
• Trust & Safety (IDV/BG, moderation, Safe‑Mode, appeals).\
• Promotions (CPC/Featured v1 with caps, QS, holdouts).\
• Studios (phase‑gated, deposit rules, house rules, verified badge).\
• Analytics & Admin (dashboards, flags, incident drills).

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.idv.instant_book, feature.promotions.v1, feature.studio.beta,
feature.group_checkout, feature.lbg_receipt, city.{HOU,DAL,AUS}
allowlists.

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• Vendors: processor(s), ACH, tax engine, IDV, BG, e‑signature, comms.
Internal: §5 data; §4 admin; §8 policy; §10 playbooks.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Over‑scope early phases; promotions perceived as pay‑to‑win; tax
misconfig; moderation backlog; processor outage.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• S→I, I→B, time‑to‑first booking, dispute loss rate, payout latency,
IDV %, Trusted Pro %, promotions ROAS, no‑results rate, tax variance.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ Every phase has go/no‑go gates signed by Product, Trust, Finance, and
SRE.\
✓ Help‑center parity with UI; admin tools cover top 3 edge cases.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• Phase‑linked squads: Profiles/Search, Booking/Money, Trust/Safety,
Promotions/Growth, Studios, Platform/SRE, Data, Support/City Ops.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Quarterly roadmap review; monthly risk register review; flag audits;
city expansion checkpoint meetings.

Implementation Notes:\
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a
runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to
\'off\' in new cities.\
• Admin Operability: No workstream is \'done\' until admin tools enable
Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without
engineering.\
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS
templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.\
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include
processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command
handoffs.\
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking,
boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental
impact.\
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only
from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.\
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and
keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.\
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive
admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.\
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors,
studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.\
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap
changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.1 --- Phase 0 (Pre‑Alpha): Scaffolding, Schemas, Admin, Policy

§12.1 --- Phase 0 (Pre‑Alpha): Scaffolding, Schemas, Admin, Policy

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• T‑90 to T‑45 days before Alpha invite (internal & selected creators).

Goals:\
• Stand up core data schemas and events; ensure Admin Console MVP
supports support/trust workflows.\
• Draft policy and help content aligned to product scope (artistic‑only
public, Safe‑Mode default).\
• Select vendors (processor(s), ACH, tax, IDV/BG, e‑signature, comms)
and wire sandbox integrations.

Product Themes:\
• Get the foundation right: data, admin, identity, money contracts, and
reversible flags.\
• Internal dogfooding with synthetic bookings to validate core loop and
receipts.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Data models: users, roles, service profiles, packages, bookings
(legs), payments, receipts, promotions, audits.\
• Events: search, inquiry, booking request, acceptance, change order,
deliverables manifest, acceptance, payout queued/sent, disputes.\
• Admin MVP: support refunds/amendments, content redaction,
impersonate/view‑as, audits.\
• Policy drafts: ToS, Privacy, Content/Safety; examples gallery for
artistic‑only and Safe‑Mode.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.booking.core, feature.messaging.core, feature.admin.mini,
feature.tax.allowlist=false (sandbox), feature.idv.sandbox.

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• Engineering environment, CI/CD, feature flag system, observability
stack (§5.12), ticketing (Support/Trust).

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Schema churn; admin gaps; unclear policy copy; vendor SLA surprises.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• Synthetic loop pass rate; admin task completion without engineering;
staging stability; event completeness to Gold.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ Core loop passes end‑to‑end in staging; admin can amend receipts and
issue refunds; policy drafts ready for counsel review.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• Founding Eng squad; Data engineer; Product/Design; Support/Trust
liaisons; Legal consult; SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Schema freeze; admin MVP; sandbox vendors functioning; policy and help
drafts staged.

Implementation Notes:\
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a
runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to
\'off\' in new cities.\
• Admin Operability: No workstream is \'done\' until admin tools enable
Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without
engineering.\
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS
templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.\
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include
processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command
handoffs.\
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking,
boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental
impact.\
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only
from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.\
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and
keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.\
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive
admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.\
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors,
studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.\
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap
changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.2 --- Phase 1 (Alpha): Role Profiles, Search Basics, Booking &
Escrow, Messaging

§12.2 --- Phase 1 (Alpha): Role Profiles, Search Basics, Booking &
Escrow, Messaging

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• T‑45 to T‑0; internal + small cohort (≤150 creators/buyers).

Goals:\
• Validate the core loop with real users in a controlled cohort; collect
usability feedback.\
• Enable role‑specific profiles and search presets; keep filter UI
simple with an advanced drawer.\
• Operationalize escrow, deliverables manifests, and acceptance flows;
enforce Safe‑Mode on public surfaces.

Product Themes:\
• Minimum lovable product for discovery and booking; admin operability
before scale.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Role tabs; separate reviews per role; portfolio uploads with
tagging/approvals; social metrics chips (verified if connected).\
• Search presets (e.g., \'Fashion model in Houston this week\');
advanced filter drawer; verified‑only toggle.\
• Booking requests, acceptance, change orders; deliverables manifest
(lightweight) with external link manifest capture.\
• Messaging threads with file gating; reschedule within rules;
notifications; read receipts (optional).

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.search.presets, feature.reviews.by_role,
feature.manifest.external_only, feature.messaging.read_receipts.

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• IDV vendor in sandbox; escrow on processor; ACH sandbox; help‑center;
admin refund calculator.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Overly complex filters; manifest intimidation; messaging misuse;
off‑platform leakage.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• S→I and I→B in cohort; manifest completion rate; off‑platform warning
triggers; response time; support tickets by category.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ S→I ≥ 15%; I→B ≥ 25% within cohort; admin resolves top 10 issues
without engineering; Safe‑Mode effective; no Sev‑1s.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• Profiles/Search squad; Booking/Money squad; Support; Trust; Design
Research.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Alpha retrospective; copy tweaks; filter tuning; manifest
improvements; help updates.

§12.3 --- Phase 2 (Public Beta --- Houston): Verification, Policies,
Change Orders, Travel Fees

§12.3 --- Phase 2 (Public Beta --- Houston): Verification, Policies,
Change Orders, Travel Fees

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• City‑gated public beta in Houston; T0 to T+90.

Goals:\
• Prove conversion at city scale while keeping safety and money stable.\
• Enable verification gating (IDV→Instant Book; Trusted Pro optional
with FCRA playbook).\
• Finalize change orders, travel fees, and time‑band cancellation logic;
improve manifest UX.

Product Themes:\
• Quality supply and fast path to first booking; clear money math and
schedules.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• IDV production; Instant Book eligibility; Trusted Pro flow; reputation
score and search tie‑break.\
• Change orders and reschedule; travel fee calculator by radius/zip;
deposits (studios not yet).\
• Refund calculators; tax allowlist (Texas) on; receipts itemize fees
and taxes; ACH discount visible.\
• Safety: harassment macros; rate limits; reporting; appeals; Safe‑Mode
hardening.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.idv.prod, feature.instant_book, feature.travel.calculator,
feature.refund.calculator, feature.tax.allowlist=TX.

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• Processor production; tax engine; comms; support staffing; moderation
staffing; studios partner outreach groundwork.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Moderation backlog; tax errors; money reconciliation variance;
chargeback narratives; harassment waves.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• City S→I ≥ 20%; I→B ≥ 35%; time‑to‑first booking; dispute loss ≤
target; ACH share; payout latency; moderation SLA.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ KPIs hit for 30 days; daily close green; dispute kit quality high;
help‑center parity; incident drills passed.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• City GM; Support; Trust; Payments/Tax; Growth; Data; SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Beta review at T+30 and T+60; PR moments; creator meetups;
endorsements.

§12.4 --- Phase 3 (GA --- Houston): Promotions v1, Tax Allowlist, Early
Payout (Per‑Use)

§12.4 --- Phase 3 (GA --- Houston): Promotions v1, Tax Allowlist, Early
Payout (Per‑Use)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• T+90 to T+150 (post‑beta, same city).

Goals:\
• Turn on promotions v1 with caps and holdouts; prove ≥2.5× ROAS without
harming organic search.\
• Stabilize money ops: ACH discount live; tax allowlist expanded where
ready; Early Payout per‑use live for high‑rep providers.\
• Harden safety and admin workflows for scale.

Product Themes:\
• Add monetization carefully; keep fairness and trust standards intact.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Search Boost (CPC floors by role/city) + Featured (weekly) with
labels, caps, QS, and holdouts; invalid‑click auto‑credits.\
• Payments & tax: ACH discount messaging; allowlist expansion (if
ready); amended receipts; daily close automation.\
• Early Payout per‑use (eligibility Rep ≥ 85 + IDV); reserve rules;
payout ledger improvements.\
• Safety: harassment tooling, doxxing macro, stricter rate limits for
new accounts; appeals capacity.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.promotions.v1, feature.early_payout,
feature.tax.allowlist.{more_states}, feature.payout.reserve.rules.

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• Growth analytics; finance dashboards; Trust staffing; support macros;
status page templates.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Pay‑to‑win perception; invalid clicks; tax variance; payout queue
stuck; support overload.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• Promotions adoption; ROAS; invalid‑click credit %; organic KPIs
steady; payout latency; tax variance; support SLA.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ ROAS median ≥ 2.5×; organic KPIs steady; daily close green 14 days;
Early Payout error rate ≤ target.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• Growth PM, Finance, Payments Eng, Trust, Support, Data, SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• GA announcement; case studies; Featured carousels; ROAS report;

Implementation Notes:\
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a
runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to
\'off\' in new cities.\
• Admin Operability: No workstream is \'done\' until admin tools enable
Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without
engineering.\
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS
templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.\
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include
processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command
handoffs.\
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking,
boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental
impact.\
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only
from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.\
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and
keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.\
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive
admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.\
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors,
studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.\
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap
changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.5 --- Phase 4 (City Expansion --- Dallas/Austin): Reuse Playbook;
Prep Studios Beta

§12.5 --- Phase 4 (City Expansion --- Dallas/Austin): Reuse Playbook;
Prep Studios Beta

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• T+150 to T+240.

Goals:\
• Replicate Houston GA playbook in Dallas and Austin with measured spend
and PR.\
• Prepare Studios Beta (verification, house rules, deposit defaults) for
a limited cohort.\
• Ensure cross‑city data comparability; maintain flag discipline.

Product Themes:\
• Scale predictably; avoid overextending; test studios with narrow
scope.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• City turn‑up runbooks; founding perks; featured carousels; referral
codes via partner studios.\
• Studio verification flow (doc upload + light review); house rules
template library; deposit holds; check‑in/out surfaces.\
• LBG scaffolding (internal): dual‑leg receipts off; group bundling
experiments (behind flags only).

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• city.DAL allowlist, city.AUS allowlist, feature.studio.beta=false,
feature.lbg.scaffold=true (internal only).

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• City ops staff; studio partner pipeline; legal review of house rules;
deposit capture on processor.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Supply thin pockets; PR backlash; deposit misuse; studio disputes;
throughput on support.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• City S→I/I→B; supply coverage heatmaps; studio attach rate; deposit
claims; dispute rate for studio bookings.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ Dallas/Austin meet beta→GA gates; studio beta ready checklists green;
deposit flow tested.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• City GMs; Studios PM; Trust; Support; Growth; Finance; SRE.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Dallas GA; Austin GA; Studios Beta go/no‑go; partner case studies.

§12.6 --- Phase 5 (V2 Themes): Studios Beta, LBG Group Checkout, Social
Metrics Advanced, Reputation

§12.6 --- Phase 5 (V2 Themes): Studios Beta, LBG Group Checkout, Social
Metrics Advanced, Reputation

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• T+240 to T+330.

Goals:\
• Run Studios Beta with limited slots; measure attach and claims;
iterate house rules and deposits.\
• Pilot LBG (talent+studio group checkout) behind invite; generate group
receipts; improve change‑order flows across legs.\
• Advance social metrics (growth, engagement presets); refine reputation
score with decay and role‑weighting.

Product Themes:\
• Broader use cases while preserving fairness and safety.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Studios: verified badge; search filter; safety addenda; host
messaging; calendar blocks; cleaning fee modeling.\
• LBG: shared quote, split escrow; group receipt; per‑leg changes;
cancellation coordination; admin tools and auditing.\
• Social: per‑platform sliders; verified‑only toggle; growth trends;
\'High engagement\' presets; explanation tooltips.\
• Reputation: time‑weighted, role‑specific; \'Why this score?\' panel;
negative event decay and caps.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.studio.beta=true (invite only), feature.lbg.checkout.beta=true
(invite only), feature.social.metrics.advanced, feature.rep.v2.

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• Processor for split captures; tax on deposits; host policy; moderation
capacity; help‑center expansion.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Complexity overload; studio disputes; LBG reconciliation; user
confusion on social metrics and reputation.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• Studio attach and repeat; deposit claim rate; LBG conversion vs
single‑leg; dispute trends; social filter usage; rep distribution
health.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ Studios Beta NPS ≥ target; LBG pilot stable; no regression to S→I/I→B;
support load manageable.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• Studios squad; Booking/Money squad; Data; Trust; Support; Finance.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Studios beta retrospective; LBG pilot findings; decision on GA or
further beta.

§12.7 --- Phase 6: Mobile Apps (iOS/Android) & Partner API
(Rate‑Limited)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at

eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to

Timeframe & Scope:\
• T+300 to T+390 (after multi‑city GA).

Goals:\
• Deliver mobile apps that improve conversion (notifications,
availability, messaging) without diverging product logic.\
• Expose a limited partner API for brands and studios under strict
scopes and rate limits.

Product Themes:\
• Meet users where they are; keep parity with web; maintain safety and
fairness controls.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• iOS/Android apps: login/IDV, search, profiles, booking, messaging,
deliverables manifest review, notifications, wallet; deep links.\
• Push notifications with quiet hours; granular controls;
safety‑respecting previews.\
• Partner API: read‑only search & profile data; RFP creation; webhooks
for booking state; OAuth scopes; rate limits; abuse monitoring.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.mobile.apps.beta=true (invite), feature.api.partner.read=true
(whitelist).

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• Mobile CI/CD; app store policies; privacy reviews; push infra; OAuth
provider; abuse detection.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Notification fatigue; API misuse; mobile parity gaps; app review
delays.

• Mobile activation; response time; bookings initiated on mobile;
notification opt‑outs; API error/abuse rates.

abuse anomaly rates low.

§12.8 --- Phase 7: Technical Debt, Performance & Quality Gates

§12.8 --- Phase 7: Technical Debt, Performance & Quality Gates

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• Runs continuously; major focus windows after each GA.

Goals:\
• Keep reliability, security, performance, and data quality within SLOs
while the roadmap evolves.\
• Pay down structural debt and keep dependencies current.

Product Themes:\
• Stability as a feature; invest in platform health to sustain growth.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Performance SLOs for search/messaging/checkout; budgets enforced in
CI; profiling and regressions tracked.\
• Observability: logs/metrics/traces; error budgets; incident
retrospectives; runbooks updated.\
• Security posture: secrets rotation; dependency updates; vulnerability
scans; pentest remediation.\
• Data quality: freshness, completeness, correctness checks; lineage;
rollback procedures.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• feature.perf.budgets, feature.logs.traces, feature.security.scanner,
feature.data.dq.gates.

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• SRE platform; security tooling; data platform; team time allocation;
leadership commitment.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Feature pressure crowds out quality; silent regressions; security
drift; data incidents affecting finance.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• SLO compliance; incident counts and MTTA/MTTR; vuln backlog age; DQ
gate pass rates; perf budget adherence.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ Error budgets green ≥ 80% of quarters; no Sev‑0 from preventable
causes; DQ gates pass with exceptions documented.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• SRE; Platform; Security; Data; Product owners accountable for quality
alongside features.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Quarterly hardening sprints; dependency upgrade days; pentest
completion; DQ audit sign‑offs.

Implementation Notes:\
• Flag Discipline: Each capability ships behind a named flag with a
runbook, owner, rollback, and blast‑radius notes. Flags default to
\'off\' in new cities.\
• Admin Operability: No workstream is \'done\' until admin tools enable
Support/Trust/Finance to handle the top 3 edge cases without
engineering.\
• Copy & Policy: All flows have help‑center articles and email/SMS
templates; copy avoids legalese and links to policy examples.\
• QA & Drills: Staging mimics production data shapes; drills include
processor/tax outages, moderation surges, and incident command
handoffs.\
• Experimentation: Features that affect marketplace economics (ranking,
boosts, fees) include holdouts and guardrails; we measure incremental
impact.\
• Data Wiring: Events land in Bronze/Silver/Gold (§5); KPIs pull only
from Gold with freshness SLOs. Definitions live in a metrics catalog.\
• Accessibility: New UI complies with WCAG 2.1 AA; screen‑reader and
keyboard paths verified; contrast ratios checked; defects triaged.\
• Security & Privacy: PII masked by default; JIT elevation for sensitive
admin actions; vendor scopes minimal; audits immutable.\
• City Readiness: City‑first artifacts (press kit, creator ambassadors,
studio partners) prepared in §10.1 runbook.\
• Post‑Launch: 7/30/90‑day reviews convert observations into roadmap
changes; flags let us tune by city without forks.

§12.9 --- Phase 8: Staffing & Budget Alignment (Squads, Vendors, SLAs)

§12.9 --- Phase 8: Staffing & Budget Alignment (Squads, Vendors, SLAs)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• Updated quarterly; synchronized with Section 9 budgets and Section 10
launches.

Goals:\
• Align headcount and vendor spend with phase gates and city
expansions.\
• Ensure Support/Trust scaling keeps SLAs while avoiding over‑hiring.

Product Themes:\
• Lean, phased hiring; vendor consolidation; training and quality
guardrails.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Squad plans per phase; hiring profiles; onboarding; training;
shadowing; QA sign‑off.\
• Vendor spend reviews; SLA scorecards; renewal calendar;
backups/failovers.\
• Support/Trust staffing models; surge plans; knowledge base and macro
maintenance cadence.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• ops.hiring.freeze (when needed), vendor.sla.alerts, support.surge.plan

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• Finance budgets (§9), GTM (§2), launches (§10), admin tooling (§4.14).

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Over‑hiring ahead of signals; vendor lock‑in; training gaps; burnout;
SLA misses.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• Runway months; burn multiple; SLA compliance; training completion;
macro freshness; vendor uptime vs SLA.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ Hiring unlocks tied to KPIs; vendor SLAs green; support SLAs met with
buffers.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• Leadership, HR/Recruiting, Finance, City Ops, Support/Trust,
Engineering managers.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Quarterly headcount review; vendor rationalization; training
refreshes; retention checks.

§12.10 --- Phase Gates, KPIs & Exit Criteria (Go/No‑Go per Phase & City)

§12.10 --- Phase Gates, KPIs & Exit Criteria (Go/No‑Go per Phase & City)

Roadmap Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document. Dates are
placeholders and will firm up as Section 5 telemetry validates
conversion and quality gates. All items ship behind flags and city
allowlists. Nothing herein creates external commitments.

Context & Alignment: US‑only creative marketplace; subscription‑free at
launch; monetization via take‑rate and usage‑based promotions with
eligibility gates and strict caps; public content limited to
artistic‑only (guest Safe‑Mode on by default); deliverables handled via
external links (Drive/Dropbox) with immutable manifests; escrowed
payments released on acceptance; Instant Book gated by ID verification;
optional background checks confer Trusted Pro; city‑gated rollout with
feature flags; strong Admin Console with least‑privilege, JIT elevation,
two‑person approvals, and immutable audits.

Timeframe & Scope:\
• Applies to all phases; reviewed monthly; ratcheted only after
sustained performance.

Goals:\
• Make phase transitions objective and auditable with clear,
city‑specific thresholds.\
• Avoid premature scaling; unlock hiring and spend based on evidence.

Product Themes:\
• Evidence‑based progress; city‑gated rollouts; fairness and trust
non‑negotiable.

Workstreams & Deliverables:\
• Define phase gates for Alpha, Beta, GA, and city expansions; publish
in Admin; tie to flags.\
• Create board‑level KPI pack (§9.8) with red/yellow/green bands and
owners.

Feature Flags & City Gates:\
• gate.alpha.exit, gate.beta.exit, gate.ga.entry,
gate.city.expand.{city}, gate.promotions.on

Dependencies & Inputs:\
• §5 dashboards; §10 drills; §11 risks; §9 financials; §8 policies.

Top Risks & Mitigations:\
• Threshold myopia; metric gaming; noisy early data; city differences
ignored.

Instrumentation & KPIs:\
• Per phase: S→I, I→B, repeat %, dispute loss, payout latency, IDV %,
Trusted Pro %, promotions ROAS (if on), support SLA, tax variance.

Acceptance Criteria (Go/No‑Go):\
✓ All gates green for the period; no Sev‑0/1; help‑center parity; admin
coverage for edge cases; board sign‑off for expansions.

Staffing & Ownership:\
• City GM, Product, Trust, Finance, SRE, Data --- each signs their gate.

Milestones & Checkpoints:\
• Alpha exit; Beta entry; GA entry; City‑2/3 launches; promotions GA;
studios beta/GA; mobile GA.

§13.0 --- Partnership Strategy & Evaluation Framework

§13.0 --- Partnership Strategy & Evaluation Framework

Partnerships Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document for
partner strategy and ecosystem development. It does not create
commitments. All integrations ship behind flags, follow privacy
policies, and require vendor due diligence, DPAs, SLAs, and legal
review. Commercial terms are illustrative until negotiated.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace at launch; subscription‑free;
monetization via take‑rate and capped, eligibility‑gated usage‑based
promotions. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode on for
guests. Deliverables flow via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with
immutable manifests; escrow releases on acceptance. Instant Book is
gated by ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro).
Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags; Admin Console enforces
least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, immutable audits,
and kill‑switches.

Goals:\
• Define how we choose, integrate, and scale partners without
compromising trust or flexibility.\
• Prioritize partners that accelerate conversion (ACH, IDV), safety (BG,
studios), and differentiation (social metrics, RFPs).\
• Set common legal, security, and commercial patterns to speed
negotiation and onboarding.

Target partner segments:\
• Money stack partners: processors, ACH, tax engines, payout banks.\
• Trust stack partners: ID verification, background checks, e‑signature,
moderation tooling.\
• Discovery & data partners: social platforms, analytics providers,
SEO/media affiliates.\
• Supply partners: verified studios, equipment rental, education
programs, creator communities.\
• Demand partners: brands, agencies, RFP aggregators, small‑business
networks.\
• Workflow partners: file storage (Drive/Dropbox), calendar, chat/Slack,
Zapier‑style automation.

Mutual value proposition:\
• Faster, cheaper, safer transactions → better conversion and margins
(ACH discounts, stable payouts).\
• Higher safety signals → more Instant Book, fewer disputes, better
trust and reviews.\
• Richer discovery (verified social metrics) → better matching, higher
booking value.\
• Lower CAC via co‑marketing (studios, schools, brand networks) →
cheaper city launches.\
• Improved retention via tools users already use (Drive, Dropbox,
Calendar, Slack).

Selection criteria & due diligence:\
• Security posture (SOC, pentest, breach history), data minimization,
token scopes, deletion flows.\
• Commercial flexibility (no exclusivity, volume tiers, credits for
outages, predictable pricing).\
• API quality and rate limits; reliability; sandbox support; SDKs;
webhooks.\
• Legal friendliness (DPAs, FCRA support for BG, clear liability
boundaries).\
• Cultural alignment: creator‑friendly, brand‑safe, responsive support.

Integration scopes & surfaces (what we build):\
• Wallet/payment: card, ACH, refund, payouts; tax quotes; receipts
hooks.\
• Trust: IDV widgets, BG consent flows, FCRA notices; e‑signature for
SOW/releases.\
• Discovery: social platform connects; metrics ingestion; verified
chips.\
• Workflow: Drive/Dropbox file manifests; ICS calendar sync;
Slack/Zapier notifications.

Commercial & legal patterns (illustrative):\
• Standard: pay‑as‑you‑go per‑use fees (IDV/BG); processor % rates; tax
quote per‑call; e‑signature per envelope.\
• Volume tiers after city 2--3; uptime credits; no minimums in year 1 if
possible.\
• Co‑marketing exchanges: logo placement, landing pages, co‑webinars,
city PR mentions.

Enablement & co‑marketing (how we launch together):\
• Technical: feature flags, city allowlists, fallback paths, incident
runbooks.\
• Go‑to‑market: co‑branded pages, case studies, launch kits for
studios/schools/brands.\
• Support & Trust: macros and escalation paths; quarterly business
reviews with vendors.

Top risks & mitigations:\
• Vendor lock‑in; scope creep; privacy risk; cost overrun; PR
misalignment.\
• City‑specific regulatory quirks; rate‑limit throttling; API
regressions.

Operational playbooks (summary):\
• Vendor outage → roll to fallback; banner comms; reconcile later;
post‑incident credits.\
• API change → freeze flag; version pin; contact vendor; hotfix; staged
re‑enable.

Owners & RACI:\
• Head of Partnerships (DRI), Legal, Security/SRE, Product owners
(Money/Trust/Search), City Ops.

KPIs & leading indicators:\
• Partner‑attributed conversion lift; ACH share; IDV completion; Trusted
Pro adoption; studio attach; RFP response rates.\
• Cost‑to‑serve per booking by partner; uptime; incident counts;
co‑marketing leads.

Acceptance criteria (ready / successful when):\
✓ Playbooks and fallback paths tested; DPA/SLA signed; partner flags
live in staging and one city; dashboards attribute lift.

Timeline & checkpoints:\
• Quarterly partner pipeline review; 30‑day pilot → 60‑day evaluation →
GA or deprecate.

Scenario Playbook --- Partner PR misalignment:\
Trigger: Partner promotes explicit content conflicting with our
artistic‑only stance.\
Response: Pause co‑marketing; reassess; require alignment statement;
restrict surfaces if needed.\
Legal/Comms: Neutral public stance; safety‑first messaging; internal
guidance.\
Roll‑back/Forward: Restore surfaces after alignment; otherwise sunset
integration.\
Owner: Head of Partnerships + Trust/Legal \| Telemetry: brand sentiment,
creator complaints \| Evidence: Screenshots, partner campaigns, policy
docs

Implementation Notes:\
• Partner Governance: Maintain a single source of truth for partner
status (prospect, NDA, pilot, GA), contacts, contracts, scopes, and
SLAs. Tag all features behind partner flags and city gates to avoid
blast‑radius mistakes. • Privacy & Data: Apply least‑data
principles---only request scopes needed for the user value; rotate
tokens; revoke access on inactivity. • Security & Audits: Vendor
SOC/pentest reports stored with expiry reminders; incident bridges
pre‑arranged for Sev‑1/Sev‑0. • Co‑Marketing Discipline: Announce after
pilots prove value; enforce clear success metrics; align PR/brand tone
with our artistic‑only policy. • Support & Playbooks: Create
partner‑specific macros; train Support/Trust on integration quirks; log
incidents with partner tags. • Measurement: Attribute partner impact in
§5 dashboards (e.g., ACH share by vendor, IDV completion rate by
provider, studio attach from verified partners). • Contracts: Avoid
exclusivity unless compensated; require termination rights, data
return/delete clauses, and uptime credits for SLA misses. • City
Sequencing: Some partners launch in founding cities only; we gate by
city to manage operational readiness. • Accessibility & Inclusion:
Ensure partner widgets meet WCAG 2.1 AA; provide text alternatives and
keyboard navigation.\
• Ethics & Brand Safety: Decline partners whose practices conflict with
user safety or our policy posture; include an ethics review in intake.

§13.1 --- Payments, Banking & Tax Partners (Processor, ACH, Payouts, Tax
Engine)

§13.1 --- Payments, Banking & Tax Partners (Processor, ACH, Payouts, Tax
Engine)

Partnerships Disclaimer: This is an internal planning document for
partner strategy and ecosystem development. It does not create
commitments. All integrations ship behind flags, follow privacy
policies, and require vendor due diligence, DPAs, SLAs, and legal
review. Commercial terms are illustrative until negotiated.

Context & Alignment: US‑only marketplace at launch; subscription‑free;
monetization via take‑rate and capped, eligibility‑gated usage‑based
promotions. Public content is artistic‑only with Safe‑Mode on for
guests. Deliverables flow via external links (Drive/Dropbox) with
immutable manifests; escrow releases on acceptance. Instant Book is
gated by ID verification; background checks are opt‑in (Trusted Pro).
Rollouts are city‑gated behind feature flags; Admin Console enforces
least‑privilege, JIT elevation, two‑person approvals, immutable audits,
and kill‑switches.

Goals:\
• Stabilize checkout and payouts with best‑in‑class rails; reduce costs
with ACH; keep tax correct with allowlists.\
• Ensure reversibility with multi‑processor readiness and clear
fallbacks.

Target partner segments:\
• Primary processor (card + escrow + payouts); backup processor
(failover).\
• ACH partner (bank linking, returns handling); payout bank for fast
transfers.\
• Tax engine for US‑only allowlists; receipt itemization; refund/credit
memos.

Mutual value proposition:\
• Higher checkout success; lower processor costs via ACH; predictable
payouts improve supply retention.\
• Tax correctness reduces support noise and financial exposure.

Selection criteria & due diligence:\
• Card + 3DS support; dispute webhooks; idempotent APIs; strong uptime
SLAs.\
• ACH verification options (instant + micro‑deposits); returns codes;
fee transparency.\
• Tax engine coverage by state/city; latency; sandbox; post‑outage
reconciliation.

Integration scopes & surfaces (what we build):\
• Checkout: card auth/capture, ACH debit, split fees; escrow ledger;
refunds; receipts.\
• Payouts: bank connect (KYC/KYB); reserves; Early Payout; failure
retry; ledger export.\
• Tax: quote at checkout; amended receipts; deposit taxation for studios
later.

Commercial & legal patterns (illustrative):\
• Interchange‑plus or blended %; ACH per‑debit fee; volume tiers after
City 2; uptime credits.\
• Tax engine per‑call pricing; annual plan negotiated after stability.

Enablement & co‑marketing (how we launch together):\
• Sandbox QA matrices; synthetic test cards and ACH returns; outage
drills; status page hooks.\
• Buyer ACH discount messaging; deposit vs charge line items; daily
close reconciliation playbook.

Top risks & mitigations:\
• Processor outage; ACH returns spike; tax misquote; payout queue
stuck.\
• Vendor lock‑in and unexpected price increases.

Operational playbooks (summary):\
• Switch to fallback processor; prefer ACH; pause promos; reconcile
after.\
• Allowlist bypass for affected state taxes; amend post‑recovery;
transparent user messaging.

Owners & RACI:\
• Payments PM/Eng, Finance, Tax PM, SRE, Support.

KPIs & leading indicators:\
• Checkout success; ACH adoption; payout latency; settlement variance;
tax quote success/latency; dispute win rate.

Acceptance criteria (ready / successful when):\
✓ 14 days of green daily close; staged rollout in one city; outage drill
passed; ACH share ≥ target.

Timeline & checkpoints:\
• Pilot in Houston alpha/beta; enable in Dallas/Austin after GA
stability; quarterly renegotiation checkpoints.

Scenario Playbook --- ACH incentive confusion:\
Trigger: Buyer fee complaints despite ACH link.\
Response: Clarify UI copy; ensure fee reduction applied only on
successful ACH; add help‑center article.\
Legal/Comms: In‑checkout tooltip; follow‑up email, support macro.\
Roll‑back/Forward: N/A\
Owner: Payments PM \| Telemetry: ACH adoption, buyer fee refunds \|
Evidence: Screenshots, receipt diffs, support transcripts
